tastingDescription: 95 Points, James Suckling: “Very energetic, concentrated and powerful flavors of lime and peaches. A wealth of mouthwatering acidity. Superb depth, purity and a long, stony mineral core. Holds long. Try from 2020.” (August 2018)

name: CHABLIS GRAND CRU VALMUR - DOMAINE CHRISTIAN MOREAU 2018
nameSanitized: chablis grand cru valmur - domaine christian moreau 2018
sort: CHABLIS GRAND CRU VALMUR - DOMAINE CHRISTIAN MOREAU 2018
tastingDescription: A Grand Cru with a beautiful clear golden coliur. The nose has great notes of citrus and lemon, and herbs such as fern and linden. The wine has a smooth minerality, the palate is rich, concentrated and fat. The finish has a good length.

tastingDescription: 96 Points, Wine Spectator: "Round and juicy, offering a plush well of cherry, raspberry, tobacco and spice flavors. Vivid, revealing broad, ripe tannins on the finish. Shows terrific length and overall balance, ending with an elegant feel. Best from 2022 through 2040." (November 2017)

name: CHAMBOLLE MUSIGNY 1ER BAUDES - LUCIEN LE MOINE 2017
nameSanitized: chambolle musigny 1er baudes - lucien le moine 2017
sort: CHAMBOLLE MUSIGNY 1ER BAUDES - LUCIEN LE MOINE 2017
tastingDescription: Soil-driven aromas of black raspberry, smoky minerals, wild herbs and pungent black licorice. Then dense and deep but relaxed, with a Chambolle fluidity of texture supported by a firm mineral underpinning. A bit like a softer Bonnes-Mares. This utterly seamless, sedate wine finishes with lovely breadth and nicely buffered tannins.

name: CHAMBOLLE MUSIGNY 1ER COMBE D'ORVEAU - DOM TAUPENOT MERME 17

The 2015s are remarkably fresh, well-balanced and represent clearly the underlying terroir.

name: CHAMBOLLE MUSIGNY VIEILLES VIGNES - GEANTET PANSIOT 2016

name: CHAMDEVILLE - BLANC DE BLANCS BRUT
tastingDescription: A value-priced bubbly Chamdeville Blanc de Blanc has aromas of pear and apple with subtle notes of wild honey and toasted almonds. Made in a fresh style with a creamy palate of brioche, citrus and pear, it is crisp and lively with nice length.

name: CHAMPAGNE AYALA - ROSE MAJEUR
tastingDescription: False

name: CHAMPAGNE LABRUYERE - ANTHOLOGIE GRAND CRU ROSE
nameSanitized: champagne labruyere - anthologie grand cru rose
sort: CHAMPAGNE LABRUYERE - ANTHOLOGIE GRAND CRU ROSE
tastingDescription: Notes of fresh red fruits and cherry-stone with elegant touch of exotic fruits. Crunchy and delicate and, at the same time, round and vinous on the palate with flavours of cherry and redcurrant. Long and generous on the finish.

name: CHAMPAGNE PHILIPONNAT - ROYAL RESERVE ROSE
tastingDescription: 91 points, Vinous: The NV Brut Rosé Royale Réserve is absolutely lovely. Soft, open-knit and inviting, the Rosé Royale Réserve is an ideal wine for drinking now and over the next handful of years. All the elements fall into place effortlessly. The Rosé Royale Réserve is built on a strong core of Pinot Noir that represents 75% of the blend, and is the Pinot that drives both the flavour profile and overall feel. Readers will find a Rosé that will drink equally well as an aperitif or at the dinner table. (November 2020)

name: CHAMPAGNE VINCENT COUCHE - CHARDONNAY DE MONTGUEUX EXTRA-BR
nameSanitized: champagne vincent couche - chardonnay de montgueux extra-br
sort: CHAMPAGNE VINCENT COUCHE - CHARDONNAY DE MONTGUEUX EXTRA-BR
tastingDescription: A Champagne with a pale yellow hue and green tints and a delicate, mineral nose offering white fruits, toast, and fresh pastries. The wine is soft, creamy and fresh on the entry to the palate.

name: CHANDON - CALIFORNIA BRUT
tastingDescription: Expect toasty apple, lemon and mineral notes in this bubbly, all wrapped in a soft brioche bun.

name: CHAPELLE CHAMBERTIN GRAND CRU - BOUCHARD PERE 2016
nameSanitized: chapelle chambertin grand cru - bouchard pere 2016
sort: CHAPELLE CHAMBERTIN GRAND CRU - BOUCHARD PERE 2016
tastingDescription: This is one of the legendary Grands Crus in Gevrey-Chambertin. The appellation dates back to 1155, when the monks from the Abbey of Bèze built a chapel on a piece of land next to the famous Clos-de-Bèze, the gem of their estate. This wine has strength, depth and exceptional finesse.

name: CHARDONNAY -  ARTIUS
tastingDescription: Chardonnay in California reflects the sunshine state that ripens this grape like nowhere else. So hints of tree fruits of apple, tropical notes like pineapple and light butter and spice round out the package. This wine will match dishes like salad courses, pasta, grilled chicken and more.

name: CHARDONNAY - A BY ACACIA CALIFORNIA 2015
tastingDescription: This California Chardonnay is lusciously ripe fruit expression of white peach, ripe pear, Golden Delicious apple, mango and papaya. On the silky palate, nuances of citrus blossoms and minerals meld with vanilla-spice notes from oak aging. Chill and pour it just to sip with friends or to pair with favorite entrées.

name: CHARDONNAY - ALAMOS MENDOZA
tastingDescription: Alamos delivers a nicely balanced and attractive Chardonnay with plenty of roasted nuts, pineapple and citrus atop toasted spice and hints of caramel. It has a creamy texture and a lively finish making it perfect for roasted chicken, almond-crusted halibut, corn chowder or pasta with cream sauce.

name: CHARDONNAY - BANROCK STATION UNWOODED
tastingDescription: Banrock Station Unwooded Chardonnay is a dry, medium-bodied wine with soft fruit-driven flavours of peach, pineapple, melon and ctirus with crisp acidity and a lingering finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - BERINGER BROTHERS BOURBON BARREL AGED 2016
nameSanitized: chardonnay - beringer brothers bourbon barrel aged 2016
sort: CHARDONNAY - BERINGER BROTHERS BOURBON BARREL AGED 2016
tastingDescription: This wine showcases a bouquet of ripe apricot, vanilla bean, and buttered toast. Creamy and mouth-coating, the palate evokes apple pie and vanilla ice cream with caramel coming through on a lingering finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - BERINGER FOUNDERS ESTATE
tastingDescription: This Chardonnay has a perfect combination of pear, apple and ripe tropical fruit flavours, with a hint of citrus. It will perfectly complement a grilled chicken or fish, or stand up to a rich risotto with its ripe, clean flavours and lingering finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - BONTERRA ORGANIC MENDOCINO CTY 2018
tastingDescription: From one of California's most respected organic winemakers, this distinctive Chardonnay is taut and tart, tangy and leesy, with notes of green apple, lemons and pears with hints of bright minerality. Refreshing as an aperitif, it pairs well with scallops, Dungeness crab and apple pie.

name: CHARDONNAY - BOSCHENDAL WESTERN CAPE  2019
tastingDescription: Lively citrus and ripe tropical fruit are counter-balanced by a buttery and creamy mouth feel with hints of oak spice in this Chardonnay

name: CHARDONNAY - BREAD AND BUTTER 2019
tastingDescription: This Chardonnay opens delicately with rich notes of vanilla bean and almond husk, which is reminisecent of a decadent creme brulee.  The creamy notes are balanced by a soft minerality and a hint of tropical fruit.

name: CHARDONNAY - CAKEBREAD CELLARS NAPA
tastingDescription: Bright, creamy, golden apple, white peach, pear and melon aromas, with hints of mineral, yeast and oak spice, introduce rich, full-bodied, apple, pear and melon flavours that persist throughout a lingering finish refreshed by vibrant citrus and mineral tones. Has a round, supple texture, superb concentration, great depth, and balanced acidity.

name: CHARDONNAY - CAMBRIA KATHERINE'S VINEYARD SANTA MARIA 2018
nameSanitized: chardonnay - cambria katherines vineyard santa maria 2018
sort: CHARDONNAY - CAMBRIA KATHERINE'S VINEYARD SANTA MARIA 2018
tastingDescription: 92 points, Wine Spectator - "Lithe and powerful, featuring a vibrant core of apple and peach pastry flavors, with dried tropical fruit accents. Buttery midpalate, delivering a plush finish that lingers with intense spiciness."

name: CHARDONNAY - CHATEAU ST JEAN CALIFORNIA 2016
tastingDescription: This Sonoma County Chardonnay expresses all the elegance and balance Chateau St. Jean is known for. With fruit selected from Sonoma's finest vineyards, this wine features a rich, creamy texture, refreshing acidity, and bright aromas of Meyer lemon, ripe pear, and vanilla.

name: CHARDONNAY - CHATEAU ST JEAN CALIFORNIA 2017
tastingDescription: Wonderfully bright and crisp with aromas and flavors of apple and pear with tropical notes of pineapple topped with lemon and lime zest.  Oak spice notes with hints of hazelnut round out the flavor profile.

name: CHARDONNAY - CHATEAU STE MICHELLE COLUMBIA VLY 2018
nameSanitized: chardonnay - chateau ste michelle columbia vly 2018
sort: CHARDONNAY - CHATEAU STE MICHELLE COLUMBIA VLY 2018
tastingDescription: Bright and jazzy, with pretty pineapple, grapefruit, elderflower and spice flavours that linger on the finish without excess weight. This just floats on for a while.

name: CHARDONNAY - CONCHA Y TORO FRONTERA
tastingDescription: This Chardonnay delivers an intense fruity aroma, with notes of apple, pear, papaya, and pineapple with butter and wood. Refreshing, soft, balanced and slightly sweet, ideal to serve with seafood, white fishes, chicken and pasta with white light sauce.

name: CHARDONNAY - CONO SUR ORGANIC
tastingDescription: Cono Sur Organic Chardonnay is a golden yellow colour with a refreshing, citrusy nose and light mineral notes. This young wine is fresh with well-balanced tropical fruit notes and citrus acidity. Try it with sole or salmon, vegetable soups or passion fruit desserts.

name: CHARDONNAY - CUPCAKE
tastingDescription: A big, rich wine, this full and elegantly-textured Chardonnay has decadent levels of butter, cream, bright citrus and vanilla. These layers melt into a balance of oak and subtle spice. This wine epitomizes the Central Coast's crisp and vibrant Chardonnay character. Serve chilled with crab cakes, seared Ahi tuna on waffle crackers or fresh-baked French bread and cheese.

name: CHARDONNAY - DE BORTOLI THE ASTRONOMER
tastingDescription: Subtle fruit aromas of apples, melons and peaches with a slight hint of vanilla on the nose. Nice creamy texture with medium acidity and moderate length. Nicely balanced and easy drinking.

name: CHARDONNAY - DE WETSHOF ESTATE LIMESTONE HILL
nameSanitized: chardonnay - de wetshof estate limestone hill
sort: CHARDONNAY - DE WETSHOF ESTATE LIMESTONE HILL
tastingDescription: A riveting 2019 unwooded Chardonnay combining a medley of stone-fruit and citrus with an opulent and rewarding palate-weight. The initial notes of lime-zest and honeysuckle lead to a sappy juiciness which is made exhilarating by the electric run of acidity, forming a remarkable complete Chardonnay sensation for an unwooded wine.

name: CHARDONNAY - DEVILS LAIR HONEYBOMB MARGARET RIVER 2018
nameSanitized: chardonnay - devils lair honeybomb margaret river 2018
sort: CHARDONNAY - DEVILS LAIR HONEYBOMB MARGARET RIVER 2018
tastingDescription: This chardonnay is a sumptuous and vibrant expression of modern Margaret River Chardonnay. It is very much in the Devil's Lair style, a subtle textural wine that has a complexity of flavour that evolves and develops in the glass, with no single flavours dominating.

name: CHARDONNAY - DOMAINE DROUHIN ARTHUR DUNDEE HILLS 2019
nameSanitized: chardonnay - domaine drouhin arthur dundee hills 2019
sort: CHARDONNAY - DOMAINE DROUHIN ARTHUR DUNDEE HILLS 2019
tastingDescription: 94 Points, James Suckling: "Baked apples, spiced pears, lemon pie, white flowers, nougat and nutmeg on the nose. It's full-bodied with crisp acidity and seamless, elegant layers of ripe stone and citrus fruit. Hints of stones and blanched almonds to close."

name: CHARDONNAY - EDNA VALLEY CENTRAL COAST 2019
tastingDescription: Edna Valley is a medium-bodied Chardonnay displaying ripe pear and apple with notes of pineapple, butter and vanilla all balanced by fresh acidity.

name: CHARDONNAY - ENIGMA
tastingDescription: False

name: CHARDONNAY - FAMILIA GASCON
tastingDescription: False

name: CHARDONNAY - FETZER
tastingDescription: Pioneers in sustainability, our Chardonnay is a crisp, clean wine with a fruit forward style and layers of flavor. Bright and golden straw in color, there are tropical aromas of pineapple, banana and honeydew with notes of vanilla,lemongrass, hazelnut and clove. This crisp, medium-bodied wine has flavors of citrus, baked apples, melon and pear with a wonderfully lingering finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - FINCA LOS PRIMOS
tastingDescription: Pleasant light peach, citrus, lees, floral aromas. The attack is fresh and round, the palate creamy with light butter, lees, peach, pear skin and baked apple flavours. Clean, easy-sipping style that will go well with food.

name: CHARDONNAY - FLOWERS SONOMA COAST 2019
tastingDescription:
Available on May 29.
"This classy 2018 has notes of musky pineapple, crushed citrus, and white flowers as well as a kiss of salty minerality. It has bright acidity, beautiful balance, and is just a classic, elegant Sonoma Coast Chardonnay that does everything right."
93 points, Jeb Dunnuck

name: CHARDONNAY - FRUIT AND FLOWER
tastingDescription: This Chardonnay boasts ripe pear and apple notes. Citrus blossom and bergamot stand out on the palate followed by a juicy lift from moderate acidity.

name: CHARDONNAY - GEORGE WYNDHAM BIN 222
tastingDescription: Generous and soft on the palate, this wine has lashings of peach, quince and citrus balanced by vanillin oak and creamy flavours. Pairs well with roast chicken and shrimp with a basil pesto sauce.

name: CHARDONNAY - GIANT STEPS YARRA VALLEY
tastingDescription: Made without compromise using 100% handpicked fruit from our estate vineyards. The Yarra Valley Chardonnay is produced with whole bunch pressings, fermentation on full juice solids, wild yeast and fermented entirely in French puncheons. This approach produces highly expressive wines, true to the regional characteristics of the Yarra Valley.

name: CHARDONNAY - GIESEN HAWKES BAY 2017
tastingDescription: 90 points, Wine Enthusiast -"Pale yellow in color, this wine shows notes of flint, salt and seashell along with tangerine, ginger and grapefruit. The palate is texturally rich but is lifted by bright acidity and offers a balanced combo of tangy citrus fruit and toasty oak spice. Drink now." (November 2019)

name: CHARDONNAY - HAMILTON RUSSELL HEMEL EN AARDE VALLEY 2019
nameSanitized: chardonnay - hamilton russell hemel en aarde valley 2019
nameSuffix: HAMILTON RUSSELL HEMEL EN AARDE VALLEY 2019
sort: CHARDONNAY - HAMILTON RUSSELL HEMEL EN AARDE VALLEY 2019
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Greg Sherwood MW: "On the palate there is a feel of density, dry extract, concentration and a really precise harmonious balance with layers of green melon, sweet lime jelly, melted butter and a full glycerol finish with just the faintest hint of butterscotch..." (April 2021)

name: CHARDONNAY - HARDYS VARIETAL RANGE
tastingDescription: This fresh and fruity Chardonnay demonstrates tropical and stone fruit characters of peach, melon and pineapple. The wine bursts with juicy fruit characters of white peach, yellow nectarine and subtle hints of vanillin oak.

name: CHARDONNAY - J LOHR RIVERSTONE
tastingDescription: False

name: CHARDONNAY - J LOHR RIVERSTONE ARROYO SECO MONTEREY 2019
nameSanitized: chardonnay - j lohr riverstone arroyo seco monterey 2019
nameSuffix: J LOHR RIVERSTONE ARROYO SECO MONTEREY 2019
sort: CHARDONNAY - J LOHR RIVERSTONE ARROYO SECO MONTEREY 2019
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine Enthusiast - "This wine starts with plush aromas of yellow melon, plumeria, wild lime sorbet and a hint of cream. There is ample zip to the palate, where acidity and a strong floral character keep the honeydew and white peach flavors in check." (December 2018)

name: CHARDONNAY - JACOB'S CREEK CLASSIC
tastingDescription: Fresh varietal flavours of rockmelon and lemon citrus with attractive creamy nuances, subtle oak and soft acidity that leads to a well balanced fruit driven finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - JACOB'S CREEK DOUBLE BARREL COONAWARRA
nameSanitized: chardonnay - jacobs creek double barrel coonawarra
sort: CHARDONNAY - JACOB'S CREEK DOUBLE BARREL COONAWARRA
tastingDescription: A modern Australian Chardonnay with a unique twist. Crafted in aged Scotch whisky barrels add depth and intensity. With hues of green and vibrant cut straw and aromas of citrus and toast with subtle malty notes which give this complex Chardonnay a lovely rich texture.

name: CHARDONNAY - JOSH CELLARS 2019
tastingDescription: Josh adds to the team with a delicious Chardonnay that sources from Monterery and Mendocino vineyards. Luscious fruit flavours of peach, citrus, tropical abound and make this a great sipper. Pair with your favourite dishes from pasta to salad bowls to salmon.

name: CHARDONNAY - KENDALL JACKSON VINTNERS RESERVE 2019
tastingDescription: 90 points, Wine Enthusiast: “This wine interlaces a lightbuttery-oak nuance with vibrant, appealing fruit flavors. It’s medium weight yet fresh, with a smooth, well-balanced palate that displays a harmonized mix of savory oak and citrus nuances.” (May 2019)

name: CHARDONNAY - KIM CRAWFORD EAST COAST UNOAKED 2019
nameSanitized: chardonnay - kim crawford east coast unoaked 2019
sort: CHARDONNAY - KIM CRAWFORD EAST COAST UNOAKED 2019
tastingDescription: Lifted aromas of citrus and stone fruit open up to notes of tropical fruit and pineapple. An approachable, full-bodied Chardonnay that shows great fruit, length, and persistence. Medium weight with a creamy texture and hints of butterscotch and lemon meringue pie show through in a style uncluttered by oak.

name: CHARDONNAY - KISTLER LES NOISETIERS SONOMA COAST 2019
nameSanitized: chardonnay - kistler les noisetiers sonoma coast 2019
sort: CHARDONNAY - KISTLER LES NOISETIERS SONOMA COAST 2019
tastingDescription:
Available on May 29.
Kistler remains one of the absolute benchmark producers of great Sonoma Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, sitting right up there with the highest quality examples of these grapes from throughout the world. The 2018 Les Noisetiers Chardonnay has a classic balance of layered, juicy fruit and mineral backbone. It is a delicious wine, with white flowers and stone fruit aromatics leading to a full-bodied, juicy core, loaded with flavours of peach, apricots, pineapple and pear.

name: CHARDONNAY - KWV THE VINECRAFTER
tastingDescription: This vibrant Chardonnay shows aromas of peach, pear and lychee with undertones of apple and biscuit. The structure is round and balanced with a refreshingly zesty and lingering finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - LA CREMA SONOMA COAST 2019
tastingDescription: This cool-climate wine is rich and layered with aromas or floral, lemon, green apple, subtle oak, and spice, along with flavors of lemon drop, white stone fruit, yellow plum and honeydew melon. The end result is a richly textured and concentrated wine with balanced acidity that drives a lingering finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - LINDEMANS BIN 65
tastingDescription: A delightful medium-bodied Chardonnay with orchard fruit aromas of white peach and red apple are enveloped by hints of spicy oak, followed by pleasing melon and white peach flavours. The palate is smooth and crisp with a lengthy finish. Try it with creamy cheeses, roasted chicken or fresh seafood.

name: CHARDONNAY - MCGUIGAN THE PLAN
tastingDescription: This is a flavorsome with a soft, smooth creamy palate. It has the great sweet tropical fruit and melon flavours of chardonnay with a touch of vanilla oak. The flavours integrate nicely in the mouth and result in a lingering clean finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - MEIOMI 2017
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Tasting Panel - "Greenish gold color with a ripe nose; clean and sleek; sweet with silky texture and subtle acidity; refreshing, juicy, and long from a winery that balances the best fruit of Sonoma, Monterey, and Santa Barbara counties." (November 2017)

name: CHARDONNAY - MER SOLEIL RESERVE SANTA LUCIA
nameSanitized: chardonnay - mer soleil reserve santa lucia
sort: CHARDONNAY - MER SOLEIL RESERVE SANTA LUCIA
tastingDescription: A rich, buttery mouth feel carries flavours of peach, pineapple, citrus and some nice oak spices in this big Chardonnay with all the trimmings

name: CHARDONNAY - MURPHY GOODE 2019
tastingDescription: A Sonoma winery from 1985, it is now part of the Kendall Jackson group. Then as now the whites are extra 'goode' and here the Chardonnay is about refreshment, apple and citrus hints. So a sipper or with so many food combinations.

name: CHARDONNAY - NAUTILUS ESTATE MARLBOROUGH 2018
tastingDescription: 92 Points, James Suckling - "A very fresh and also ripe and rich chardonnay that offers plenty of ripe peaches and pears in a smooth, fleshy and richly textural style. Grilled cashews and spicy nougat to close. Drink now." (August, 2019)

name: CHARDONNAY - OYSTER BAY MARLBOROUGH 2019
tastingDescription: Subtly oaky, this classic Chardonnay features solid fruit character. Its fragrant, white peach aromas on the nose are followed by tastes of zesty citrus, vibrant green apple and a nice creaminess from some lees stirring.

name: CHARDONNAY - PATO CRIOLLO
tastingDescription: Bright deep yellow with marked green hints. Aromas of floral and citrus notes harmoniously combined with fruit. Sweet entrance, crisp, well-balanced wine of medium body and a persistent finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - PENFOLDS BIN 311 2020
tastingDescription: The Bin 311 style typically exhibits a mineral acid backbone, complemented by barrel fermentation and maturation in seasoned oak. Minimal filtration is employed, preserving elegant fruit flavours.

name: CHARDONNAY - PENFOLDS KOONUNGA HILL
tastingDescription: Koonunga Hill is a light to medium-bodied Chardonnay with stone fruits persist alongside fresh citrus and green apple and just a splashing of honey suckle. Fine and pure with a subtle and soft oak influence finishing with a long, mineral acid structure that gives great length of flavour.

name: CHARDONNAY - PENFOLDS MAX'S
tastingDescription: A soft and delicate mouth coating/laminated acidity fills out the palate and gently conveys the fermented spoils of Adelaide Hills Chardonnay. Showing more of a citrus edge, with lime splice and finger lime sweetness. Enticing teacake sponge flavours varietally laced with finely grated lemon zest.

name: CHARDONNAY - PRECISION WINE CO TECHNIQUE RUSSIAN RIVER 2018
nameSanitized: chardonnay - precision wine co technique russian river 2018
nameSuffix: PRECISION WINE CO TECHNIQUE RUSSIAN RIVER 2018
sort: CHARDONNAY - PRECISION WINE CO TECHNIQUE RUSSIAN RIVER 2018
tastingDescription: Notes of toasted almonds, green apples and Asian pears on the nose.  Rich and creamy on the palette with flavours of apples and stone fruit finishing with lingering notes of Meyer lemon and Creme Brulee.

name: CHARDONNAY - RENMANO CASK
tastingDescription: This Chardonnay offers a classic fruit-driven wine. Melon and pineapple flavours combine with peach and a hint of vanilla from subtle oak.

name: CHARDONNAY - ROBERT MONDAVI PRIVATE SELECTION
tastingDescription: This Chardonnay from the cool Central Coast region has a bouquet of lemons, limes and tropical fruit. Generous acidity, minerality and sweet restrained oak ground the concentrated fruit in the mouth. Round and creamy, it finishes smooth and long. Enjoy with popcorn or step it up with roast chicken or fettuccini Alfredo. Also great to enjoy with friends over appetizers, such as crab cakes or prawn skewers or try it with smoked salmon, grilled chicken, creamy pastas, and stuffed clams.

name: CHARDONNAY - RODNEY STRONG CALIFORNIA CHARDONNAY 2018
tastingDescription: This wine displays aromas of lemon curd and apple with hints of toasty oak and baking spices. The finish is long and lingering with silky notes of fresh pear and pineapple. Enjoy this wine with grilled asparagus, seared tuna with a mango-avocado salsa or an apple and brie grilled cheese.

name: CHARDONNAY - RODNEY STRONG SONOMA CHALK HILL 2017
nameSanitized: chardonnay - rodney strong sonoma chalk hill 2017
sort: CHARDONNAY - RODNEY STRONG SONOMA CHALK HILL 2017
tastingDescription: This is a nice, savoury-style Chardonnay with notes of tropical fruit, lemon butter and some oak spice. It has a beautiful bright acidity to hold it all together

name: CHARDONNAY - ROMBAUER CARNEROS 2019
tastingDescription: 90 Points, James Suckling: "Lemon-curd, ripe-apricot and toasted-hazelnut aromas. It's full-bodied and rich with lots of ripe fruit and praline."  (January 2021)

name: CHARDONNAY - ROSEMOUNT ESTATE
tastingDescription: Bright, fresh arom as of tropical fruits, peach and melon are complemented by hints of toasty oak. A fresh, medium-bodied Chardonnay with a soft, round palate, bright acid, and a long, crisp finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - SLOW PRESS
tastingDescription: Tasting Notes: Monterey County delivers a classic Chardonnay with a toasty finish. The Slow Press winemaking process magnifies fruit aromas and delivers notes of fresh apple, lemon, and pear. Slow Press Chardonnay is aged in American oak barrels for 9 months to develop a full bodied, creamy mouthfeel.

name: CHARDONNAY - SONOMA CUTRER RUSSIAN RIVER RANCHES 2016
nameSanitized: chardonnay - sonoma cutrer russian river ranches 2016
sort: CHARDONNAY - SONOMA CUTRER RUSSIAN RIVER RANCHES 2016
tastingDescription: It opens with scents of Bosc pear and Honeycrisp apple accentuated with notes of nougat, roasted nuts, oak spice and a touch of citrus blossom. True to the Russian River Ranches style, the wine is beautifully focused on the palate with bright acidity and a nicely balanced long, flavourful structure.

name: CHARDONNAY - STERLING NAPA VALLEY 2016
tastingDescription: Aromas and flavors led by a bright citrus character with classic Chardonnay tones of toasted brioche, ripe apple and pear and flan. In the mouth, creamy and filling, with notable acidity and minerality alongside oak spice, subtle caramel and vanilla bean with impressive length and a lingering, memorable finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - STERLING VINTNER'S COLLECTION
tastingDescription: Irresistibly charming, this Chardonnay has gracious California style with vibrant fruit and supple texture. Crisp Gala apple, Bartlett pear and hints of pineapple are layered by lovely pie spices and toasty vanilla notes. The palate is long and round with rich viscosity that comes from partial malolactic fermentation and barrel aging. Clean, ripe citrus flavors extend the finish and add a refreshing lift to the rich fruit.

name: CHARDONNAY - THREE THIEVES CALFORNIA
tastingDescription: Exhibits toasty aromas of spice, peach, apple and pear with notes of mango, sweet oak and butter. The palate is soft, rich and creamy, with flavours of ripe tropical fruit, peach, vanilla and spice on a well-balanced finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - TNT LODI
tastingDescription: Crisp and refreshing style with notes of pear and apple on the nose. A fine balance of citrus and vanilla with pleasant acidity.

name: CHARDONNAY - TOASTED HEAD
tastingDescription: Layered aromas of baked apples, brown sugar, butterscotch, and toasted marshmallows. The palate is a rich display of warm vanilla bean cream, apple caramel custard, and toasted macadamias.

name: CHARDONNAY - TOM GORE 2017
tastingDescription: Pale gold in color, our Chardonnay has intense aromas of pear, citrus, and baked apples. Layers of toasted oak and spice complement the fruit which follows through in the flavor. The wine is full and round with a creamy texture and finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - VASSE FELIX FILIUS MARGARET RIVER 2019
nameSanitized: chardonnay - vasse felix filius margaret river 2019
sort: CHARDONNAY - VASSE FELIX FILIUS MARGARET RIVER 2019
tastingDescription: 92 Points, James Suckling: "This is creamy, fine, pretty and textural showing crushed limestone, nashi pear, sea salt, hints of juniper and a flick of sage. It can't hide its coastal roots; there is a salivating mention of dried kelp and sun-drenched sand in there."

name: CHARDONNAY - VILLA MARIA PRIVATE BIN EAST COAST
nameSanitized: chardonnay - villa maria private bin east coast
nameSuffix: VILLA MARIA PRIVATE BIN EAST COAST
sort: CHARDONNAY - VILLA MARIA PRIVATE BIN EAST COAST
tastingDescription: This wine is fruit driven in style, exhibiting ripe peach with underlying citrus and fig characters. On the palate these flavours are enhanced by a creamy texture and a delicate suggestion of oak. A medium bodied Chardonnay that is styled for enjoyment upon release.

name: CHARDONNAY - WENTE MORNING FOG LIVERMORE 2019
tastingDescription: Crafted in half oak barrel and half stainless steel, this Chardonnay has flavours of green apple, white peach, oak, spice and vanilla. Thanks to the morning fog effect on the vineyard close to San Francisco Bay, this dry wine has a balanced and fresh acidity together with a medium body and a round mouth feel.

name: CHARDONNAY - WILLIAM HILL NORTH COAST 201
tastingDescription: The William Hill Estate North Coast Chardonnay offers aromas and flavours of ripe tree fruit, underscored by hints of brown spice, citrus and tropical fruit. Hailing mostly from Sonoma and Solano, with a touch of fruit from Mendocino, this well-integrated wine has excellent acidity and a creamy mouthfeel.

name: CHARDONNAY - WOLF BLASS YELLOW LABEL
tastingDescription: A generous wine with enticing aromas of stone fruits with hints of gun-flint, and an elegantly structured palate with rich fruit flavours, subtle integrated oak complexity, a soft, creamy texture and a lingering finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - WOODBRIDGE
tastingDescription: The Woodbridge Chardonnay displays aromas of tropical fruit with a hint of cinnamon and maple, leading to a rich, toasty finish. This vibrant, medium-bodied Chardonnay is lovely to pair with appetizers, including grilled summer vegetables and fresh fruits.

name: CHARDONNAY - WYNNS COONAWARRA ESTATE
tastingDescription: Poached pear and stone fruit characters balance the soft natural acidity. Underlying complex barrel ferment characters present an elegant, beautifully balanced Chardonnay that will continue to develop with short-term cellaring.

name: CHARDONNAY - YELLOW TAIL
tastingDescription: This Chardonnay is everything a great wine should be – vibrant, flavoursome, fresh and easy to drink. The perfect balance of citrus and peach flavours coats the mouth with a creamy mouth feel and persists to a long lingering finish.

name: CHARDONNAY - YELLOW TAIL PURE BRIGHT
tastingDescription: This lighter style [yellow tail] Pure Bright Chardonnay has a creamy finish while being silky smooth and easy to drink. Lighter in calories compared to the standard [yellow tail] Chardonnay, but full of flavour with a refreshingly clean finish. It expresses bright notes of peach and melon, along with a hint of vanilla.

name: CHARLES DE CAZANOVE - CUVEE BIO CHAMPAGNE
nameSanitized: charles de cazanove - cuvee bio champagne
sort: CHARLES DE CAZANOVE - CUVEE BIO CHAMPAGNE
tastingDescription: False

name: CHARLES HEIDSIECK - BRUT RESERVE
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Spectator - "Rich hints of toasted brioche and coffee liqueur are layered with black cherry and mandarin orange peel flavors in this creamy Champagne. Fine and satiny on the palate, with lemony acidity refreshing the lingering finish. Drink now through 2021." (November 2018)

name: CHARMES CHABERTIN GRAND CRU - GEANTET PANSIOT 2018
nameSanitized: charmes chabertin grand cru - geantet pansiot 2018
sort: CHARMES CHABERTIN GRAND CRU - GEANTET PANSIOT 2018
tastingDescription: Ripe cherries, red berries, orange peel, earth and subtle wood aromas introduce the 2018 Charmes-Chambertin Grand Cru. On the palate, it is medium- to full-bodied, structured and broad, with flavours of blackberry, bramble leaf, warm spices and a hint of

name: CHARMES CHAMBERTIN GRAND CRU - DOMAINE TAUPENOT MERME 2016
nameSanitized: charmes chambertin grand cru - domaine taupenot merme 2016
sort: CHARMES CHAMBERTIN GRAND CRU - DOMAINE TAUPENOT MERME 2016
tastingDescription: 91-93 Points, Wine Advocate: “The 2016 Charmes-Chambertin Grand Cru has quite a candied bouquet with vivacious red fruit laced with orange blossom and a touch of Earl Grey tea. The palate is medium-bodied with fine tannin... This is a gutsy, generous Charmes-Chambertin... Drink: 2021 - 2038.” (December 2017)

name: CHASSAGNE MONTRACHET - BACHELET RAMONET 2019
tastingDescription: False

name: CHASSAGNE MONTRACHET - BACHELET RAMONET ROUGE 2019
tastingDescription: False

name: CHASSAGNE MONTRACHET - BERTRAND BACHELET BLANC 2018
tastingDescription: False

name: CHASSAGNE MONTRACHET - PHILIPPE COLIN CHARDONNAY 2019
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Wine Enthusiast: ''This is a perfumed, citrusy expression of village-level Chassagne-Montrachet packed with pert, juicy green-apple and Meyer-lemon flavors. While matured in 25% new oak, the fruit-focused wine balances its smokier, spicier intonations well alongside a bristling salty finish. Lovely young, the wine should maintain peak through 2027.'" (December 2021)

name: CHASSAGNE MONTRACHET - PHILIPPE COLIN LES CHENES PINOT NOIR
nameSanitized: chassagne montrachet - philippe colin les chenes pinot noir
nameSuffix: PHILIPPE COLIN LES CHENES PINOT NOIR
sort: CHASSAGNE MONTRACHET - PHILIPPE COLIN LES CHENES PINOT NOIR
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Wine Enthusiast: ''Black currants and red cherries are succulent and soft in this deeply ripe yet elegant Pinot Noir. It's plush and fleshy, but crisply balanced by raspberry acidity and delicate notes of tea leaf, violet petal and crushed graphite. Soft, feathery tannins make the wine welcoming young but it should improve through 2035 and hold further still.'' (December 2021)

name: CHASSAGNE MONTRACHET 1ER CHAUMEES - PHILIPPE COLIN 2019
tastingDescription: 96 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "Green apple and Mirabelle flavors are cutting and pure on the palate of this richly textured, supple wine. While plush in body and undeniably ripe, it has an edge of lemony acidity alongside streaks of crystalline minerality. Voluptuous yet freshly composed, it's delightful young but should fare well through 2030." (December 2021)

name: CHASSAGNE MONTRACHET 1ER MORGEOT - DOM BACHELET RAMONET 2018
nameSanitized: chassagne montrachet 1er morgeot - dom bachelet ramonet 2018
sort: CHASSAGNE MONTRACHET 1ER MORGEOT - DOM BACHELET RAMONET 2018
tastingDescription: False

name: CHATEAU BEAU SEJOUR BECOT 2016
tastingDescription:
“Medium to deep garnet-purple colored, the 2016 Beau-Sejour Becot (80% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon) is just a little closed to begin, opening out to reveal beautiful chocolate-covered cherries, preserved plums and black raspberries scents with touches of stewed tea, tobacco, red roses and cinnamon stick. Full-bodied and jam-packed with perfumed fruit layers, it has a rock-solid frame of ripe, finely grained tannins and layer upon layer of provocative black fruit and savory layers on the finish. Drink: 2020 - 2037.”
95 Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU BELLEGRAVE POMEROL 2016
tastingDescription:
“A rather crisp and lively Pomerol that has some unresolved tannins. With more effusive red-fruit character, this would rate higher. A blend of 75 per cent merlot and 25 per cent cabernet franc. From organically grown grapes.”
90 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU BERLIQUET 2016
tastingDescription:
“Medium to deep garnet-purple in color, the 2016 Berliquet (blended of 75% Merlot and 25% Cabernet Franc) is a little mute to begin, opening out to expressive kirsch, black plums and black cherry compote scents plus nuances of unsmoked cigars and dried herbs. Medium to full-bodied, the palate has fantastic intensity and energy, with a firm frame of ripe, grainy tannins and a lively lift to the mineral-laced finish. Drink: 2020 - 2034.”
93 Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAU BROWN BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 93 Points, James Suckling: “Loads of dried limes, cooked apples and dried lavender. Full-bodied, layered and flavorful. The dried fruits are intense and lively on the finish. Driven white with lots of precise character and energy. Drink now.” (February 2018)

name: CHATEAU BROWN BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“This is vibrant, with a lovely mix of chamomile, acacia and verbena notes out front followed by lemon curd, star fruit and Jonagold apple flavors. Light fennel, salted butter and mineral accents ripple through the finish. Thoroughly delicious. Drink now through 2021.”
93 Points, Wine Spectator

name: CHATEAU CARBONNIEUX BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Lightly herbal, this is a crisp and bright wine. The strong structural element will allow the wine to age, with a textured character and perfumed acidity at the end. Drink from 2022.”
93 Points, Wine Enthusiast
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU CARBONNIEUX ROUGE 2016
tastingDescription:
“Packed with young tannins, this wine shows the structure of the vintage as well as its fresh and perfumed fruit. The combination will develop to produce a restrained and elegant wine. Drink from 2025.”
95 Points, Wine Enthusiast
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU CHASSE SPLEEN 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Chasse-Spleen has a very elegant bouquet with neatly integrated oak, the terroir really showing through here, hints of cedar and smoke emerging with time. The palate is fresh as a button on the entry. It is cut through with a superb line of acidity that engenders superb tension, the tannins firm but fine with a subtle marine influence towards the persistent finish. This is a fabulous Chasse-Spleen, the best I have ever tasted from the estate. Drink: 2021 - 2045.”
92-94 Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU CLIMENS 2010
tastingDescription: False

name: CHATEAU CLIMENS 2015
tastingDescription: 97 Points, Wine Spectator: “Gorgeous, offering a range of orange, almond and brioche notes backed by lively citrus oil, green tea and ginger accents. Rich but tightly coiled nonetheless, with lots of energy lying in reserve on the finish. Needs some time. Best from 2022 through 2045.” (March 2018)

name: CHATEAU CLIMENS 2016
tastingDescription:
“Pale lemon-gold colored, the 2016 Climens is a little youthfully mute, revealing notions of ripe peaches, mango and musk melon with touches of cedar chest, orange blossoms, candied ginger and baking bread. Bursting in the mouth with vibrant, energetic stone fruit and tropical layers, it is framed by fantastic freshness, finishing long and creamy. Drink: 2021 - 2049.”
96+ Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU CLIMENS BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Pale lemon-gold colored, the 2016 Climens is a little youthfully mute, revealing notions of ripe peaches, mango and musk melon with touches of cedar chest, orange blossoms, candied ginger and baking bread. Bursting in the mouth with vibrant, energetic stone fruit and tropical layers, it is framed by fantastic freshness, finishing long and creamy. Drink: 2021 - 2049.”
96+ Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU CORBIN 2016
tastingDescription:
“Blended of 89% Merlot and 11% Cabernet Franc aged in 50% new French oak for 18 months, the medium to deep garnet-purple colored 2016 Corbin has quite a meaty nose with smoked meats and beef drippings over a core of black plum preserves with hints of bay leaves and garrigue. The palate is medium to full-bodied, firm and grainy with a great core of muscular fruit and an earthy finish. Drink: 2021 - 2037.”
93+ Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAU CROIX DE LABRIE 2016
tastingDescription:
“This shows so much violet and dark-berry character on the nose. So enticing. Full-bodied with chewy and polished tannins, blackberries and eucalyptus and a light, menthol note to finish. A rich yet touching wine. Try after 2023.”
96 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU D'ESCURAC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Blackberry, licorice and tar aromas follow through to a full body with chewy tannins and a flavorful finish. A blend of merlot and cabernet sauvignon. Needs a year or two to soften. Drink after 2020.”
91 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU D'YQUEM 2007
tastingDescription: False

name: CHATEAU DE FIEUZAL BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 95 Points, James Suckling: “Some spicy wood on offer with attractive, ripe tropical fruits delivered in a smoothly textured palate that has impressive length and focus. Good concentration. One of the best whites from here in a while. 55% sauvignon and 45% semillon. Drink or hold.” (February 2018)

name: CHATEAU DE FIEUZAL BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Tautly textured, this wine has minerality and a good structure that complements the rich fruits. It is balanced, rich while fresh, structured while packed with fruits. The wine will age well, so wait until 2023.”
95 Points, Wine Enthusiast
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU DE FIEUZAL ROUGE 2016
tastingDescription:
“Very intense red-plum and dark-fleshed peach aromas, plus a hint of pomegranate, make this generous, well-structured Pessac-Léognan red very attractive. However, the full, moderately dry tannins need some time to resolve. Better from 2021, but with a long future ahead of it.”
94 Points, James Suckling
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU DE LA DAUPHINE 2016
tastingDescription:
“This is probably the best wine ever produced at La Dauphine, loaded with brambly fruits and softly-spun minerality, taking it into the top tier of the appellation. They are now at 53ha of vines, making them a significant Right Bank player. Working entirely organically and biodynamically, this year a new plot has been included from up on the limestone plateau that was not historically biodynamic, so they have had to start the process of certification all over again. The blend this year is 85% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Franc.”
92 Points, Decanter

name: CHATEAU DES CHARMES - VIDAL ICEWINE 2017
tastingDescription: A pale straw colour, this classic varietal icewine has a nose of honey, apricot and flowers in full bloom. The palate is mouth coating with sweet grape flavours and a balancing acidity.

name: CHATEAU DOISY DAENE 2016
tastingDescription:
“Pale lemon in color, the 2016 Doisy Daëne leaps from the glass with flamboyant tropical fruit notions of warm pineapple, guava and passion fruit plus hints of lime cordial, fungi, musk perfume and chalk dust. The palate has loads of earthy/savory layers with great concentration and depth, finishing long and lively. Drink: 2019 - 2039.”
94 Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAU DOISY-VEDRINES 2016
tastingDescription:
“The pale lemon colored 2016 Doisy-Vedrines is a little closed to begin, giving way to notes of lemonade, grapefruit, white peaches and yuzu with wafts of ginger, honeycomb and crushed rocks. The palate is wonderfully elegant and refreshing with delicate citrus and mineral layers and a lively citrus lift to the finish. Drink: 2019 - 2036.”
93+ Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAU DU GLANA 2016
tastingDescription:
“Very vivid and juicy with lovely fruit and acidity that gives this wine presence and texture. Much better than the 2015.”
92-93 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU DUHART MILON 2016
tastingDescription:
“I remember how delicious this was at en primeur, and it remains a stately, elongated, perfectly poised Pauillac. It's austere, certainly, but is also full of rich fruit pared down by a slate texture, the sense of minerality scraping along the palate as you approach the blackcurrant leaf and tobacco finish. It's excellent quality, and clearly a vintage that suits the personality of Duhart - juicy but restrained. Matured in 50% new oak. Drink: 2024 - 2040.”
95 Points, Decanter
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU FERRAN 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Ferran is medium garnet-purple colored and reveals beautiful red and black cherries, warm plums and mulberries scents with an earthy undercurrent and a waft of charcuterie. Medium-bodied, it has a wonderfully plush palate with bags of earth-laced fruit and a long minerally finish. Drink: 2019 - 2031.”
91 Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAU FLEUR CARDINALE 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Fleur Cardinale is medium to deep garnet-purple colored and bursts from the glass with crushed blackberries, mulberries and chocolate-covered cherries with hints of spice cake, dried herbs and fragrant soil. The palate is medium to full-bodied and wonderfully elegant with soft, rounded tannins and a great backbone of freshness, finishing perfumed. Drink: 2019 - 2034.”
93 Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAU GRACIA 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Gracia is composed of 70% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon aged in 100% new French oak. Deep garnet-purple in color, it is a little closed at this stage with crushed red and black plums, black cherries, cedar chest, lilacs and truffles plus a waft of violets. The palate is medium to full-bodied, firm, grainy and fresh with minerally notions on the finish. Drink: 2021 - 2044.”
94+ Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU GRAND PUY LACOSTE 2016
tastingDescription:
“A neoclassical edition of Grand-Puy-Lacoste, this has cedar, graphite, deeply integrated cedar and spicy-oak influence and a very fresh array of ripe blackberries, dark cherries and cassis. The palate is so seamless. It builds beautifully and delivers a long, seamless array of perfectly ripe dark fruit, swathed in fine, firm, ascending layers of tannins. As good as we have seen in recent vintages, this is a star of the vintage. Try from 2024.”
97 Points, James Suckling
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU HAUT BERGEY 2016
tastingDescription:
“A silky and delicious wine now with very fine tannins, medium body and berry, wet-earth, lavender and currant character. Drink now or hold.”
92 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU HAUT BERGEY 2016
tastingDescription:
“This broad, lush style is showy, with macadamia nut and warm brioche notes framing the core of meringue, creamed yellow apple and honeysuckle flavors. Wet straw and heather accents underscore the finish. Drink now through 2024.”
92 Points, Wine Spectator

name: CHATEAU HAUT BERGEY BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 92 Points, James Suckling: “Dried-mango and pineapple aromas with hints of apples and lemons. Full-bodied, layered and phenolic with white tannic tension and texture. Drink now or hold.” (February 2018)

name: CHATEAU HAUT BRION 2009
tastingDescription: False

name: CHATEAU HAUT BRION BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 97+ Points, Wine Advocate: “Composed of 69% Sauvignon Blanc and 31% Semillon, the Haut-Brion 2015 Blanc simply sings with melodious notes... The medium to full-bodied palate contributes a compelling steeliness to all those incredible layers, plus a fantastic frame of freshness, finishing with multifaceted mineral and citrus accents... Drink: 2020 - 2045.” (February 2018)

name: CHATEAU HAUT-BRION BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Made up of 70.5% Sauvignon Blanc and 29.5% Sémillon, the Haut-Brion 2016 Blanc is a little closed to begin, the nose slowly revealing notes of orange blossoms, fresh ginger, lime zest and wet pebbles over a core of white peaches, pink grapefruit and lemon curd. Medium-bodied, the palate has fantastic elegance and depth, with layer upon layer of fragrant citrus and stone fruit-inspired flavors and a racy backbone, finishing with epic length. Drink: 2021 - 2038.”
96+ Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU JOANIN BECOT 2016
tastingDescription:
“Aromas of blackberries and blackcurrants. Hints of fresh and wet earth. Full-bodied, very tight and polished with ultra-fine tannins and a beautiful finish. Shows intensity and brightness. Exciting. Top for the appellation. Needs five to six years to come together, but already gorgeous. Better after 2024.”
94 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU LA GARDE BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Beautiful aromas of dried lemons, peaches, and cooked apples. Hints of cream. Lime at the end. Full body, yet agile and very fresh. Bright and electric. Salty undertones. A blend of 86 per cent sauvignon blanc and 14 per cent semillon.”
94 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU LA LOUVIERE BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 92-93 Points, James Suckling: “The clean and fresh sauvignon blanc character jumps out of the glass here with sliced pineapple, grapefruit and orange peel aromas and flavours. Full to medium body, lively acidity and a bright finish. Very pretty.” (April 2016)

name: CHATEAU LA MISSION HAUT BRION 2006
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Wine Spectator: "Almost jammy, with vanilla bean and coffee undertones. Full-bodied and very powerful, with big, juicy tannins and a long finish. Very big and generous for the vintage, showing exceptional quality. Best after 2015." (March 2009)

name: CHATEAU LA MISSION HAUT BRION BLANC 2014
nameSanitized: chateau la mission haut brion blanc 2014
nameSuffix: CHATEAU LA MISSION HAUT BRION BLANC 2014
sort: CHATEAU LA MISSION HAUT BRION BLANC 2014
tastingDescription: 99 Points, James Suckling: “So much lemon, pineapple and green-papaya aromas here. Stones and salt block, too. Full-bodied, dense and layered with a creamy and layered mouthfeel. Powerful and agile at the same time. Exceptional. Rivals the 100-point 2011 La Mission. Drink if you can find it!” (February 2017)

name: CHATEAU LA MISSION HAUT-BRION BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 98 Points, James Suckling: “This is so powerful with incredibly subtle fruit character of pineapple, peaches and apples. Some lees and cream. Full-bodied yet remains agile and tensioned. Wonderful finish. Hard not to drink now. For now or ageing.” (December 2018)

name: CHATEAU LA MISSION HAUT-BRION BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Conditions were a little challenging for the Sémillon this year, and the blend of the La Mission Haut-Brion 2016 Blanc is, unusually, dominated by Sauvignon Blanc (62.7%) with 37.3% Sémillon. It reveals subtle notions of mandarin peel, fresh grapefruit and pineapple with touches of crushed rocks, white peaches and coriander seed. Medium-bodied, the palate has a racy line of freshness cutting through the vibrant citrus and tropical layers, finishing on a lingering mineral note. Considering the challenges, this is a very impressive result! Drink: 2020 - 2035.”
95+ Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 1996
tastingDescription: 98 Points, Wine Advocate: "The bouquet is classic Pauillac with pencil shavings and sous-bois infusing the black fruit, masculine and a little aloof, yet focused and very well delineated. The palate is very well balanced with crisp blackberry and boysenberry fruit. Drink: 2020 - 2050." (October 2016)

name: CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 2009
tastingDescription: False

name: CHATEAU LAFON ROCHET 2016
tastingDescription:
“A sleeper in this vintage, the 2016 Lafon-Rochet is positively stellar. Bright, translucent and super-expressive, the 2016 has so much to offer. Lavender, tobacco, cedar, mint and dried herbs give the 2016 striking aromatic top notes to play off the darker fruit flavors. The 2016 is pure class. Don't miss it. Drink: 2024 - 2041.”
95 Points, Vinous
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU LANESSAN 2016
tastingDescription:
“Currant, lead pencil and fresh rose-petal aromas follow through to a full body, round and nicely chewy tannins and a long finish. Balanced and polished. Drink in 2022.”
93 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU LATOUR MARTILLAC BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Wine Advocate: “... The palate feels crisp and energetic, very linear and taut at the moment but with an impressive, mineral-driven, almost Chenin-like finish with traces of fennel and sunflower seed. This is a superb white Pessac-Léognan that should age with style. Drink: 2020 - 2035.” (February 2018)

name: CHATEAU LATOUR MARTILLAC BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Wine Advocate: “... The palate feels crisp and energetic, very linear and taut at the moment but with an impressive, mineral-driven, almost Chenin-like finish with traces of fennel and sunflower seed. This is a superb white Pessac-Léognan that should age with style. Drink: 2020 - 2035.” (February 2018)

name: CHATEAU LATOUR MARTILLAC BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“This estate, owned by the Kressmann family, is particularly known for its white. Lightly wood aged, this wine is already delicious, boasting great citrus and white fruits, and sure to be delicious. Drink from 2023.”
95 Points, Wine Enthusiast

name: CHATEAU LATOUR MARTILLAC ROUGE 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Latour Martillac is medium to deep garnet-purple in color with warm plums, kirsch and redcurrant jelly on the nose with touches of bay leaves, iron ore and black soil. Medium-bodied with a well-sustained mid-palate of muscular fruit, it has a firm backbone of fine-grained tannins and wonderful freshness, finishing very long. Drink: 2020 - 2037.”
93 Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAU LAVILLE HAUT BRION 2007
tastingDescription: False

name: CHATEAU LE BON PASTEUR 2016
tastingDescription:
“Beautiful plums and ripe cherries with dark chocolate and hazelnut undertones. Full-bodied, juicy and tannic with lots of fruit and structure. The length is long and chewy. A blend of 80 per cent merlot and 20 per cent cabernet franc. Needs at least three to four years to soften. Better from 2022.”
96 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU LES GRANDS CHENES 2016
tastingDescription:
“Very attractive red fruit and spices with a background, tarry edge that leads to a palate that offers ample sweet fruit on first impression with bright acidity and a long, fresh and flavorful, darker-fruit finish. Try from 2021.”
92 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU LES GRANDS CHENES 2016
tastingDescription: False

name: CHATEAU LYNCH MOUSSAS 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Lynch Moussas is a blend of 17% Merlot an 83% Cabernet Sauvignon cropped at 48 hectoliters per hectare between 3 and 19 October. Matured in 60% new oak and the remainder one year old, this has a concentrated bouquet that offers tobacco-infused black fruit, briary and then with aeration, veins of pencil lead. The palate is medium-bodied with firm tannin cloaked in plenty of black fruit, quite spicy for Lynch Moussas with a touch of orange rind developing towards the finish. I appreciate the salinity on the aftertaste here. This is excellent and may well surpass the impressive 2015 last year. Drink: 2022 - 2045.”
92-94 Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAU LYNCH MOUSSAS 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Lynch Moussas is a blend of 17% Merlot an 83% Cabernet Sauvignon cropped at 48 hectoliters per hectare between 3 and 19 October. Matured in 60% new oak and the remainder one year old, this has a concentrated bouquet that offers tobacco-infused black fruit, briary and then with aeration, veins of pencil lead. The palate is medium-bodied with firm tannin cloaked in plenty of black fruit, quite spicy for Lynch Moussas with a touch of orange rind developing towards the finish. I appreciate the salinity on the aftertaste here. This is excellent and may well surpass the impressive 2015 last year. Drink: 2022 - 2045.”
92-94 Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAU MALARTIC LAGRAVIERE 2016
tastingDescription:
“The Bonnie family's estate has produced a richly structured wine, full of the ripe tannins indicative of the vintage. To balance the structure, powerful flavors of black currant and dark berries give ripeness. It is a wine to age; drink after 2026.”
96 Points, Wine Enthusiast
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU MALARTIC LAGRAVIERE BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 95 Points, James Suckling: “Very vibrant lemons and limes with tropical fruit. Hints of mangoes and melon. The palate has silky, sm ooth fruit with seamless build and flow. Impressive. 85% sauvignon and 15% semillon. Drink or hold.” (February 2018)

name: CHATEAU MALARTIC LAGRAVIERE BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 95 Points, James Suckling: “Very vibrant lemons and limes with tropical fruit. Hints of mangoes and melon. The palate has silky, sm ooth fruit with seamless build and flow. Impressive. 85% sauvignon and 15% semillon. Drink or hold.” (February 2018)

name: CHATEAU MALARTIC LAGRAVIERE BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Beautifully wood aged, with subtle hints of spice, this is an elegant, textured wine, ripe with white fruit tones and layered with intense, fresh acidity. Its bright highlights are tempered by warm fruitiness and by the mineral texture that promises aging. Drink from 2023.”
96 Points, Wine Enthusiast
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU MALARTIC LAGRAVIERE BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Beautifully wood aged, with subtle hints of spice, this is an elegant, textured wine, ripe with white fruit tones and layered with intense, fresh acidity. Its bright highlights are tempered by warm fruitiness and by the mineral texture that promises aging. Drink from 2023.”
96 Points, Wine Enthusiast
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU MARGAUX 2016
tastingDescription:
“Deep garnet-purple colored, the 2016 Château Margaux (blended of 94% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Cabernet Franc, 2% Merlot and 1% Petit Verdot) sashays out of the glass with glamorous red currants, candied violets, kirsch and crushed blackcurrants scents followed by notions of tilled black soil, forest floor, cast iron pan and cigar box with subtle wafts of lavender and oolong tea. Medium-bodied, mineral laced accents hover over the palate with an ethereal sensation of weightlessness, yet it is super intense with layers of red and black flavors supported by a firm texture of silt-fine tannins, finishing wonderfully fragrant and incredibly long. Drink: 2024 - 2063.”
99 Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU MARQUIS DE TERME 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Marquis de Terme is a deep, luscious wine, just as it was at en primeur. Dark red cherry, spice, tobacco, licorice and floral notes fill out the wine's layered frame effortlessly. Plush, forward and racy, the 2016 offers quite a bit of immediacy and overall appeal.”
93 Points, Vinous
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU MARSAU 2016
tastingDescription:
“There’s a very bright and ripe array of dark berries and plums with an earthy edge, as well as nuances of sweetly fragrant black truffle. The palate has a very supple and fluid core of ripe dark plums with a very sleek, polished and compressed bed of tannins. Great depth and drive here through the finish. Mouthwatering, pure merlot. Try from 2023.”
94 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU MAUCAILLOU 2016
tastingDescription:
“Very floral and citrusy with raspberry and cherry aromas. Medium body, lively acidity and a fresh and zingy finish. Energetic. A blend of 52 per cent cabernet sauvignon, 41 per cent merlot and seven per cent petit verdot. Try after 2020.”
90 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU MUSAR 2014
tastingDescription: Full-bodied and elegant with an intense aroma of blackcurrant, cherry, raisins, and spices. In the long, rich finish there are notes of cedars of Lebanon and a touch of vanilla. It is a beautifully structured mature vintage.

name: CHATEAU OLIVIER 2015 BLANC
tastingDescription: 94 Points, James Suckling: “Fascinating aromas of hot stones, lemon rind, green pears and green mangoes. Full body and dried citrus and apple flavors. Tight and focused with a savory finish. Very serious white. Drink now or hold.” (February 2018)

name: CHATEAU OLIVIER BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 94 Points, James Suckling: “Fascinating aromas of hot stones, lemon rind, green pears and green mangoes. Full body and dried citrus and apple flavors. Tight and focused with a savory finish. Very serious white. Drink now or hold.” (February 2018)

name: CHATEAU OLIVIER BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“This is a ripe style of wine, rich with white fruits as well as having a more herbal character. Spice from wood aging shows lightly, contrasting with the generous fruitiness and mineral texture. Drink the wine from 2023.”
94 Points, Wine Enthusiast

name: CHATEAU OLIVIER BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“This is a ripe style of wine, rich with white fruits as well as having a more herbal character. Spice from wood aging shows lightly, contrasting with the generous fruitiness and mineral texture. Drink the wine from 2023.”
94 Points, Wine Enthusiast

name: CHATEAU OLIVIER ROUGE 2016
tastingDescription:
“Dense tannins are balanced by equally rich fruit in this wine. It comes from vines around a medieval, moated castle on the edge of Bordeaux city. The wine is full of ripe, juicy blackberry flavors that circle of core of dryness. Both will allow the wine to age well. Drink from 2025.”
95 Points, Wine Enthusiast

name: CHATEAU PESQUIE - TERRASSES AOC VENTOUX ROUGE 2019
nameSanitized: chateau pesquie - terrasses aoc ventoux rouge 2019
sort: CHATEAU PESQUIE - TERRASSES AOC VENTOUX ROUGE 2019
tastingDescription: 91 points, Jeb Dunnuck: "...It offers a rocking bouquet of black cherries, ground pepper, flowers, and violets, with almost marine-like hints in its minerality. Medium to full-bodied, fresh, focused, pure, and with fine tannins, it's another winner from this domaine." (August 2019)

name: CHATEAU PETIT VILLAGE 2016
tastingDescription:
“Attractive slate and stony aromas here with a sense of depth and strongly terroir-focused style. Abundant ripe dark fruit with a suave, plush and very deep-set palate. Long, classic, seamless and powerful Pomerol. Try from 2023.”
96 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU PHELAN SEGUR 2016
tastingDescription:
“Another sleeper from Saint-Estèphe, the 2016 Phélan Ségur is super impressive. An enticing bouquet laced with crushed rocks, graphite, iron, smoke, lavender, mint and inky blue/purplish fruit makes a strong opening statement. A wine of power, resonance and gravitas, the 2016 Phélan is remarkably expressive and also full of potential. Drink: 2024 - 2041.”
94 Points, Vinous
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU POUGET 2016
tastingDescription:
“Currant and condensed berry aromas pop out of the glass. Medium body, soft and silky tannins and a clean and delicate finish. Drink or hold.”
91 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU POUJEAUX 2016
tastingDescription:
“A restrained style, but with a tasty core of juicy plum and red currant fruit that melds with light mulling spice, black tea and sanguine notes. There's a dusting of cedar on the finish. Drink now through 2028.”
91 Points, Wine Spectator

name: CHATEAU QUINTUS ROUGE 2016
tastingDescription:
“This is so beautifully integrated already with dark, stony minerals, slate and graphite, as well as a swathe of ripe blackberries and dark, spicy plums. The palate starts out quite tight and maintains a long, linear shape that pushes deeper and wider into the finish. Regal and velvety on the surface. Profoundly fine and long below. Freshens as it goes, too. Superb. Try from 2023.”
96 Points, James Suckling

name: CHATEAU RIEUSSEC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Pale lemon colored, the 2016 Rieussec comes sashaying out of the glass with a beautiful floral and citrus perfume of orange blossom, pink grapefruit, yuzu, lime leaves, lemongrass and fallen leaves with hints of nutmeg and candied ginger. Having shed a lot of the puppy fat from when I last tasted this from barrel, the palate reveals loads of elegant, tightly wound layers and seamless freshness, finishing long and fragrant. Drink: 2021 - 2050.”
96+ Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAU SMITH HAUT LAFITTE 2016
tastingDescription:
“Composed of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 4% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot and matured in 60% new oak for 18 months, the 2016 Smith Haut Lafitte has a very deep garnet-purple color, opening with sensuous scents of warm black cherries, blackberry pie, star anise and fragrant lilacs with hints of chocolate box, cigar box and pencil lead plus wafts of truffles and crushed rocks. Medium to full-bodied, rich and seductive, it completely fills the palate with perfumed black berry preserves and superbly plush tannins, finishing epically long and beautifully layered. Drink: 2023 - 2046.”
98 Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU SMITH HAUT LAFITTE BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“The Smith Haut Lafitte 2016 Blanc is a blend of 90% Sauvignon Blanc, 5% Sauvignon Gris and 5% Sémillon matured in 50% new oak. It reveals gregarious pineapple and green guava notes giving way to tantalizing fresh grapefruit and green apples scents plus wafts of orange blossom, crushed rocks and honey drizzled peaches. Medium to full-bodied with a gorgeous satiny texture, the palate is jam-packed with tropical and citrus flavors, finishing long and deliciously savory. Drink: 2020 - 2037.”
96 Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU SMITH HAUT LAFITTE BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“The Smith Haut Lafitte 2016 Blanc is a blend of 90% Sauvignon Blanc, 5% Sauvignon Gris and 5% Sémillon matured in 50% new oak. It reveals gregarious pineapple and green guava notes giving way to tantalizing fresh grapefruit and green apples scents plus wafts of orange blossom, crushed rocks and honey drizzled peaches. Medium to full-bodied with a gorgeous satiny texture, the palate is jam-packed with tropical and citrus flavors, finishing long and deliciously savory. Drink: 2020 - 2037.”
96 Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU SOCIANDO MALLET 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Sociando-Mallet has a refulgent purple/black color. It has a very intense and rich, you might say "ambitious" bouquet with layers of small black cherries, blueberry and a touch of sloes, less tertiary than previous vintages and certainly more opulent. The palate is medium-bodied with juicy ripe tannin that almost disguise the firm structure underneath. I admire the completeness of this Sociando-Mallet, the neatly embroidered new oak and the freshness on the finish. The 2015 Sociando-Mallet did not fire on all cylinders last year, but this 2016 is totally convincing. It comes highly recommended as one of the best wines produced at this estate in the northern Médoc. This is an outstanding wine from Mon. Gartreau. Drink: 2022 - 2045.”
92-94 Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAU SUDUIRAUT 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Suduiraut is fabulous. Crème brȗlée, passion fruit, tangerine peel and exotic floral notes all race out of the glass. I marvel at how Suduiraut can deliver so much flavor intensity and yet remain so gracious and classy. The 140 grams of residual sugar are very well integrated. This is such a gorgeous wine. Drink: 2024 - 2046.”
97 Points, Vinous
2 bottle limit

name: CHATEAU VIEILLE CURE 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 La Vieille Cure has a deep garnet-purple color and quite a savory nose of chargrilled meats, tapenade, beef dripping and dried herbs over a core of plum preserves and Black Forest cake. Full-bodied, rich and packed with black plums and savory layers, it has a firm, velvety frame and fantastic length. Drink: 2020 - 2032.”
92 Points, Wine Advocate

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CHATEAU DE BEAUCASTEL 2017
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - chateau de beaucastel 2017
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CHATEAU DE BEAUCASTEL 2017
tastingDescription: Deeply concentrated fruit flavours, an ever-evolving palate and a lengthy finish showcase why Château de Beaucastel is considered a top producer in Châteauneuf-du-Pape

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CHATEAU DE LA GARDINE 2017
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - chateau de la gardine 2017
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CHATEAU DE LA GARDINE 2017
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine Advocate: "La Gardine's 2015 Chateauneuf du Pape is only 50% Grenache, which perhaps accounts for why it shows off more pretty spice notes than cherry fruit. This full-bodied wine's tannins are supple, and the wine draws to a close with echoes of cinnamon and allspice. Drink: 2017 - 2027." (October 2017)

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CLOS DE L'ORATOIRE
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - clos de loratoire
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CLOS DE L'ORATOIRE
tastingDescription: 90-92 Points, Wine Advocate: "...this blend of 65% Grenache, 25% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre is one of the gems in the lineup. Black raspberries, blackberries, cured meats and licorice all emerge from this full-bodied, beautifully textured barrel sample that has first rate purity, ripe tannin and impeccable balance. It should drink nicely through 2025." (October 2016)

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CLOS DE L'ORATOIRE DES PAPES BLANC 201
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - clos de loratoire des papes blanc 201
nameSuffix: CLOS DE L'ORATOIRE DES PAPES BLANC 201
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CLOS DE L'ORATOIRE DES PAPES BLANC 201
tastingDescription: False

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CLOS DE L'ORATOIRE DES PAPES BLANC 201
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - clos de loratoire des papes blanc 201
nameSuffix: CLOS DE L'ORATOIRE DES PAPES BLANC 201
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CLOS DE L'ORATOIRE DES PAPES BLANC 201
tastingDescription: The colour is a beautiful golden yellow with glints of green. The nose expresses the specificity of this wine, with aromas of white fruit. The palate has much presence, is very fruity, with finesse, breadth and sweetness, but retaining a good balance of freshness.

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CLOS DES PAPES 2019
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - clos des papes 2019
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - CLOS DES PAPES 2019
tastingDescription: 95 points, Joe Czerwinski - "Bursting with striking red-fruit aromas and delicate cinnamon, clove and star anise notes, the 2018 Clos des Papes is another terrific vintage from this estate.  While certainly full-bodied and powerful, it's also lithe and silky, with an airy feel on the palate that translates into great elegance on the lengthy finish.  Drink 2020-2030.  Wine Advocate. (September, 2020)

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - DOMAINE DE BEAURENARD 2018
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - domaine de beaurenard 2018
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - DOMAINE DE BEAURENARD 2018
tastingDescription: False

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - DOMAINE DE BEAURENARD BOISRENARD 2016
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - domaine de beaurenard boisrenard 2016
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - DOMAINE DE BEAURENARD BOISRENARD 2016
tastingDescription: 96 Points, Wine Advocate: "Inky in color, with aromas that hint at toasted coconut, black cherries and chocolate. It's a rich, decadent, full-bodied sexpot of a CdP that possess admirable concentration, a wonderfully creamy-silky texture and a long, long finish." (August 2019)

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - DOMAINE DE CRISTIA VIEILLES VIGNES 17
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - domaine de cristia vieilles vignes 17
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - DOMAINE DE CRISTIA VIEILLES VIGNES 17
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Robert Parker's The Wine Advocate - "Possessing more concentration and richness than the other Cristia cuvees, the 2017 Chateauneuf du Pape Vieilles Vignes - sourced from 95-year-old Grenache vines in the Cristia lieu-dit-combines hints of cedar and vanilla from the barrels in which it matured with ripe raspberries and black cherries. Full-bodied and intensely flavored, it delivers those things without any sense of heaviness, remaining fresh, silky and elegant from boldly aromatic start to long, nuanced finish. Yum! (September, 2020).

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - DOMAINE DUSEIGNEUR CATARINA 2018
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - domaine duseigneur catarina 2018
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - DOMAINE DUSEIGNEUR CATARINA 2018
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Joe Czerwinski, Wine Advocate - "The certified organic and biodynamic 2018 Catarina is 90% Grenache, 10% Syrah ... Fermented in tank and matured in older demi-muids, it shows vibrant resberry and cherry fruit on the nose, underscored by hints of garrigue and crushed stone. Medium to full-bodied, it's ripe and silky in feel but not overly rich or round, making less of a cocktail wine than some, and easier to pair with food." (October, 2020)

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - DOMAINE LA BARROCHE JULIEN BARROT 2018
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - domaine la barroche julien barrot 2018
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - DOMAINE LA BARROCHE JULIEN BARROT 2018
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Jeb Dunnuck, Wine Advodate - "The [2018] cuvee from the young, passionate (and incredibly talented) Julien Barrot ... has a great nose of red and black raspberries, framboise, spring flowers, and peppery garrigue. Medium to full-bodied, it displays a notable sense of elegance and purity, light yet present tannins, and a great finish ..." (October 2020).

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - LA FIOLE DU PAPE
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - la fiole du pape
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - LA FIOLE DU PAPE
tastingDescription: This medium- to full- bodied wine is ready for most occasions with flavours of cassis, candied cherry, dark plum, tobacco leaf, herbal notes and well- integrated tannins

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - LE VIEUX DONJON 17/18
nameSanitized: chateauneuf du pape - le vieux donjon 17/18
sort: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - LE VIEUX DONJON 17/18
tastingDescription: 95 points, Joe Czerwinski, Wine Advocate - This full-bodied wine is produced from 7 Rhone grape varietals. "This is a beautiful Vieux Donjon. The 2018 is rich amd mouth-filling, concentrated and velvety, with plenty of power. Ripe cherries, raspberries and cloves with hints of leather and cocoa on the long, intense finish. Drink 2020-2033." (September, 2020)

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE - VIEUX LAZARET 2016
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Spectator: "Alluring, with flow to the cassis, cherry compote and raspberry coulis flavors, backed by light rooibos tea, tobacco and dried blood orange accents. The silky finish is sneaky long, offering a light sanguine echo. Drink now through 2025." (October 2018)

name: CHATEAUNEUF DU PAPE BLANC - BEAUCASTEL 2019
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Wine Spectator - "A gorgeously rendered hedonists' delight, with creamed melon, peach, apricot and quince flavors that glide along, supported by subtle ginger, hazelnut and piecrust notes. The long, lush finish has fruit for days. Drink now through 2020." (November 2016)

name: CHATEAUNEUF-DU PAPE - SANTA DUC LES SAINTES VIERGES SINGLE

name: CHATEAUX BROWN ROUGE 2016
tastingDescription:
“A solid, slightly robust style, with waves of dark currant and blackberry paste flavors rolling through, underscored by tar, alder and sweet tobacco notes. A bramble accent is buried deep on the finish, while the tobacco edge lingers. Best from 2023 through 2032.”
92 Points, Wine Spectator

name: CHECKMATE - BLACK ROOK MERLOT 2016
tastingDescription: False

name: CHECKMATE - END GAME MERLOT 2016
tastingDescription: False

name: CHECKMATE - KNIGHT'S CHALLENGE CHARDONNAY 2017

name: CHECKMATE - QUEEN TAKEN CHARDONNAY 2017
