name: CHENAS - PASCAL AUFRANC VIGNES DE 1939 2016
tastingDescription: False

name: CHENIN BLANC - KEN FORRESTER OLD VINE RES STELLENBOSCH
nameSanitized: chenin blanc - ken forrester old vine res stellenbosch
nameSuffix: KEN FORRESTER OLD VINE RES STELLENBOSCH
sort: CHENIN BLANC - KEN FORRESTER OLD VINE RES STELLENBOSCH
tastingDescription: 90 Points, James Suckling - "A pleasing white with lots of character, from dried apples to peaches, following through to a medium body. A fruity and juicy finish. Drink now." (June 2018)

name: CHENIN BLANC - ROBERTSON
tastingDescription: This wine punches above its weight in the value sector by offering layers of fruit and balanced acid on a medium bodied and refreshing palate. Expect a nose that offers aromas of pear, honey and herbs and a palate that is laden with pear, honey and citrus fruit followed by a fresh finish - perfect for pairing patio side

name: CHENIN BLANC - RUPERT WINES PROTEA
tastingDescription: Green apricot, pear drop and tangerine fruit aromas vie for prominence on a somewhat shy nose. Appealing in its refreshing vibrancy, the mouth has ample tangy, crisp and lively nectarine and apricot flavours. The mid-palate is fleshed out by a gentle leesy fullness that adds an extra dimension as well as length.

name: CHENIN BLANC - SCATTERED EARTH
tastingDescription: This wine is a great example of modern-styled, South African Chenin blanc and shows true elegance.  It displays prominent aromas of guava, lime and ripe melon.  The palate is vibrant and fresh with a linear acidity and an enduring finish.

name: CHENIN BLANC - SPIER SIGNATURE
tastingDescription: This lively wine boasts a rich bouquet of melon, grapefruit and tropical fruit flavours with a lemon-edged, mineral acidity.

name: CHENIN BLANC - T & V CAREME TERRE BRULEE LE BLANC 2018
nameSanitized: chenin blanc - t & v careme terre brulee le blanc 2018
nameSuffix: T & V CAREME TERRE BRULEE LE BLANC 2018
sort: CHENIN BLANC - T & V CAREME TERRE BRULEE LE BLANC 2018
tastingDescription: A crowd pleasing Chenin Blanc for any occasion, this lush bottling delivers notes of honeysuckle and citrus which are balanced by a bright, seamless acidity.

name: CHENIN BLANC - WILD OLIVE OLD VINES SWARTLAND
nameSanitized: chenin blanc - wild olive old vines swartland
sort: CHENIN BLANC - WILD OLIVE OLD VINES SWARTLAND
tastingDescription: A refined and well-balanced Chenin Blanc with notes of peach and apricot and citrus and matures to include hints of almond and honey. The finish is long and shows an elegant minerality. Enjoy by the glass, or pair with light fare such as fish, shellfish, white meats and salads. Drink now.

name: CHENIN BLANC SEMILLON - JUST NUISANCE
tastingDescription: False

name: CHERRY POINT - COWICHAN BLACKBERRY
tastingDescription: This rich dessert wine is produced from luscious wild blackberries growing alongside the local river estuary. The intense flavour of tangy, fresh blackberries and the warm finish reflect the warmth of the Cowichan Valley summer. This makes a great sweet finish to any meal.

name: CHEVALIER MONTRACHET GRAND CRU - PHILIPPE COLIN 2019
nameSanitized: chevalier montrachet grand cru - philippe colin 2019
sort: CHEVALIER MONTRACHET GRAND CRU - PHILIPPE COLIN 2019
tastingDescription: 98 points, Wine Enthusiast: ''From the flagship vineyard of an exceptionally terroir-focused producer, this spicy, smoky sip offers the seduction of French oak alongside piercing lemon, white peach and even pineapple flavors. Creamy and silk-tipped yet vital and translucent, it's everything you could ask of Grand Cru white Burgundy in such a ripe vintage. Irresistible young, the wine should continue to gain complexity through 2035.'' (December 2021)

name: CHIANT CLASSICO - CECCHI STORIA DI FAMIGLIA 2016
nameSanitized: chiant classico - cecchi storia di famiglia 2016
sort: CHIANT CLASSICO - CECCHI STORIA DI FAMIGLIA 2016
tastingDescription: The main grape is Sangiovese. Red ruby tending to garnet with aging, fine nose, the taste is intense and persistent, its structure is large and with a great balance.

name: CHIANTI - CECCHI
tastingDescription: Balanced, firmly structured, plush mouthfeel, with notes reminiscent of cherry, blueberry and plum. Intense aromas of fresh fruit and a hint of spices. A versatile wine, suitable for an aperitif with friends through to dinner with the family.

name: CHIANTI - FONTELLA
tastingDescription: Ruby red, with a typical Chianti nose, smooth, medium-bodied palate, with an attractive lingering finish. Thanks to its acidity, it is a perfect match with rich, fatty dishes. Wonderful with Spaghetti al pomodoro or pizza. Try it with a nice Fiorentina steak with crude olive oil.

name: CHIANTI - FRESCOBALDI CASTIGLIONI
tastingDescription: Delightful fruity aromas of cherry, blackcurrant and raspberry immediately emerge on the nose, followed by floral and fragrant notes such as violets. On the palate, Chianti Castiglioni is lively, soft and enveloping. The finish is long and persistent, with the aftertaste confirming the fruity aromas previously detected on the nose.

name: CHIANTI - GABBIANO CAVALIERE D'ORO
tastingDescription: This Chianti starts with wafting aromas of beef, cherries, earth, and minerals before caressing the palate with warm and enticing flavours of aged steak cooked rare, dusty cherries and slight note of green olive. A hint of tannic astringency on the finish reveals a structure that would benefit food. This is a good value, medium- to full-bodied wine that's perfect for mid-week pizza.

name: CHIANTI - RUFFINO
tastingDescription: Floral notes of violet on the nose lead to fruity flavours of plum, sweet cherry and a lightly spicy finish.  Medium-bodied, this red shows fresh fruit on the finish. Spaghetti loves this wine for it's affinity to pair with tomato based sauces.

name: CHIANTI - VICCHIO LE CALVANE QUERCIONE 2016
tastingDescription: On the palate, it is very smooth, warm and polished. Delicately structured wine with suave tannis and good acidity. Pairs well with simple fair like pizza and pasta.

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - ANTINORI PEPPOLI 2018
tastingDescription: 91 Points, James Suckling: “A Chianti Classico that shows dark plums, raspberries and hints of crushed cherries. Medium body, ripe tannins and a crisp finish. Drink now.” (July 2018)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - CAROBBIO 2015
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Falstaff - The 2015 Chianti Classico Carobbio is an extremely elegant and refined wine made from Sangiovese grape and due to its excellent drinkability and intense overtones of red fruits, this wine is spices and violet highlights aroma, dry, full bodied, soft tannins and well balanced.

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - CASTELLO DI AMA AMA
nameSanitized: chianti classico - castello di ama ama
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO - CASTELLO DI AMA AMA
tastingDescription: False

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - FONTODI 2018
tastingDescription: 95 Points, James Suckling: “The purity of fruit here really makes an impression on you. The nose shines with freshly picked blackcurrants, dark plums, freshly cut herbs, cinnamon, raspberry cheesecake, glazed cherries, orange and lemon rind. The palate is so well-crafted with a silky ball of tannins surrounded by layers of blue and red fruit and enveloping acidity. A long finish. From organically grown grapes.” (June 2018)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - GABBIANO CAVALIERE D'ORO 2019
tastingDescription: Made with 90% Sangiovese, 5% Merlot and 5% Colorino, this juicy wine opens with aromas of blue flower, black-skinned berry and a whiff of tobacco. The savory palate doles out Marasca cherry, licorice and black pepper alongside velvety tannins. Enjoy over the next few years.

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - ISOLE E OLENA 2018
tastingDescription: 93 Points, James Suckling: "This is a really authentic and beautiful Chianti Classico, offering cherries, orange peel and light undertones of nuts and bark. It's medium-bodied, very polished and integrated with a fresh, juicy finish. Drink now." (July 15, 2021)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - ISTINE
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Vinous: "The 2018 Chianti Classico is bright and racy, with tons of Radda Sangiovese character. Red berry fruit, flowers, chalk and white pepper all grace this super-expressive, translucent Chianti Classico. The 2018 is a bit airy and taut, but that is also a big part of its appeal." (September 2020)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - RICASOLI BROLIO 2018
tastingDescription: 92 Points, James Suckling:  "Lovely, pure fruit to this with light, polished tannins, medium body and a pretty, cherry and strawberry aftertaste." June 2020

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - ROCCA DELLE MACIE 2017
tastingDescription: Intense and persistent bouquet with hints of wild berries that combine well with the aromas released by the wood of the barrels. Savoury and full bodied, it highlights the exceptional persistence of the bouquet.

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - ROCCA DI MONTEGROSSI ORGANIC 2019
nameSanitized: chianti classico - rocca di montegrossi organic 2019
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO - ROCCA DI MONTEGROSSI ORGANIC 2019
tastingDescription: 90+ points, Vinous - “Super-ripe dark plum, espresso, spice and licorice all race out of the glass.” (August, 2019)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - SAN FABIANO CALCINAIA ORGANIC 2018
nameSanitized: chianti classico - san fabiano calcinaia organic 2018
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO - SAN FABIANO CALCINAIA ORGANIC 2018
tastingDescription: 92 Points, James Suckling  - "Chianti Classico with some dark-plum and black-cherry character. Medium to full body. Slight tough feel at the end. From organically grown grapes. Needs a couple of years to soften. Try after 2021." (Aug 2020)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO - SAN FELICE 2018
tastingDescription: Luminous ruby red. Scents of cherry, raspberry, and sweet violets. Dry on the palate, showing subtle tannins and a fresh, crisp acidity. At its best when partnered with antipasti, full-flavoured first courses and most red meats.

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SEL - CASTELLO DI AMA SAN LORENZO 2016

sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SEL - CASTELLO DI AMA SAN LORENZO 2016
tastingDescription: 95 Points, James Suckling: “Tight and super silky with a gorgeous density and precision that gives great polish to the tannins. Makes them almost dusty. Lots of subtle dark berry, mineral and spice. Drink or hold.” (August 2016)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SEL - MAZZEI CASTELLO FONTERUTOLI 2015
nameSanitized: chianti classico gran sel - mazzei castello fonterutoli 2015
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SEL - MAZZEI CASTELLO FONTERUTOLI 2015

sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SELEZIONE - FELSINA COLONIA

tastingDescription: 94 Points, James Suckling: “Lots of ripe fruit with chocolate and walnut undertones. Full body, velvety tannins and a flavorful finish. Structured and powerful. Drink or hold.” (August 2016)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SELEZIONE - RICASOLI RONCICONE
nameSanitized: chianti classico gran selezione - ricasoli roncicone
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SELEZIONE - RICASOLI RONCICONE
tastingDescription: 95 Points, James Suckling: "This is so perfumed - the red fruit and flowers just jump out of the glass. So aromatic. Full-bodied, yet the precise, fine tannins just melt into the glass and spread wide across the palate. A gorgeous wine. Drink or hold." (June 2020)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SELEZIONE - RUFFINO RIS DUCALE ORO 14
nameSanitized: chianti classico gran selezione - ruffino ris ducale oro 14
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SELEZIONE - RUFFINO RIS DUCALE ORO 14
tastingDescription: 93 Points, James Suckling: “A lovely and juicy Chianti Classico with berry, dried fruit, black truffle and chocolate. Full body, soft and velvety tannins and a flavorful finish. Class with tradition. Drink now or hold.” (October 2017)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SELEZIONE - RUFFINO ROMITORIO DI SANTE
nameSanitized: chianti classico gran selezione - ruffino romitorio di sante
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SELEZIONE - RUFFINO ROMITORIO DI SANTE
tastingDescription: Ruby red with garnet hues. The wine expresses a distinctive Tuscan bouquet of violet, cherry, and plum, with aromas of chocolate and spice. Intense aromas of violet, blackberry, cherry, and ripe plum with intriguing notes of cinnamon and clove. Classic elegance and structure in which the fruit, tannins, and spices form a tightly woven balance, with a lingering finish of chocolate and coffee.

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SELEZIONE - SAN FABIANO CALCINAIA ORGA
nameSanitized: chianti classico gran selezione - san fabiano calcinaia orga
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SELEZIONE - SAN FABIANO CALCINAIA ORGA
tastingDescription: 93 Points, James Suckling - “Firm and structured with blueberry and chocolate aromas and flavors. Full body, tight and tannic finish. Needs two or three years to soften. Made from organic grapes.” (October 2017)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SELEZIONE - SAN FELICE IL GRIGIO 2015
nameSanitized: chianti classico gran selezione - san felice il grigio 2015
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAN SELEZIONE - SAN FELICE IL GRIGIO 2015
tastingDescription: 95 points, Wine Enthuasist - "Inviting aromas of ripe red-skinned fruit, baking spice, new leather, scorched earth and a whiff of tobacco fill the glass. Smooth and elegant, it boasts an almost weightless concentration, doling out ripe Morello cherry, star anise, black raspberry and white pepper alongside taut, velvety tannins." (April 2019)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAND SELEZIONE - CASTELLO DI MONSANTO 2015
nameSanitized: chianti classico grand selezione - castello di monsanto 2015
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO GRAND SELEZIONE - CASTELLO DI MONSANTO 2015
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Antonio Galloni's, Vinous - "The 2015 Chianti Classico Gran Selezione Vigna il Poggio is a beautiful and compelling wine. High-toned floral and savory notes emerge first, with plenty of sage, cedar, sweet pipe tobacco and crushed rose petal aromatics. Pliant and open, the 2015 is already quite showy. It will drink well with minimal cellaring. In fact, it's already pretty expressive. The one thing I would do is open it well in advance to allow some youthful Sangiovese funkiness to blow off."  (September, 2020)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - ANTINORI VILLA ANTINORI 2016
nameSanitized: chianti classico riserva - antinori villa antinori 2016
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - ANTINORI VILLA ANTINORI 2016
tastingDescription: 92 Points, James Suckling: "A red with attractive blackberry and licorice aromas and flavors. Some tar. Medium body, light tannins and a delicious finish. Drink now." (November 2019)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - BADIA A COLTIBUONO
nameSanitized: chianti classico riserva - badia a coltibuono
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - BADIA A COLTIBUONO
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Advocate: "A graceful and elegantly tempered red wine...traditional Sangiovese: the complexity and elegance of the grape and that fresh acidity. It opens to a mid-weight style... Pretty mineral notes appear on the close, and the tannin is beautifully integrated". (September, 2019).

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - CAROBBIO 2013
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Advocate: “Svelte and velvety, the 2013 Chianti Classico Riserva shows generous dark fruit and rich textural finesse. There is an unexpected level of softness here with sweet touches of blue violets and pressed rose. This wine delivers the kind of plush intensity that would make a good match to pork or lamb. Drink: 2017 - 2026.” (December 2016)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - CASTELLO DI VOLPAIA COLTASSALA 16
nameSanitized: chianti classico riserva - castello di volpaia coltassala 16
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - CASTELLO DI VOLPAIA COLTASSALA 16
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Wine Spectator - "Piercing aromas of black currant, blackberry, violet and stone are augmented by earth, tobacco and underbrush flavors. A powerful red, with a muscular structure and a long finish." (January 2020).

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - FELSINA BERARDENGA 2017
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine Advocate: “The 2013 Chianti Classico Riserva Berardenga is a little more evolved and aged than anticipated. The wine opens to dark fruit, plum, prune, dried cherry, savory spice and pipe tobacco. The apparent lack of primary fruit is surprising given the cooler climate in 2013... Drink: 2017 - 2025.” (December 2016)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - GABBIANO
tastingDescription: Crafted from exceptional parcels from estate vineyards - a deep, ruby red color, this wine offers lovely red fruity notes coming led with hints of strawberries, citrus and tobacco. Same flavors extend to the fruit-filled palate with additional earthy and spicy notes, firm tannins balanced by fresh acidity and good complexity.

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - ISTINE LEVIGNE
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Decanter: "Rather than being a superior expression to the single vineyard bottlings of these, Istine's Riserva is a panorama of the three. The 2016 is initially discreet in aromas with subtle spring blossom, cherry and flint building in the glass. Iron and balsamic nuances join in on the palate. Shyly seductive and savoury, this allies great depth of fruit and clayey tannins with Sangiovese's fabulous lightness of being." (March 2020)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - LAMOLE DI LAMOLE 2014
nameSanitized: chianti classico riserva - lamole di lamole 2014
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - LAMOLE DI LAMOLE 2014
tastingDescription: 90 Points, James Suckling: “Light aromas of strawberries, dark chocolate and cinnamon. Medium to full body, juicy tannins and a lively finish. Drink now.” (July 2018)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - MAZZEI SER LAPO 2015
nameSanitized: chianti classico riserva - mazzei ser lapo 2015
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - MAZZEI SER LAPO 2015
tastingDescription: 95 Points, James Suckling: “There’s cedar and tobacco here, but it’s backed up with lovely, fresh wild strawberries, raspberry cheesecake and redcurrants. Full body, polished tannins and beautifully linear acidity. Finishes long and elegantly. Drink now.” (July 2018)

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - RUFFINO RISERVA DUCALE 2017
nameSanitized: chianti classico riserva - ruffino riserva ducale 2017
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - RUFFINO RISERVA DUCALE 2017
tastingDescription: This ruby red blend is aged for 24 months before bottling. The bouquet is elegant, characterized by violet, cherries, wild berries and plums along with hints of tobacco and white pepper. Fragrant fresh fruit in the mouth is accompanied by firm yet gentle tannins and by a pleasant minerality and notes of rosemary.

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - RUFFINO RISERVA DUCALE ORO 1988
nameSanitized: chianti classico riserva - ruffino riserva ducale oro 1988
sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - RUFFINO RISERVA DUCALE ORO 1988
tastingDescription: The 1988 Riserva Ducale Oro Chianti Classico Riserva is still fresh with aromas of cedar and caramel followed by a swirl of coffee, dark chocolate, red cherry and a little pepper and lemon zest on the finish.

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - SAN FELICE IL GRIGIO 2016

sort: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - SAN FELICE IL GRIGIO 2016

name: CHIANTI CLASSICO RISERVA - SAN FELICE POGGIO ROSSO

The lithe, elegant palate offers juicy red cherry, crushed red raspberry, cinnamon and star anise flavors framed by polished tannins and vibrant acidity. An outstanding performance for a cool, difficult vintage. Enjoy 2019–2024.” (July 2018)

name: CHILEAN RED - CLOS APALTA COLCHAGUA 2015
tastingDescription: 100 Points, James Suckling: “There is a subtle complexity on the nose with currant, berry, fresh herb and wet earth aromas. Cut fresh flowers, too. Full body, dense and powerful. Incredible character here with such purity and polish. It goes on for minutes. Formed, sculptured yet soulful. A monumental wine for Chile. Unbelievable… Better in 2022.” (February 2018)

name: CHILEAN RED - CLOS APALTA COLCHAGUA 2017
tastingDescription:
What a stunning nose of crushed berries, fresh flowers, sandalwood and light vineyard dust. Black olives, too. Very complex. Full-bodied with a beautiful, dense palate of blackberries, chocolate, walnuts and cigar box. Fantastic length and composure. The tannin just rolls over the palate. Very structured. The most classically structured wine ever from here. Goes on for minutes. Outrageous and so polished.
100 pts, James Suckling

name: CHILEAN RED - CONO SUR BICICLETA
tastingDescription: "This flavourful red blend is mostly Cabernet Sauvignon with Merlot and other reds to smooth it out. Look for currant fruit and plums, red berries and light tannins.  Will go with all kinds of menu and occasions. Enjoy."

tastingDescription: Deep red with violet tones. The nose presents intense aromas of black and red fruits such as plums, blueberries, and cherries intermingled with fresh notes recalling bay leaf, cedar. Juicy on the palate with round tannins that lend good structure and volume and a long, and elegant finish.

A wine of intense color with violet hues, with notes of red fruit and great elegance. In the mouth it is smooth and its acidity enhances the fruity flavors, giving a long, pleasant finish. 60% Merlot, 33% Shiraz, 5% Tempranillo and 2% Viognier.

name: CHILEAN RED - SEN 2019
tastingDescription: More great value from Chile. Using Cabernet Sauvignon, Pais and other red varietals, this is a fruit forward red to go with all kinds of menu.

name: CHILEAN RED - SENA ACONCAGUA 2016
tastingDescription: 98 Points, James Suckling: “Aromas are lifted and bright in this wine with loads of blackberries and blueberries. Full body, velvety tannins. Gorgeous texture. Very pure fruit. A bright and more fundamental Seña than last vintages. Restrained at the end. 55% cabernet, 20% malbec, 12% petit verdot, 8% carmenere, 5% cabernet franc.” (February 2018)

Dry, with high acidity, moderate, balanced tannins, medium body, crunchy with youthful red and black fruit flavours in a medium long finish. Meant for early drinking within 5 years. Great with charcuterie, poultry, Mediterranean cuisine.

name: CHIROUBLES - STEEVE CHARVET 2018
tastingDescription: Adorned with a deep ruby red color, the Chiroubles 2015 from Steeve Charvet reveals intense aromas of black fruit and spice, with round and juicy tannins. Very well-balanced on the palate with a long, satisfying finish.

name: CHIYOGIKU - SEISHU
tastingDescription: Light body with a crisp finish. Pair perfectly with any cuisine. Drink cold or hot (50°C/ 120F).

name: CHOCOLATE SHOP - THE CHOCOLATE LOVER'S WINE

With inviting aromas of black cherry and dark chocolate that entwine and continue to a smooth finish.

class: Other Country Fruit and Dessert Wine
name: CHOYA - YUZU
tastingDescription: Made from the refreshing citrus juice of the Yuzu fruit from Shikoku-region to create a delicate and floral liqueur. Enjoy simply on the rocks, with mixers or make great tasting cocktails.

class: Other Country Fruit and Dessert Wine
name: CHOYA UJI GREEN TEA UMESHU
tastingDescription: The well merged taste of Uji green tea and slightly sweet Umeshu is made possible only by the CHOYA's own brewing process that does not produce the bitterness of Uji leaves from Kyoto. Sweetness is extracted slowly at a low temperature when formulating tea with Umeshu, and it creates a nice fragrance and elegant umami.

name: CHURCH AND STATE - LOST INHIBITIONS RED PRUDE
nameSanitized: church and state - lost inhibitions red prude
sort: CHURCH AND STATE - LOST INHIBITIONS RED PRUDE
tastingDescription: Lost Inhibitions red offers a Bordeaux blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot in a meaty juicy style of red wine. Fruit forward and made for now, this wine would complement everyday fare like the pizza party or barbecue night or a big family style spaghetti and meatballs.

name: CHURCH BLOCK - WIRRA WIRRA MCLAREN VALE 2018
nameSanitized: church block - wirra wirra mclaren vale 2018
sort: CHURCH BLOCK - WIRRA WIRRA MCLAREN VALE 2018
tastingDescription: This structured blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot produces both fresh red and dark fruit notes with some plum, cherry and cedar to round out the palate. Will pair nicely with roasted cauliflower

name: CINSAULT - TIGER HORSE OLD VINE
tastingDescription: False

name: CINSAULT ROSE - THE GRINDER
tastingDescription: A crisp, dry Rose, made in the French style. Delicate violets and strawberry on the nose, followed by ripe, pink grapefruit on the palate.

name: CINZANO - ROSSO
tastingDescription: Sweet and fragrant with flavours of citrus and berries. It finishes with a uniquely persistent but pleasantly bitter aftertaste. It's exciting, rich and daring.

name: CL DE LA CHAPELLE - ECRIN BRUT RESERVE
nameSanitized: cl de la chapelle - ecrin brut reserve
sort: CL DE LA CHAPELLE - ECRIN BRUT RESERVE
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "This blend dominated by Pinot Noir with four years of aging conveys an attractive maturity while preserving the bright white fruits and acidity. These two elements add up to a rich wine that has a fine texture and delicious finishing acidity." (December 2018)

name: CLOS DE LA ROCHE GRAND CRU - ALBERT BICHOT 2015
namePrefix: CLOS DE LA ROCHE GRAND CRU
nameSanitized: clos de la roche grand cru - albert bichot 2015
sort: CLOS DE LA ROCHE GRAND CRU - ALBERT BICHOT 2015
tastingDescription: 92-94 Points, Wine Advocate: "… The palate is medium-bodied with supple and extremely fine tannin, just the right amount of salinity with an edgy and vibrant, feminine finish. This is a graceful Clos de la Roche from Bichot that should age with style. Drink: 2020 - 2040." (December 2016)

name: CLOS DE VOUGEOT - DOMAINE DE LA VOUGERAIE 2014
nameSanitized: clos de vougeot - domaine de la vougeraie 2014
sort: CLOS DE VOUGEOT - DOMAINE DE LA VOUGERAIE 2014
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Wine Spectator: "Sweet vanilla, butterscotch and milk chocolate notes give way to cherry and spice flavors in this tightly wound red. The oak is dominant now, but there is a lot going on. The finish is long, ending with ripe fruit. Best from 2022 through 2045." (May 2017)

name: CLOS DE VOUGEOT - DOMAINE FAIVELEY 2015
tastingDescription: 92-95 Points, Burghound: "…The full-bodied and tautly muscled broad-shouldered flavors possess excellent power and detail on the stunningly long, mildly rustic and youthfully austere finish. This is quite serious and clearly very structured yet it stops short of being overtly old school in style..." (January 2017)

name: CLOS DE VOUGEOT - JOSEPH DROUHIN 2015
tastingDescription: 94 Points, James Suckling - "A wealth of wet-earth notes and an array of red and dark cherries, as well as a gently smoky edge. The palate is beautifully plush and long and delivers a very striking array of juicy, rich and sweet cherries that hold pure and fresh. Silky tannins have the final word."

name: CLOS DU MARQUIS 2016
tastingDescription:
“Blended of 73% Cabernet Sauvignon, 24% Merlot and 3% Cabernet Franc, the 2016 Clos du Marquis has a very deep garnet-purple color and is a little broody to begin, giving way to notes of crushed blackcurrants and black cherries with touches of warm plums, pencil shavings, earth and new leather with a waft of yeast extract. Medium-bodied with a rock-solid frame of grainy tannins, it has bold fruit matched by freshness, finishing long and mineral laced. Drink: 2021 - 2038.”
94 Points, Wine Advocate

name: CLOS DU SOLEIL - CELESTIALE 2019
tastingDescription: Célestiale is Clos du Soleil’s Bordeaux-style blend that is soft and full of fruit with an elegant and classic structure. The taster is greeted with bright, fresh aromas of blackcurrant and raspberry, with further notes of cranberry and spice. On the palate, the wine is remarkably rich and layered, with flavours of black cherries, ripe raspberries, plums and savoury grilled notes. The wine is elegant and perfectly balanced, and with its fresh acidity and fine lively tannins this is a perfect food wine.

name: CLOS DU SOLEIL - CELESTIALE SIMILKAMEEN 2018
tastingDescription: Clos du Soleil's Bordeaux blend that is soft and full of fruit with a classic and elegant structure. The taster is greeted with aromas of cedar and raspberry compote with darker notes of blackberries. On the palate is soft and layered, dominated by fresh ripe fruit flavours of raspberry, blackberry.

name: CLOS DU SOLEIL - PINOT GRIS WHISPERED SECRET VINEYARD 2020
nameSanitized: clos du soleil - pinot gris whispered secret vineyard 2020
sort: CLOS DU SOLEIL - PINOT GRIS WHISPERED SECRET VINEYARD 2020
tastingDescription: At home here in BC we are lucky to have best selection and price for our local wines. Such as from an artisan producer from the Similkameen Valley from the great 2020 vintage as a single vineyard expression of Pinot Gris. A cooler site near the river, Whispered Secret vineyard shows best with white grapes like Pinot Gris. Citrus and pear and nectarine hints are in the taste profile of this crisp fresh white that is so delicious.

name: CLOS FLORIDENE BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“A rapier style, with chalk-edged lime pith, white asparagus, thyme and quinine notes that are finely pitched through the bony finish. Pure and chiseled. Drink now through 2022.”
91 Points, Wine Spectator

name: CLOS FLORIDENE GRAVES 2016
tastingDescription:
“Solid, delivering a mix of cherry and plum paste flavors backed by kirsch and bramble notes, with light sweet tobacco and tar edges through the juicy finish. Drink now through 2026.”
91 Points, Wine Spectator

name: CLOS FLORIDENE GRAVES BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“A rapier style, with chalk-edged lime pith, white asparagus, thyme and quinine notes that are finely pitched through the bony finish. Pure and chiseled. Drink now through 2022.”
91 Points, Wine Spectator

name: CLOS FOURTET 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Clos Fourtet is vivid, explosive and simply captivating. Inky blue/purplish berry fruit, lavender, spice and white flowers are all vivid in the glass, but it is the wine's silky, seamless personality that elevates it into a place among the wines of the vintage. In 2016, Clos Fourtet is stunningly beautiful and utterly compelling. This is a tremendous showing from proprietor Matthieu Cuvelier and consulting winemaker Stéphane Derenoncourt.”
97 Points, Vinous
2 bottle limit

name: CLOS SAINT DENIS GRAND CRU - JADOT DOMAINE GAGEY 2017
nameSanitized: clos saint denis grand cru - jadot domaine gagey 2017
sort: CLOS SAINT DENIS GRAND CRU - JADOT DOMAINE GAGEY 2017
tastingDescription: 95-97 Points, Robert Parker's the Wine Advocate - "The 2017 Clos Saint-Denis Grand Cru, which contains "a few stems," according to winemaker Frederic Barnier, has a gorgeous bouquet of raspberry, cranberry and touches of crushed stone and orange pith - one of the finest aromatics from Jadot this year. The palate is medium-bodied with supple tannins, demonstrating more weight and fruit intensity than its sibling Clos de la Roche. There is grip, focus and a sense of purpose whereas the Clos de la Roche seems to drink more easily. Superb." (January, 2020).

name: CLOS VOUGEOT - BOUCHARD PERE 2016
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Burghound: "This is really quite aromatically refined, indeed the expressive nose is highly perfumed and speaks of floral, plum and black cherry scents layered with a subtle earthiness. The sense of refinement continues onto the palate as the focused, intense and sleekly muscular flavors evidence good power on the balanced, long and only moderately austere finish." (April 2012)

name: CLOS VOUGEOT - THIBAULT LIGER BELAIR 2014
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Wine Advocate: "The 2014 Clos Vougeot Grand Cru was deeply impressive when I tasted it from barrel and now in bottle, it is fulfilling my expectations. It demonstrated superb mineralité and tension on the nose. Good focus and detail… This is excellent! Drink: 2020 - 2045." (June 2017)

name: CLOS VOUGEOT GRAND CRU - CHATEAU DE MARSANNAY  2015
nameSanitized: clos vougeot grand cru - chateau de marsannay  2015
sort: CLOS VOUGEOT GRAND CRU - CHATEAU DE MARSANNAY  2015
tastingDescription: Powerful and expressive nose. Notes of black fruit, spice and tobacco. Complex, structured, and powerful mouth with soft and velvety tannins. Very long finish.

name: CLOS VOUGEOT GRAND CRU - DOMAINE LOUIS JADOT 2017
nameSanitized: clos vougeot grand cru - domaine louis jadot 2017
sort: CLOS VOUGEOT GRAND CRU - DOMAINE LOUIS JADOT 2017
tastingDescription: 92 Points,  Robert Parker's The Wine Advocate - "Tasted from bottle, the 2017 Clos Vougeot Grand Cru (Domaine Louis Jadot) opens in the glass with an attractive bouquet of berry fruit, plums, orange rind and coniferous forest oor, framed by a deft application of new oak. On the palate, the wine is full-bodied, ample and enveloping, its succulent core of fruit framed by melting tannins. From barrel, I faulted this wine for being excessively open-knit, but while it certainly is unusually supple and giving by the standards of this cuvee, there's more depth than I perceived last year: what's more, and critically, this is simply immensely pleasurable to drink. (February, 2020).

name: COCKBURN'S - SPECIAL RESERVE
tastingDescription: The Special Reserve still has the lusciously ripe, vibrant fruit of youth and lovely tannins, which give it the slightly peppery spice on the tongue. But it also has the elegance of age: the softness and smoothness that can only be achieved by slow ageing in old oak barrels. That’s what puts the Special in Special Reserve.

name: COCKBURN'S - VINTAGE PORT 2016
tastingDescription: 99 Points, James Suckling: "This shows fantastic graphite and dark-berry character with black-stone undertones and hints of dried roses. Full-bodied and very tight and precise. Good kick in the end. Love the polished tannins, which are totally folded into the wine. Reminds me of the 1947 Cockburn." (November 2018)

name: CODORNIU - CAVA CLASICO BRUT

name: COTES DE BORDEAUX CADILLAC - CHATEAU CARIGNAN PRIMA 2015
nameSanitized: cotes de bordeaux cadillac - chateau carignan prima 2015
sort: COTES DE BORDEAUX CADILLAC - CHATEAU CARIGNAN PRIMA 2015
tastingDescription:
“The 2015 Prima is 100% Merlot, with great density and nuances of smoke, blackberry and dark plum. It is approachable now but will certainly hold for 3-5 years in the cellar.”
89 Points, Barbara Philip, MW

name: COTES DE CASTILLON - CHATEAU GARDEGAN 2018
tastingDescription:
"This is a perfumed, balanced wine. Firm structure provides a solid base for crisp, clean black-currant fruits and acidity. Freshness will propel the wine forward as it matures. Drink from 2022."
88 pts, Wine Enthusiast

name: COTES DE CASTILLON - CHATEAU JOANIN BECOT 2018
nameSanitized: cotes de castillon - chateau joanin becot 2018
sort: COTES DE CASTILLON - CHATEAU JOANIN BECOT 2018
tastingDescription:
"Emerging from the team of Beau-Séjour Bécot, the 2018 Château Joanin Bécot is based on 75% Merlot and 25% Cabernet Franc coming from the limestone soils of the Côtes de Castillon region. Lots of black cherry and redcurrant fruit as well as leafy herbs, dried flowers, chalky minerality, and camphor emerge on the nose. This carries to a medium-bodied, seamless 2018 with terrific overall balance, ripe yet present tannins, and outstanding length on the finish. Tasting like a topflight Saint-Emilion, it will benefit from a year or so in the cellar and impress for at least a decade."
93 pts, Jeb Dunnuck

name: COTES DE CASTILLON - CHATEAU JOUANIN
tastingDescription: Michaela Morris: "Immediately expressive, aromas of bay leaf, exotic spice and plum emerge from the glass. On the palate, ripe plush fruit is neatly framed by an assertive grip."

name: COTES DE GASCOGNE - LES FLEURS DU MAL
nameSanitized: cotes de gascogne - les fleurs du mal
sort: COTES DE GASCOGNE - LES FLEURS DU MAL

name: COTES DE PROVENCE - CHATEAU MINUTY ORIGINAL
nameSanitized: cotes de provence - chateau minuty original
sort: COTES DE PROVENCE - CHATEAU MINUTY ORIGINAL
tastingDescription: Cultivated using sustainable agriculture methods, the vineyards thrives in a coastal area with southwest exposure on soils compose of mica shist. Complex with an exceptional freshness and finesse offering notes of pink grapefruit and white peach. Recommended with aperitifs, seafood, bouillabaisse, sushi and fresh salads.

name: COTES DE PROVENCE - CHATEAU MINUTY PRESTIGE
nameSanitized: cotes de provence - chateau minuty prestige
sort: COTES DE PROVENCE - CHATEAU MINUTY PRESTIGE
tastingDescription: Sourced from a rigorous selection of the best "Cotes de Provence vineyards. This light rose wine expresses some very intense aromas of citrus fruit and white flowers. On the palate, a velvety texture combined with a fresh flavor gives this wine a certain ethereal quality.

name: COTES DE PROVENCE ROSE - CALVET
tastingDescription: Light pink with slightly purple shades, clear. Elegant and fine, flavoured, red fruit, recurrent, spices. Ample and fleshy, with a lot of finesse. A summer wine par excellence grilled food, fresh salads can be served with meals all year round.

name: COTES DE PROVENCE ROSE - CALVET MURMURE
nameSanitized: cotes de provence rose - calvet murmure

tastingDescription: Cotes De Provence is a clear light pink rose with a slight purple shade. The nose is elegant and fine with red fruit, red currant and spices. Its freshness is appreciated as an aperitif with antipasti or paired with salads, grilled meat and fish dishes either cooked or raw

name: COTES DE PROVENCE ROSE - CHATEAU DE L'AUMERADE MARIE-CHRISTI
nameSanitized: cotes de provence rose - chateau de laumerade marie-christi
sort: COTES DE PROVENCE ROSE - CHATEAU DE L'AUMERADE MARIE-CHRISTI
tastingDescription: A lovely pale powder pink, with refreshing aromas of grapefruit leading to succulent peach and apricot on the palate. Fruit forward and full, with a hint of spice, this elegant rosé has a refreshing acidity and a long finish.

name: COTES DE PROVENCE ROSE - GASSIER SABLES D'AZUR
nameSanitized: cotes de provence rose - gassier sables dazur
sort: COTES DE PROVENCE ROSE - GASSIER SABLES D'AZUR
tastingDescription: Light pink robe with peach-coloured shades. Elegant notes of red fruit (red currant), white flowers notes, and prunus fruits on the nose. The palate is lively, fresh with a nice balance, ending with beautiful notes of delicacies.

name: COTES DU JURA CHARDONNAY - M CABELIER VIEILLES VIGNES 2015
nameSanitized: cotes du jura chardonnay - m cabelier vieilles vignes 2015
sort: COTES DU JURA CHARDONNAY - M CABELIER VIEILLES VIGNES 2015

name: COTES DU RHONE - BRUNEL DE LA GARDINE 2019
nameSanitized: cotes du rhone - brunel de la gardine 2019
sort: COTES DU RHONE - BRUNEL DE LA GARDINE 2019
tastingDescription: Here is a delightful Grenache-dominant blend, typical of the southern Rhône, with notes of pepper, cherry, blackberry, leather and cocoa.

name: COTES DU RHONE - CHAPOUTIER BELLERUCHE 2019
tastingDescription: 89 Points, James Suckling: "A fresh array of light, bright raspberries and red plums, delivered in a bright, simple and easygoing style. Drink now." (August 2018)

name: COTES DU RHONE - DELAS ST ESPRIT 2017
nameSanitized: cotes du rhone - delas st esprit 2017
sort: COTES DU RHONE - DELAS ST ESPRIT 2017
tastingDescription: Wine Advocate: "A blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Grenache, the 2016 Cotes du Rhone Saint-Esprit is a screaming value. If offers bold black cherry and blueberry fruit aromas, lively fruit flavors, silky tannins and a crisp, lengthy mocha-tinged finish. Drink: 2017 - 2020." (October 2017)

name: COTES DU RHONE - GUIGAL 2016
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Advocate: "As usual, the 2015 Cotes du Rhone features a majority of Syrah. Spicy, peppery, hickory aromas lead off, adding berries up front and then moving into darker fruit and more savory notes of black olive by the finish. Drink: 2018 - 2023." (October 2018)

name: COTES DU RHONE - HALOS DE JUPITER 2018
nameSanitized: cotes du rhone - halos de jupiter 2018
sort: COTES DU RHONE - HALOS DE JUPITER 2018
tastingDescription: 89 Points, Wine Advocate: "More concentrated and richer than the Costières de Nîmes, the 2016 Cotes du Rhone—a concrete-aged blend of 80% Grenache and 20% Syrah—combines blueberry and cherry fruit, then adds hints of garrigue and mocha. It's medium to full-bodied, with just the right dash of astringency on the finish... Drink: 2018 - 2023." (August 2018)

name: COTES DU RHONE - JL CHAVE SELECTION MON COEUR 2018
nameSanitized: cotes du rhone - jl chave selection mon coeur 2018
sort: COTES DU RHONE - JL CHAVE SELECTION MON COEUR 2018
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Vinous - "Smooth, concentrated and gently sweet, offering mineral- and spice-accented black raspberry, cherry and violet pastille flavors and a spicy jolt of cracked pepper. Finishes supple, sweet and quite long, with harmonious tannins and lingering florality." (April 2020)

name: COTES DU RHONE - JOSEPH PELLERIN RESERVE
nameSanitized: cotes du rhone - joseph pellerin reserve
sort: COTES DU RHONE - JOSEPH PELLERIN RESERVE
tastingDescription: Medium-bodied, medium tannic, blackberry notes, cherry notes, ripe strawberry notes, cocoa notes, spicy.

name: COTES DU RHONE - LA FIOLE 2018
tastingDescription: This easy-drinking red blend is light and fruity on the nose, with cherry, raspberry, earth and barnyard aromas and a pleasing spiciness. It has vibrant acidity on the palate, with slightly sour red fruit and spice notes and a rustic quality that suits Mediterranean cuisine.

name: COTES DU RHONE - LES DAUPHINS RESERVE
nameSanitized: cotes du rhone - les dauphins reserve
sort: COTES DU RHONE - LES DAUPHINS RESERVE
tastingDescription: This delicious blend of 70% Grenache, 25% Syrah and 5% Mouvèdre has fragrances of ripe red fruits and blackcurrant with a hint of spice. On the palate, it has an elegant structure with smooth tannins and a harmonious finish. It is perfect with assorted meats, roast dishes and cheese.

name: COTES DU RHONE - LOUIS BERNARD
tastingDescription: Expressive nose with stewed cherry and red fruits aromas. The palate is harmonious and rich, with round tannins and a lively, fruit-forward character.

name: COTES DU RHONE - OGIER HERITAGES
tastingDescription: Expressive, elegant and complex with flavours of ripe red berries. Lightly spicy with hints of undergrowth. Full and very attractive palate with freshness and silky tannins.

name: COTES DU RHONE - PERRIN RESERVE
tastingDescription: 88-90 Points, Wine Advocate: "Abnormally concentrated for this cuvée, the 2017 Cotes du Rhone Reserve is a blend of 60% Grenache, 20% Mourvèdre and 20% Syrah. ...it offers intense cherry fruit, supple tannins and crisp acids. At the price this wine normally sells for, it should be a steal. Drink: 2018 - 2022." (October 2018)

name: COTES DU RHONE BLANC - LOUIS BERNARD
nameSanitized: cotes du rhone blanc - louis bernard

Floral hints on the nose combine with fruity aromas of apple. It is lively and fresh, with the floral and apple fruit elements being well-balanced on the palate.

nameSanitized: cotes du rhone blanc - meffre saint vincent
sort: COTES DU RHONE BLANC - MEFFRE SAINT VINCENT

Slightly taut on the finish due to an extracted hint, but there's still plenty of fruit here. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2020." (November 2017)

It shines for its purity and should easily be an outstanding Côtes du Rhône." (October 2020)

name: CROFT - ORIGINAL PALE CREAM
tastingDescription: This pale cream sherry combines the dryness of quality fino sherry with the richness of a cream sherry. It is pale yellow in colour with a nutty, dried sweet fruit palate and a smooth finish.

name: CROFT - QUINTA DA ROEDA VINTAGE 2018
tastingDescription: Deep purple colour and the nose displays opulent red fruit character with intense, woodland berry aromas, balsamic, minty, and eucalyptus scents. The palate is round and rich, with a velvety texture and excellent acidity and well-integrated grippy tannins. The finish is powerful and very long with persistent crisp, red berry flavours.

name: CROFT - VINTAGE 2016
tastingDescription: 97 Points, Wine Spectator - "Very expressive, this unfurls with mouthwatering licorice snap, fruitcake, apple wood and violet notes, which are quickly followed by a wave of mouthfilling plum, blackberry and fig paste flavors...packed but well-defined...the energy allows the fruit to ripple through the long finish. Built for the long haul, with distinctly dry cut at the end." (December 2018)

name: CROZES HERMITAGE - ALAIN GRAILLOT 2018
tastingDescription: 93 Points, James Suckling: "Dark stony minerals and toasty biscuity notes with plenty of licorice, star anise, graphite and dark plum-soaked herbs. Full of interest. The palate has a neatly articulated frame of ripe and sturdy tannins, cradling a slightly tarry, ripe, dark plum-flavored palate. This has a saline, succulent resolve." (September 2017)

name: CROZES HERMITAGE - CHAPOUTIER MEYSONNIERS ORGANIC 16
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Advocate: "The 2016 Crozes Hermitage les Meysonniers has turned out even better than I thought. It's bigger and richer than the La Petite Ruche, delivering blueberry fruit tinged with cracked pepper and a long, silky finish. It should drink well through at least 2025.. Drink: 2018 - 2025." (October 2018)

name: CUVEE WHITE - STINA 2019

The combination of pear and melon notes and anise nuances gives this sake an impressive and satisfying finish that lingers in the mouth long after the sake has disappeared.

name: DAO - ADEGA DE PENALVA
tastingDescription: Deep cherry red. Light cherry aroma, touch of peppery spice, smells fresh rather than sweet. Terrific introduction to Dão - red cherry fruit, a firm but polite grip from the tannins and an immediate association with the granite rock of the region.

name: DAO - GRAO VASCO
tastingDescription: Ruby red, plumy, berry fruit aromas and flavours with leather nuances; medium- to full-bodied with a prolonged finish. A versatile wine, it is ideal as an accompaniment to light dishes, cured meats, and cheeses.

name: DAO - QUINTA MONDEGO MONDECO

name: DAO BRANCO - JULIA KEMPER 2015
tastingDescription: This wine presents a magnificent citrus color with greenish reflections. Very young and fresh with notes of orange blossom, soft lime, custard apple and mango. It reveals a rich acidity and good mouth volume, with a pronounced character, expresses a unique minerality, elegance and personality. The “in mouth” sensation is fresh and long.

name: DAO TOURIGA NACIONAL - OPTA 2016
tastingDescription: Opta Touriga Nacional presents you with expressive aromas of violets, blackcurrant and cassis with smooth tannins and floral and black fruit flavours. The finish is complex, rich and persistent. It pairs well with spicy red or white meat.

name: DASSAI - 23 JUNMAI DAIGINJO
tastingDescription: Each grain of saké rice is painstakingly polished down to 23% of its original size. Cucumber, melon, and fresh rainwater come to mind when tasting this saké. Incredible balance of delicate aromas and the depth of a full-bodied presence on the palate.

name: DASSAI - 39 JUNMAI DAIGINJO
tastingDescription: Extremely light, fruity and a pure delight to drink. Smooth with mild acidity. Aromatic layers of fresh pineapple, ripe pear, mango and delicate anise fill the senses, with a dry clean touch on the palate.

name: DE CHANCENY - CREMANT DE LOIRE ROSE BRUT

Made from 100% Cabernet Franc, this charming off-dry bubbly has a salmon-pink hue and vibrant aromas of peach stone, wild red berries, honey, fine spices and cedar. It is delicate with a kiss of sweetness and a clean and tangy finish. Perfect for holidays and spicier cuisines. (October, 2019)

name: DE VENOGE - CORDON BLEU BRUT
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Advocate - "On the palate, this is a round, fresh and well-balanced Champagne with a tight structure and and impressive length. There is even a certain salinity that makes this Brut a first class aperitif and at a very good price point. Drink: 2017 - 2022." (November 2017)

name: DEEP LAYERED RED - INCEPTION
tastingDescription: This Shiraz-dominated blend is rich and complex and matches well with spicy chicken dishes and roasted red meats. South Africa could be the next big thing in Shiraz.

name: DEEP ROOTS WINERY - GAMAY 2020
tastingDescription: False

name: DELAMOTTE - BRUT
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Decanter: "Floral nose, with a hint of soft spice and nectarine; palate is dry but not austere, with stone fruit and a fine mineral tension. Cerebral, satisfying and impressively wrought.

name: DELLE VENEZIE PINOT GRIGIO - PASQUA COLORI D'ITALIA
nameSanitized: delle venezie pinot grigio - pasqua colori ditalia
sort: DELLE VENEZIE PINOT GRIGIO - PASQUA COLORI D'ITALIA
tastingDescription: This wine offers floral notes such as acacia blossoms, with hints of pear. On the palate, it is intense and very well-balanced, with fruity flavours of apple and pear.

name: DEUTZ - AMOUR DE DEUTZ BRUT 2006
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Spectator - "A rich, vivacious Champagne, with toasted brioche and smoked walnut accents, this offers flavors of black cherry pâte de fruit, pickled ginger and poached apricot on a lively bead. Shows fine minerally cut to the lingering finish. Drink now through 2026." (November 2015)

name: DEUTZ - CUVEE WILLIAM DEUTZ BRUT 2006
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Spectator - "Hints of marzipan and apricot preserves enrich this finely meshed Champagne, with racy acidity providing a vibrant frame. Creamy on the palate, featuring black raspberry, orange liqueur, biscuit and spice notes lingering on the minerally finish. Drink now through 2026." (November 2015)

name: DEWAZAKURA AWA SAKE
tastingDescription: If you are looking for an alternative drink choice to Champagne or sparkling wine, this sake is perfect for you. There is no sugar or distill alcohol added; the bubbles are formed with carbon dioxide which derives from the natural fermentation during brewing. This sake is faintly sweet with a floral aroma and an overall light impression. This Awasake is approved by the 'Japanese Awasake Association' after the strict examination.

name: DIABOLICA - RED
tastingDescription: A top seller with customers, that like the fruity red and black fruit flavours and smooth tannins. A blend of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Shiraz, the wine has some weight but is crafted to be very approachable. This is a good red to sip on its own or with bbq meat and veggies or tomato sauced pastas.

name: DIABOLICA - REINCARNATION BOURBON OAK AGED
tastingDescription: The oak barrel has influenced winemaking forever and the modern twist is around the flavours that can be imparted into the wine. Particularly red wines where hints of smoke and vanilla and spice and chocolate seem to work with the cherry, berry, plum and other fruit flavours in the glass. At the table the boldness of flavor lends itself to pizza, spicy ribs or tomato sauced pasta dishes.

name: DIABOLICA - ROSE 2019
tastingDescription: The perfect patio sipper as an off dry Rosé! Gushing with big, luscious, fruit flavors of wild strawberry and watermelon to start. Midway, it unravels with pomegranate, jasmine, and a hint of deep dark cherry.

name: DIABOLICA - WHITE
tastingDescription: A combination of aromatic grapes and the Pinots (Blanc and Gris) add up to a flavourful glass of white. Offering citrus and spice, tropical hints, honey and peach, this is a good sipper on its own. Or work with snacking meals, tapa courses or salad courses.

name: DIRTY LAUNDRY - PINOT GRIS SAY YES 2020
nameSanitized: dirty laundry - pinot gris say yes 2020
sort: DIRTY LAUNDRY - PINOT GRIS SAY YES 2020
tastingDescription: Excellent fruit character here and BC's signature white varietal, the Pinot Gris wines offer great food matching ability. Particularly in BC where our menu is all over the place. Such as quiche dishes, or butter chicken or poached salmon.

name: DIRTY LAUNDRY - ROSE HUSH 2020
tastingDescription: Originally a grape grower in the Summerland area, the Scherzinger winery opened in 1995 with a reputation for Gewurztraminer. New ownership and name change became Dirty Laundry and much success. One of the largest production rose wines in the province, Dirty Laundry Hush Rose uses white and red grapes to be so delicious. Fruitiness of apple, rhubarb and strawberry combine with a crisp and refreshing linger.

name: DIRTY LAUNDRY VINEYARD - HUSH WHITE BLEND 2020
nameSanitized: dirty laundry vineyard - hush white blend 2020
sort: DIRTY LAUNDRY VINEYARD - HUSH WHITE BLEND 2020
tastingDescription: False

name: DOGLIANI DOLCETTO - BATASIOLO 2017
tastingDescription: Fresh aromas of cherry, blueberries and herbaceous vein. On the palate it is fresh, flowing with a slightly almond finish. It has structure and body and a dense but silky tannin, what is needed for a pleasant and good drink.

name: DOLCEORO - MOSCATO D'ASTI
tastingDescription: A rich nose, with fresh notes of mint and sage, and a round and effervescent palate. It pairs perfectly with pastries and cakes, or can be an ingredient in cocktails and spritzers.

name: DOLCETTO D'ALBA - AZELIA 2018
tastingDescription: A single-vineyard Dolcetto from one of the region's best areas for this variety: Montelupo Albese. Intense colour, red fruit, blackberry, blueberry, rose, sweet spices, deep fruity and floral flavors which persist for long. Aromatic and mineral. Ideal to drink young, but given its complexity also after 3-4 years.

name: DOLCETTO D'ALBA - MASSOLINO
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Spectator: “This red is balanced and fluid, bursting with black cherry, blackberry, violet and spice aromas and flavors. Firms up slightly on the finish. Shows fine purity and length. Drink now through 2021.” (February 2018)

name: DOLOMITI TEROLDEGO - FORADORI 2018
tastingDescription: 94 Points, James Suckling: “Extremely floral and perfumed with blue fruit, roses, violets and other flowers. Full-bodied and very fine with beautiful depth and polish. Goes on for minutes. From biodynamically grown grapes and Demeter certified. Drink now or hold.” (August 2018)

name: DOM PERIGNON - 2010
tastingDescription:
98 Points, James Suckling: "A firm and vivid Champagne with a precise, focused palate. Full-bodied and dry. It's very layered and bright with light pineapple, peach, praline, cooked-apple and stone aromas and flavors. It's very subtle and focused at the end. Integrated with richness and high acidity. Good depth. Reminds me of the 1995. Very clean. Solid. Lovely to drink already, but will age nicely." (December 2020)
2 bottle limit.

name: DOM PERIGNON - ROSE 2006
tastingDescription: 99 Points, James Suckling - "A mind-blowing wine. This is super subtle and intense with aromas of peaches, light strawberry and cream. Also shows rose petal and cooked peaches. Medium to full body, with ultra-fine tannins that feel like fine silk. The finish goes on for minutes." (December 2016)

name: DOM PERIGNON - WHITE LUMINOUS LABEL 2008

In the glass it evolves to show high-toned acidity and a freshness of citrus, with grainy texture adding to its complexity." (July 2018)

name: DOMAINE DE CHEVALIER BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Still very shy on the nose, but the candied citrus, fresh melon, pear and quince notes come through on the palate, together with discreet, toasty oak. Although this is really concentrated, the power is underplayed and the enormous, herbal and mineral depth steals up on you slowly and then whisks you away. You could enjoy it now, but there’s enormous aging potential. A blend of 70 per cent sauvignon and 30 per cent semillon. Try in 2021.”
98 Points, James Suckling
2 bottle limit

name: DOMAINE DE CHEVALIER BLANC 2016
tastingDescription:
“Still very shy on the nose, but the candied citrus, fresh melon, pear and quince notes come through on the palate, together with discreet, toasty oak. Although this is really concentrated, the power is underplayed and the enormous, herbal and mineral depth steals up on you slowly and then whisks you away. You could enjoy it now, but there’s enormous aging potential. A blend of 70 per cent sauvignon and 30 per cent semillon. Try in 2021.”
98 Points, James Suckling
2 bottle limit

name: DOMAINE DE CHEVALIER ROUGE 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Domaine de Chevalier is a thrilling wine. Dense and beautifully layered, the 2016 is also quite a bit richer than it usually is. Cabernet Sauvignon aromatics and structure pulse through the wine. The red-toned fruit is incredibly primary at this stage. Readers should be prepared to cellar the 2016 for at least a handful of years. It has been nothing short of magnificent on the three occasions I have tasted it so far. Drink: 2026 - 2066.”
97 Points, Vinous
2 bottle limit

name: DOMAINE VENDANGE - CREMANT DE SAVOIE GRANDE RESERVE
nameSanitized: domaine vendange - cremant de savoie grande reserve
sort: DOMAINE VENDANGE - CREMANT DE SAVOIE GRANDE RESERVE
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Gismondi - ''This crémant blends Jacquère (45%), Altesse (30%), Chardonnay (25%) of 25 year old vines, with vinification in stainless over 9 months with bâtonnage, prior to a secondary ferment in bottle for a minimum of one year on lees. A riffing pear skin sets off subtle quince, yellow apple, elderflower blossoms, lemon pith on a savoury, stony, slender, lees-lined palate. The subtle dosage and happy 12.5% makes it very drinkable now, and smartly so.'' (June 2021)

name: DORE - CHAMPAGNE BRUT CUVEE
tastingDescription: False

name: DORE - CHAMPAGNE BRUT ROSE

name: DOURO - CASA FERREIRINHA BARCA VELHA
tastingDescription: It has a very complex aroma, with prominent spices such as pepper, balsamic notes and tobacco box. It has a vibrant acidity in the mouth, very lively, very firm tannins, notes of spices, black fruits, and balsamic flavors. The finish is extremely long, of great elegance and complexity.

name: DOURO - CRASTO 2016
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine Advocate - “The 2015 Tinto is a blend of 35% Touriga Nacional, 30% Tinta Roriz, 25% Touriga Franca and 10% Tinta Barroca. A small part of the blend was aged for six months in French oak. This has been seen before, but it is worth another look as it is a very fine value. It is still gloriously fruity, intense in flavor, yet showing lift to the fruit all the time. It is always fresh and lively, never jammy and sweet, even while very fruity. That may seem like a contradiction, but it's not. With more time in the bottle, it also is showing a bit more muscle as the fruit comes into perfect balance with the structure. This is even better now and a terrific value. Drink: 2017 - 2028.” (August 2017)

name: DOURO - PORCA DE MURCA
tastingDescription: 90 Points James Suckling: "Aromas of violets, hibiscus, wild strawberry and brambleberry. It's medium-bodied with firm, sleek tannins. Juicy and fresh. Touriga nacional, touriga franca, tinta barroca and tinta roriz. Drink or hold." (January 2021)

name: DOURO - PRATS & SYMINGTON CHRYSEIA 2014
tastingDescription: 94 Points & Top 100: 2017, Rank: 98, Wine Spectator - "A powerful and concentrated red, featuring kirsch, red plum and baker's chocolate notes, balanced by tarragon, slate and violet details. Elegant, with supple tannins framing the long finish, which is laced with hot stone, olive and licorice accents. Drink now through 2023.” (March 2017)

name: DOURO - QUINTA DO VALE MEAO 2018
tastingDescription: 99 Points, Wine Enthusiast - "This stellar wine comes from one of the grandest estates in the Douro...For such a massive wine, it is surprisingly elegant. It is dense with tannins and black fruits but also sophisticated and certainly ageworthy." (March 2021)

name: DOURO - QUINTA DO VALE MEAO MEANDRO 2018
nameSanitized: douro - quinta do vale meao meandro 2018
sort: DOURO - QUINTA DO VALE MEAO MEANDRO 2018
tastingDescription: "The Meandro is a consistently highly rated wine and you can see why with its balance of rich, dark fruit and floral aromas. It is smooth, gorgeous and matches particularly well with grilled meats." - Barbara Philip, MW, Category Manager for Wines of Europe, Sparkling & Fortified

name: DOURO - QUINTA DO VESUVIO 2015
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Wine Spectator - "A generous, polished red sporting an array of glazed black cherry, currant and blackberry flavours woven together with licorice, Asian spice and mineral elements. Full, supple tannins hug the floral aromas on the finish. Drink now through 2023." (February 2018)

name: DOURO - QUINTA DOS ACIPRESTES
tastingDescription: 90 Points Wine Advocate: "This has a dark chocolate overlay that gives way to acidity and overall freshness. It has reasonable concentration, better structure and a long finish. It is never fleshy or jammy. This is a super value, and some cellaring may make it better." (August 2019)

name: DOURO - VALE D MARIA 2014
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Enthusiast - "This wine has a dry, solid character, with more tannins than fruit at this very young stage. Firm now, it will soften although its structure suggests it will likely continue to be a firm, structured wine for many years. Drink from 2020."

name: DOURO - VICENTE FARIA ANIMUS
tastingDescription: A blend of three Portuguese grape varieties (Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional) combine to produce flavours or red fruits, purple plum, cedar and fine tannins.  Great accompaniment to pizza, roast chicken or pasta dishes.

name: DOURO - VILA REGIA
tastingDescription: Black berry, red fruit and vanilla aromas and flavours with earthy, dried fruit and cedar notes. Dry and medium-bodied with a long finish. The perfect aperitif, or an ideal wine with tapas and share plates.

name: DOURO BRANCO RESERVA - CASA FERREIRINHA PLANALTO
nameSanitized: douro branco reserva - casa ferreirinha planalto
sort: DOURO BRANCO RESERVA - CASA FERREIRINHA PLANALTO
tastingDescription: Wine Advocate - "The 2015 Reserva Planalto, screwcapped now, is an unoaked blend of 25% Viosinho, 20% Malvasia Fina, 15% each of Gouveio, Códega and Arinto, plus 5% each of Rabigato and Moscatel. It comes in at 13% alcohol. This is one of my favorite values when I'm in Portugal (running just about 5 Euros there) and just looking for an uncomplicated glass of something. A mass market wine, it is both readily available and often surprisingly fine for the money and the level. This is one of its best vintages. Showing fine tension on the finish and intensity of fruit flavor--in a dry, controlled fashion--this is clean, fresh and lovely." (December 2016)

name: DOW'S - LATE BOTTLED VINTAGE 2013
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine Spectator - "A floral aroma leads to sinewy flavors of red plum, raspberry and dark cherry that lengthen out midpalate, with a creamy texture. Milk chocolate details emerge on the finish. Drink now through 2019." (July 2016)

name: DOYARD - CHAMPAGNE CUVEE VENDEMIAIRE BRUT
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Advocate: "Mingling aromas of peach, white flowers, green apple, nutmeg and toasted almonds, it's medium to full-bodied, fleshy and enveloping...lively acids and fine length on the finish. Deep, concentrated and characterful, everything that bears the Doyard label is well worth serious attention" March 31, 2021

name: DRAPPIER - CARTE D'OR
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Spectator: "This bright and zesty champagne is lightly juicy and appealing, offering flavours of Honeycrisp apple, ripe white cherry, biscuit and pickled ginger. Balanced and lacy in texture, with a lingering, spiced finish. (November 2017)

name: DUBONNET - ROUGE
tastingDescription: Ruby/ garnet red with orange tint in colour, it has a sweet dried apricot, plum and herbal aroma and flavour with a citrus finish.

name: DUCLOT COLLECTION 2016
tastingDescription:
The Duclot Bordeaux Collection includes one bottle each of Château Lafite Rothschild, Château Mouton Rothschild, Château Petrus, Château Margaux, Château Haut-Brion, Château La Mission Haut-Brion, Château Cheval Blanc, Château Ausone, and Château d'Yquem.

sort: ECHEZEAUX GRAND CRU - DOMAINE JACQUES PRIEUR 2018
tastingDescription: 93-95 Points, Vinous: "The 2018 Echezeaux Grand Cru, which is completely de-stemmed, has a very intense, almost heady bouquet with layers of black cherry and cassis fruit; a dash of black pepper emerges with time. The palate is medium-bodied with succulent tannins, and very powerful for this vineyard, but it manages to maintain balance. The finish offers great length and satisfying freshness to counterbalance the fruit intensity. This might well be the pick of Prieur's reds this year." (January 2020).

name: EDELZWICKER - DOMAINE MARTIN JUND
tastingDescription: 89 Points, Gismondi on Wine - "An off-dry blend of Pinot Blanc, Muscat, Riesling, and Gewurztraminer, this glides the silken palate with gooseberry, starfruit, white peach, and pear, slicked with anise, and finishing with a grapefruit twist. Bonus - only 12.5% abv, and in a magnum!" (October 2020)

name: ELEPHANT ISLAND - THINK AGAIN MERLOT 2017
tastingDescription: A classic beauty. Intense plum aromatics, rich, concentrated Naramata sun ripened fruit on mid-palate, and silky fine grained tannins on finish. Delicious to drink solo now, or pair with a hearty stew. Intensity and structure will allow this vintage to ag

name: EMU - 999 FORTIFIED WINE

name: EMU - AUSTRALIAN APERA MEDIUM DRY

name: ENTRE LACS - DRY WHITE

name: ERMITAGE - CHAPOUTIER L'ERMITE 2017
tastingDescription: 100 Points, Wine Advocate: "The 2017 Ermitage l'Ermite is equally astounding but a completely different expression of Hermitage. Somehow this combines the reservedness of le Pavillon with the generosity of le Méal, resulting in a wine that I can only describe as perfect. The pristine cassis fruit is remarkably pure, joined by complex notes of crushed stone, salted licorice and the slightest hints of fine-grained oak. It's full-bodied, concentrated and velvety in texture, with oodles of chewy but ripe tannins and a finish that goes on for minutes."

name: ERMITAGE - CHAPOUTIER LE PAVILLON 2016
tastingDescription:
Full-bodied, concentrated and plush across the mid-palate, it turns rich and velvety on the nearly endless finish, marked by savory notes of beef, licorice and espresso. If you wish to catch a glimpse of this wine's greatness, it would be no crime to open a bottle upon release, as I suspect it will close down for a number of years soon afterward. Drink: 2025 - 2045.
100 pts, Wine Advocate

name: ERMITAGE - CHAPOUTIER LE PAVILLON 2017
tastingDescription: 99 Points - Wine Advocate: "Cassis and crushed stone join on the nose of the 2017 Ermitage le Pavillon. More austere than les Geffieux or le Méal, le Pavillon is rooted more firmly in granite, with crisply defined edges and firm tannins. It's impressive for sure, full-bodied, loaded with extract and almost creamy across the mid-palate, but ultimately it needs time. Give it 10 years to soften and develop a bit more charm - it has the concentrated dark fruit to carry it the distance."

name: ERMITAGE BLANC - DOM PHILLIPE & VINCENT JABOULET 09
nameSanitized: ermitage blanc - dom phillipe & vincent jaboulet 09

tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Advocate: “The 2016 Ermitage Blanc is unusual for the appellation in being 100% Roussanne. This is oaky, with cedar and vanilla notes over quince, pineapple and melon fruit. It's full-bodied and round, with a freshness and length on the finish. Drink: 2020 - 2030.” (October 2018)

name: ETNA ROSSO - PIETRADOLCE 2018
tastingDescription: 91 Points, James Suckling: “A fresh and delicate nerello mascalese with bright acidity, dried orange peel and hints of dark berries, following through to a medium body, fine tannins and a clean and vivid finish. Drink now.” (July 2018)

High-toned and transparent, it gains depth with air, developing a dark current of smoke and tar that offers a superb introduction to Etna Rosso. (October 2020)

name: EVOLVE - PINK EFFERVESCENCE
tastingDescription: 90 Points, John Schreiner - "This is a blend of Pinot Blanc and Merlot. It is a festive wine in the glass, with a pink blush and with active bubbles. There are toasty and fruity aromas, leading to flavours of strawberry. The bubbles add to the creamy texture." (December 2016)

It's a ripe, sexy, beautiful red that has lots of ripe red and black fruits, liquid flowers, incense and violets." (Feb 2018)

name: FAUGERES - DOMAINE OLLIER TAILLEFER GRANDE RESERVE 2017
nameSanitized: faugeres - domaine ollier taillefer grande reserve 2017
