tastingDescription: Silver (90 points), Decanter World Wine Awards: "Bright bramble fruit and distinctive black pepper notes; rustic and complex with a meaty structure and rich, ripe tannins." (September 2020)

name: FERN WALK - PINOT GRIS
tastingDescription: Our Pinot Gris is unoaked to preserve the fresh varietal character. Th e colour is a gorgeous golden with pinkish hues. The wine has amazing minerality and spice that is complemented by flavours of apricot, papaya, passionfruit and aromatic honey blossoms.

name: FERN WALK - PINOT NOIR
tastingDescription: This BC Pinot Noir features fresh strawberries, dark cherries and hints of floral that intertwine with silky tannins and touches of vanilla

name: FERN WALK - SAUVIGNON BLANC
tastingDescription: The Sauvignon Blanc is medium-bodied with subtle grassy notes, tropical fruit including kiwi and passionfruit, and vibrant citrus flavours with a delightful balanced acidity. The finish is crisp with a touch of lemon. Try with grilled fare, pasta dishes or salad courses.

name: FERN WALK -ROSE
tastingDescription: The cool purity in the air on a spring morning walk. The feathery touch of a fern. Our Osoyoos and Black Sage vineyards evoke these same sensations. Vines that dance lightly in the breeze. Fruit lush as morning's first light. Bright, fresh, wild strawberries and a bright, soft creamy palette.

name: FERRARI - TRENTO BRUT METODO CLASSICO
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine Advocate - "Here is a classic Italian metodo classico sparkling wine that you can count on for a long list of drinking occasions. The non-vintage Trento Brut is luminous and bright with measured intensity that hits all the right buttons. Drink: 2016 - 2022." (May 2016)

name: FERREIRA - VINTAGE PORT 2018
tastingDescription: 100 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "This impressively structured wine shows a perfect balance between its powerful, spicy fruits and firm tannins. Dense tones of dark berries and smoke are rich and flavorful, bringing the wine to a perfect conclusion. It's immensely ageworthy. Drink from 2030." (Dec 2020)

name: FITZPATRICK FAMILY VINEYARDS - FITZ BRUT 2017
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Beppi Crosariol (The Globe and Mail) - "Aged for 24 months on the lees, it displays excellent concentration and layering, with big notes of orchard fruit and bread..." (November 2018)

name: FITZPATRICK FAMILY VINEYARDS - FITZ EXTRA BRUT 2017
nameSanitized: fitzpatrick family vineyards - fitz extra brut 2017
sort: FITZPATRICK FAMILY VINEYARDS - FITZ EXTRA BRUT 2017
tastingDescription: False

name: FITZPATRICK FAMILY VINEYARDS - RUNABOUT WHITE 2020
tastingDescription: The Runabout is a blend of all the estate grown white grapes:  Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc, Ehrenfelser, Gewurztraminer and Riesling.  Peach and melon aromatics.  A crisp apple start to the palate with tropical notes, finishes round and refreshing with good weight.

name: FIXIN 1ER CLOS DE LA PERRIERE MONOPOLE - ALBERT BICHOT 2018
namePrefix: FIXIN 1ER CLOS DE LA PERRIERE MONOPOLE
nameSanitized: fixin 1er clos de la perriere monopole - albert bichot 2018
sort: FIXIN 1ER CLOS DE LA PERRIERE MONOPOLE - ALBERT BICHOT 2018
tastingDescription: 90-92 Points, Wine Advocate: "...a fragrant, perfumed bouquet with open red cherry and crushed strawberry fruit, one of the most attractive among Bichot's 2015s. The palate is medium-bodied with fleshy red cherry and raspberry fruit, good depth and a crisp line of acidity. It feels sensual towards the smooth finish... Drink: 2018 - 2028." (December 2017)

name: FLEUR DE MIRAVAL - ROSE
tastingDescription: 94 points, Wine Decanter: "An extraordinary achievement this, made by the famously difficult saignée method, yet with a wonderful onion skin colour and poised aromas of lemongrass, small red berried fruit and pink grapefruit." (October 2020)

name: FLORIO - MARSALA SUPERIOR DOLCE VECCHIOFLORIO 2015
tastingDescription: This vintage dated Marsala awarded Best Fortified Wine (Vancouver Magazine Wine awards) as featured in TASTE Fall Issue 2013, is amber coloured with old gold highlights. Extremely fine with scents of raisins, liquorice, dates and vanilla. Warm and full palate, with an after-taste of ripe fruit and raisins. Its versatile use ranges from cooking classic Marsala dishes, Tiramisu and Zabaglione. It can also be enjoyed as an aperitif , an accompaniment to desserts such as butter tarts and drizzled on vanilla ice cream with candied walnuts.

name: FONSECA - 10 YEAR OLD TAWNY
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Gismondi on Wine:  "Mellow with spiced fruitcake, walnuts, golden raisin compote and black tea. A smooth, silky, extended finish that persists for minutes. Youthful, but ready to drink." Nov 2019

name: FONSECA - BIN 27 RESERVE
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Decanter World Wine Awards:  "*Silver Medal* A lovely plum and strawberry character with nicely-integrated touches of spice, liquorice, cocoa and kirsch. Good value." Sept 2020

name: FONSECA - TERRA PRIMA RESERVE ORGANIC
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Decanter World Wine Awards:  "One of very few organic Ports. Exuberant dark cherry and ripe cassis - big, bold and upfront fruit. Firm, ripe peppery tannins and a long finish. Reserve Ports do not get better than this." Dec 2017

name: FONSECA - VINTAGE 2003
tastingDescription: 96 Points, Wine Spectator - "Lots of grape and raisin on the nose. Full-bodied, chewy and lightly sweet. Serious concentration, with lots of grip on the finish. Just what to expect from a young Vintage Port. Best after 2012." (April 2006)

name: FONSECA - VINTAGE 2007
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Wine Advocate - "The 2007 Fonseca is maturing nicely, with a perfumed, high toned, rich bouquet of macerated black cherries, blueberry, creme de cassis and vanilla. The palate is very harmonious with plush dark cherry fruit, fresh fig, salted licorice and a supple, rounded, spicy finish that delivers wonderful purity and length. This is a sexy Fonseca, perhaps more generous and alluring than the 2009 – a quintessential Fonseca that should peak in 15-20 years time." (June 2013)

name: FONSECA - VINTAGE 2016
tastingDescription: 98 Points, James Suckling - "Lots of ripe fruit here with raisins and wet earth that turn to violets and hot stones. Full-bodied, tannic and powerful with fantastic grip and intensity. Grabs you. Impressive." (May 2018)

name: FONSECA - VINTAGE 2016
tastingDescription: 98 Points, James Suckling - "Lots of ripe fruit here with raisins and wet earth that turn to violets and hot stones. Full-bodied, tannic and powerful with fantastic grip and intensity. Grabs you. Impressive." (May 2018)

name: FONSECA - VINTAGE 2016
tastingDescription: 98 Points, James Suckling - "Lots of ripe fruit here with raisins and wet earth that turn to violets and hot stones. Full-bodied, tannic and powerful with fantastic grip and intensity. Grabs you. Impressive." (May 2018)

name: FORT BERENS - CHARDONNAY 2020
tastingDescription: Made primarily from estate grown Chardonnay grapes, this lightly oaked wine has aromas of yellow apples, lime, pear, and honey dew. Medium bodied with flavours of fresh peaches, apricot and granny smith apples leads to a light, toasty finish.

name: FORT BERENS - RIESLING 2020
tastingDescription: This crisp and just off dry Riesling is perfectly balanced with bright fruit aromas of pineapple and lychee.  Very versatile wine for pairing with any foods, including spicy foods, or drink as a casual sipper.

name: FOUR SHADOWS WINERY - MERLOT 2018
tastingDescription: This new Penticton winery is off to a good start. Showing plums, black currants and barrel notes, this Merlot is flavourful and persistent.

name: FOXTROT - FOXLY PINOT GRIS
tastingDescription: Foxtrot is a Burgundy specialist working the Naramata Bench as hand crafted Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. With Foxly the winery contracts fruit – in this case from Summerland – to craft more accessible wines with more output. Look for citrus, apple and floral notes, a fuller bodied Gris palate that has trademark BC acidity. Sold out at the winery but still available at BC Liquor Stores. 216 cs produced.

name: FOXTROT - PINOT NOIR THE WALTZ 2019
tastingDescription: Foxtrot's 2019 "The Waltz" Pinot Noir is a Burgundian-inspired blend with elegant structure, mineral backbone, and poignant combinations of your favourite Pinot Noir flavours: cherry, licorice root, white pepper, and earth.

name: FRANCE ROSE - LE PETIT CHAT MALIN
nameSanitized: france rose - le petit chat malin
sort: FRANCE ROSE - LE PETIT CHAT MALIN
tastingDescription: There’s a lot to like about this cheeky rosé from the Languedoc-Roussillon region of southern France. The name of this wine is a play on the Châteauneuf-du-Pape region. It’s cheery, bright and dry, with floral, red berry and white pepper notes and tastes of ripe berries, herbs and sweet spices. Enjoy with crab cakes, mussels and tuna tataki.

name: FRATELLI FICI - MARSALA SUPERIORE DRY
tastingDescription: Aged in oak cask for two years, this Marsala Superiore is not your average cooking wine. Its bouquet of nutty and caramel nuances is further enhanced by a creamy palate of vanilla and nuts.

name: FREIXENET - CAVA CARTA NEVADA SEMI SECO
nameSanitized: freixenet - cava carta nevada semi seco
sort: FREIXENET - CAVA CARTA NEVADA SEMI SECO
tastingDescription: Carta Nevada semi-seco has a brilliant balance of sweet and dry. The toasty aroma and fruity, flavourful palate deliver creamy, sweet peaches with smooth custard flavours. Just the right touch of acidity keeps it lively.

name: FREIXENET - CAVA CORDON NEGRO BRUT
tastingDescription: Cordon Negro Brut is a crisp, clean and well-balanced Cava sparkling wine. The fresh palate of apple, ripe pear and bright citrus flavours combine with a long finish and an exciting touch of ginger. This brilliant, versatile Cava goes well with just about everything.

name: FREIXENET - CAVA CORDON NEGRO GRAN SELECCION BRUT
nameSanitized: freixenet - cava cordon negro gran seleccion brut
nameSuffix: CAVA CORDON NEGRO GRAN SELECCION BRUT
sort: FREIXENET - CAVA CORDON NEGRO GRAN SELECCION BRUT
tastingDescription: Cordon Negro Brut is a crisp, clean and well-balanced Cava sparkling wine. The fresh palate of apple, ripe pear and bright citrus flavours combine with a long finish and an exciting touch of ginger. This brilliant, versatile Cava goes well with just about everything.

name: FREIXENET - CAVA CORDON NEGRO GRAN SELECCION BRUT
nameSanitized: freixenet - cava cordon negro gran seleccion brut
nameSuffix: CAVA CORDON NEGRO GRAN SELECCION BRUT
sort: FREIXENET - CAVA CORDON NEGRO GRAN SELECCION BRUT
tastingDescription: Cordon Negro Brut is a crisp, clean and well-balanced Cava sparkling wine. The fresh palate of apple, ripe pear and bright citrus flavours combine with a long finish and an exciting touch of ginger. This brilliant, versatile Cava goes well with just about everything.

name: FREIXENET - LEGERO
tastingDescription: A non-alcoholic sparkling wine produced by Freixenet. Just prior to bottling, before carbon dioxide is added for sparkle, the alcohol is gently removed by cold filtration, leaving less than 0.4% alcohol by volume. Pale yellow in colour with a nose full of ripe white peaches and pineapple. The palate is refreshing and full of mid-sized bubbles leading to a finish full of melon and citrus notes. The acidity and sweetness are in perfect balance.

name: FRESITA - SPARKLING WINE INFUSED WITH STRAWBERRIES
nameSanitized: fresita - sparkling wine infused with strawberries
sort: FRESITA - SPARKLING WINE INFUSED WITH STRAWBERRIES
tastingDescription: Real strawberries are infused into sparkling wine and bottled to produce this fun and enjoyable off-dry treat.

name: FRIND WINERY - BRUT
tastingDescription: Frind Brut is made with 76% Riesling and  24% Chardonnay. It was bottle aged for 15 months to complete the second fermentation process and for the flavours to marry in the bottle, before being disgorged. The continuous bubbles create a soft mouthfeel and pop with aromas of ripe pear, citrus and green apple. Enjoy on its own and celebrate the everyday!

name: FRIULI COLLI ORIENTALI RIBOLLA GIALLA - ROCCA BERNARDA 2017
nameSanitized: friuli colli orientali ribolla gialla - rocca bernarda 2017
sort: FRIULI COLLI ORIENTALI RIBOLLA GIALLA - ROCCA BERNARDA 2017
tastingDescription: This traditional Friulian variety first achieved prominence at Rocca Bernarda in the early decades of the 20th century, when the estate was owned by the Perusini family. Today’s wine still reveals its unique qualities. Extremely elegant and fruity, with notes of green apples. On the palate, it is fragrant and dry with a hint of softness.

name: FRIULI PINOT GRIGIO - DI LENARDO MONOVITIGNA
nameSanitized: friuli pinot grigio - di lenardo monovitigna
sort: FRIULI PINOT GRIGIO - DI LENARDO MONOVITIGNA
tastingDescription: Bouquet is very pleasant with a good array of varietal aromas such as pear Williams, banana, apricot and Acacia flowers. Taste is reminiscent of pear syrup and quince peel. Good acid balance good body and long finish. Mature wines have a bouquet of toasted almonds and straw.

name: FRIULI VENEZIA GIULIA PINOT GRIGIO RAMATO - SUN GODDESS
namePrefix: FRIULI VENEZIA GIULIA PINOT GRIGIO RAMATO
nameSanitized: friuli venezia giulia pinot grigio ramato - sun goddess
sort: FRIULI VENEZIA GIULIA PINOT GRIGIO RAMATO - SUN GODDESS
tastingDescription: The bouquet is intense and complex, with hints peach, melon and blackberries. On the palate it is full-bodied and velvety, with a pleasant acidity, sweet tannins and a finish rich in mineral sensations. The skins' pink hue give the wines color from a semi-pale pink to dark orange.

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU DE CARLES 2015
tastingDescription: False

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU DE LA DAUPHINE 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Château de la Dauphine was a knockout when I tasted it from barrel. Now in bottle, it has a very clean, precise bouquet of shimmering blackberry and wild strawberry aromas, underlying blood orange notes coming through with aeration. The palate is medium-bodied with grainy tannins, plenty of graphite-tinged black fruit and a very elegant yet long finish. Superb! Drinking Window: 2022 - 2040."
93 pts, Vinous

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU FONTENIL 2017
tastingDescription:
"Medium to deep garnet-purple colored the 2017 Fontenil comes prancing out of the glass with cheery kirsch and black raspberry scents followed by notions of warm plums, star anise and pencil shavings. Medium-bodied, the palate is elegant, stylish and refreshing with well-played, soft tannins and a perfumed finish. Drink: 2020 - 2032."
91 Points, Wine Advocate

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU FONTENIL 2018
tastingDescription:
"Deep garnet-purple colored, the 2018 Fontenil hits the ground running with vivacious notes of baked black plums, stewed black cherries and black raspberry preserves, followed by hints of molten licorice, ground cloves and sandalwood. The rich, full-bodied palate (15% alcohol) is jam-packed with black fruit preserves and exotic spice accents, framed by plush tannins and plenty of freshness, finishing long and perfumed. Drink Date: 2023 - 2039."
93 pts, Wine Advocate

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU HAUT CARLES 2015
tastingDescription: False

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU HERVE LAROQUE 2010
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine Spectator: "Sleek and very racy, with dark cherry, plum skin and linzer torte notes that are very brisk, but have excellent underlying depth. The finish lets cocoa and singed apple wood notes fill in, with a buried iron edge. Drink now through 2020." (2013)

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU LA DAUPHINE 2015
tastingDescription: 92 Points, James Suckling: "Very pretty aromas of perfume, currants and orange peel follow through to a full body, round and chewy tannins and a flavourful finish. Solid and structured. Give it two years to soften. Better in 2020." (February 2018)

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU LA DAUPHINE 2017
tastingDescription:
"Deep garnet-purple colored, the 2017 de la Dauphine prances out of the glass with pretty kirsch, baked raspberries and preserved plums scents with hints of stewed tea and potpourri. Medium-bodied, the palate has a plush texture and a great intensity of perfumed fruit, finishing fragrant. Drink: 2020 - 2030."
90 Points, Wine Advocate

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU LA VIEILLE CURE 2014
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Spectator: "Ripe and structured, this sports a vivid core of cassis and plum that races along, with fine-grained structure and light anise, bay and chalk notes hanging in the background. The long finish has cut and drive, with the cassis accent pushing through with determination. Rock-solid. Best from 2018 through 2026." (March 2017)

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU LA VIEILLE CURE 2017
tastingDescription:
"This is packed with plum and blackberry compote flavors, supported by graphite and smoldering tobacco notes. Everything melds through the solidly structured and toasty finish. Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2022 through 2030."
92 Points, Wine Spectator

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU LA VIEILLE CURE 2018
tastingDescription:
"The deep ruby-hued 2018 Château La Vieille Cure is a smoking wine that readers should snatch up! Lots of red and black currants, cedary spice, dried tobacco, and a touch of chalky minerality all emerge from the glass, and it's medium to full-bodied, with a fruit-loaded, concentrated mouthfeel, ripe tannins, and outstanding length. It has a touch of background oak, but that should integrate with 2-4 years in the cellar, and this gorgeous Fronsac will shine over the following decade or more."
93 pts, Jeb Dunnuck

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU MOULIN HAUT LAROQUE 2016
tastingDescription:
“Warm and ripe in feel, with a mix of plum sauce and steeped raspberry fruit flavors, inlaid liberally with tobacco and singed cedar notes that extend through the lightly earth-tinged finish. Has depth and length. For fans of the slightly rustic style. Drink now through 2028.”
90 Points, Wine Spectator

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU MOULIN HAUT LAROQUE 2018
tastingDescription:
"Juicy and compact, with red currant and black cherry fruit trying to burst out while light savory, singed cedar and floral notes dart through. Light chalky thread on the finish, which isn't dense, but does have ample energy. Very engaging. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Drink now through 2028."
91 pts, Wine Spectator

name: FRONSAC - CHATEAU TESSENDEY 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Tessendey is composed of 85% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Franc. Deep garnet-purple colored, it features stewed plums, baked black cherries and wild blueberries with hints of charcoal and fragrant earth. Medium to full-bodied with a firm grip of chewy tannins, it has just enough freshness to lift the dense fruit to a lively finish."
89-91 pts, Wine Advocate

name: FRONSAC - TOUR BELAIR TRADITION 2016
tastingDescription:
Ripe cherry, dried strawberry and floral aromas on the nose are complemented by spice and a hint of anise. Firm and chalky tannins balance the fruit and indicate this delicious wine will develop well for the next 3-5 years. 
92 Points, Barbara Philip MW

name: G MARQUIS - RIESLING ICEWINE SILVER LINE 2016
nameSanitized: g marquis - riesling icewine silver line 2016
sort: G MARQUIS - RIESLING ICEWINE SILVER LINE 2016
tastingDescription: The Silver Line VQA Riesling ice wine has an intense fruit profile of peach, apricot, tropical and citrus fruit with hints of figs and dates. Seductively creamy with a lasting mouthfeel culminating in a truly memorable and long finish.

name: G.S.M. - GRANT BURGE HOLY TRINITY BAROSSA 2014
nameSanitized: g.s.m. - grant burge holy trinity barossa 2014
sort: G.S.M. - GRANT BURGE HOLY TRINITY BAROSSA 2014
tastingDescription: The Holy Trinity is a Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre blend sourced from old vines and five different vineyards. The wine receives no new oak so the pedigree of fruit is on display and offers vibrant raspberry, rose petal and orange peel aromas with nuances of spice box and underbrush. Full-bodied and richly fruited in the mouth, it has a medium to firm level of velvety tannins, crisp acid and a long spicy finish. Enjoy it now or keep for a few years.

name: GALILEE RED - MOUNT HERMON INDIGO 2018 KOSHER
nameSanitized: galilee red - mount hermon indigo 2018 kosher
sort: GALILEE RED - MOUNT HERMON INDIGO 2018 KOSHER
tastingDescription: Black currant, tobacco and smoke carry the nose. Medium bodied with notes of raspberry and black cherry, characters of aniseed and cocoa, and hints of flowers and earth. Try this with beef brisket, grilled lamb shanks or with a barbecue beef burger.

name: GALLIPOLI PENINSULA KARASAKIZ - SUVLA 2018
tastingDescription: It has a bright red cherry colour and it shows the notes of smashed strawberries, plum, laurel, black fig and thyme on the nose. Flavourful and full textured, Karasakiz has a balanced acidity and a pleasant persistent finish.

name: GAMBRINUS - ROSE DI PINOT BRUT ROSA
nameSanitized: gambrinus - rose di pinot brut rosa
sort: GAMBRINUS - ROSE DI PINOT BRUT ROSA
tastingDescription: VSQ quality Brut spumante, long Charmat method, 12% alc./vol, produced by soft pressing of Pinot Noir, Pinot Blanc and Pinot Grigio grapes from the province of Treviso.  It is dry and fresh, with a hint of roses and violet on the nose.  On the palette, a touch of berries, a hint of cherry and tropical fruit. The perlage is fine and long-lasting.

name: GARNACH - RUNNING WITH BULLS BAROSSA 2018
tastingDescription: There are notes of roasted cinnamon, rose and mint. A juicy and vibrant palate full of cherry, liquorice and rhubarb with quartz like tannins.

name: GEHRINGER - AUXERROIS OLD VINES GOLDEN MILE BENCH 2020
nameSanitized: gehringer - auxerrois old vines golden mile bench 2020
nameSuffix: AUXERROIS OLD VINES GOLDEN MILE BENCH 2020
sort: GEHRINGER - AUXERROIS OLD VINES GOLDEN MILE BENCH 2020
tastingDescription: An elegant white wine, only a handful of wineries produce this in BC. And do it well as there is always a hint of tropical fruit along with good acidity and tree fruit notes too. Perfect with salad courses, seafood or pasta.

name: GEHRINGER - CHARDONNAY UNOAKED DRY ROCK GOLDEN MILE BENCH 19
nameSanitized: gehringer - chardonnay unoaked dry rock golden mile bench 19
nameSuffix: CHARDONNAY UNOAKED DRY ROCK GOLDEN MILE BENCH 19
sort: GEHRINGER - CHARDONNAY UNOAKED DRY ROCK GOLDEN MILE BENCH 19
tastingDescription: False

name: GEHRINGER - DRY ROCK CABERNET MERLOT 2020
tastingDescription: This juicy red wine is done in stainless steel fermenters and could be easily mistaken for a fine Beaujolais with its damson plum, black cherry and blueberry aromas and its medium-bodied palate. Flavours of blackberry, blueberry, cassis and a touch of herbaceousness hang on the long finish. This lighter, juicier style red wine is a great match for quail, chicken and duck.

name: GEHRINGER - EHRENFELSER 2019
tastingDescription: As produced by a handful of BC producers, Ehrenfelser is a unique varietal from Germany that does very well here in the Okanagan Valley. Offering spicy peachy notes and distinct mouth feel, it is a good wine to go with Pacific Rim cuisine or risotto or bbq chicken. Enjoy.

name: GEHRINGER - PRIVATE RESERVE DRY RIESLING 2020
tastingDescription: All the great flavours Riesling has to offer without all the sweetness. Orange and lime zest play with melon, honey and a touch of spice in this clean-finishing expression

name: GEHRINGER - PRIVATE RESERVE PINOT GRIS 2020
tastingDescription: Located on the Golden Mile, Gehringer dates back to the 1985 with their first vintage. In the glass for you is their Pinot Gris, which offers citrus and apple hints with good acidity. Will work with salmon dishes or pasta or grilled poultry.

name: GEHRINGER - PRIVATE RESERVE PINOT NOIR 2019
tastingDescription: False

name: GEHRINGER - RIESLING 2020
tastingDescription: Located on the Golden Mile, Gehringer dates back to 1985 with their first vintage. A hallmark of the Riesling grape is the fresh acidity that for some elevates it to being the ultimate food wine! So in a pinch match to takeout sushi or ham steak or salad course or cheese fondue.

name: GEHRINGER - SIGNATURE CABERNET FRANC ICEWINE BOX 19
nameSanitized: gehringer - signature cabernet franc icewine box 19
sort: GEHRINGER - SIGNATURE CABERNET FRANC ICEWINE BOX 19
tastingDescription: Red icewine is relatively rare and this one is loaded with notes of strawberry, raspberry and rhubarb. A lively acidity balances the sweet finish.

name: GEHRINGER - SIGNATURE RIESLING ICEWINE IN WOOD BOX 2019
nameSanitized: gehringer - signature riesling icewine in wood box 2019
nameSuffix: SIGNATURE RIESLING ICEWINE IN WOOD BOX 2019
sort: GEHRINGER - SIGNATURE RIESLING ICEWINE IN WOOD BOX 2019
tastingDescription: From one of the valley's most consistent producers: a great example, with a honeyed top, focused fruit, green apple and lime notes wrapped in keen acidity that keeps it from being cloying. Think goat's cheese and vanilla ice cream garnished with kiwi fruit or mandarin orange.

name: GEKKEIKAN - DAIGINJO YAMADA NISHIKI
tastingDescription: This premium daiginjo sake is made with Yamada Nishiki rice, often known as the �king of sake rice� for its quality and the flavor it imparts on the sake. With the rice painstakingly polished to only 45% of its original size, this daiginjo has a delicately fruity nose, a smooth, well-balanced flavor and a clean finish.

name: GEKKEIKAN - GOLD JUNMAI SAKE
tastingDescription: Lightly fragrant, full-bodied, elegant, smooth finish. Enjoy with rich, flavorful sauces and red meat dishes.

class: Other Country Fruit and Dessert Wine
name: GEKKEIKAN - JAPANESE PLUM WINE
tastingDescription: Amber yellow in colour, this fruit wine has aromas of sweet dried fruit, butter and toffee. The natural sweet plum flavour is complemented by toffee notes and just a hint of tartness to balance the palate.

name: GEKKEIKAN - NAMASAKE DRAFT SAKE
tastingDescription: Light, clean flavor, with hints of banana and a refreshing light finish. Pairs well with light dishes, appetizers, seaweed salads, shellfish, steamed dishes and dim sum. Best served chilled or on the rocks. Refrigerate after opening.

name: GEKKEIKAN - SAKE
tastingDescription: Gekkeikan Sake is herbaceous with hints of grapefruit and a light earthiness. Good acidity, mineral driven, and well balanced with a clean, medium finish. This versatile sake can be enjoyed warm, at room temperature, or chilled. Also excellent for sake cocktails.

name: GEKKEIKAN - SAKE
tastingDescription: Gekkeikan Sake is herbaceous with hints of grapefruit and a light earthiness. Good acidity, mineral driven, and well balanced with a clean, medium finish. This versatile sake can be enjoyed warm, at room temperature, or chilled. Also excellent for sake cocktails.

name: GEKKEIKAN - SAKE
tastingDescription: Herbaceous with hints of grapefruit and a light earthiness. Good acidity, mineral driven, well-balanced with a clean, medium finish. It is delicious with tempura, full flavored fish and shellfish, fresh green vegetable dishes, and coconut-based Asian dishes. A flavorful base for stocks and marinades.

name: GEKKEIKAN - TARU SAKE
tastingDescription: Gekkeikan�s signature sake is used to make this Taru (�barrel�) Sake. After the sake is pressed, it is matured in cedar wood casks for up to 2 weeks, carefully monitored to produce just the right amount of flavour. The result is a invigorating, fresh wood aroma on top of the smooth umami-rich body of the sake. Be sure to enjoy the aroma before taking a sip of this versatile sake, which can be enjoyed chilled or warm.

name: GERRY CHAMBERTIN 1ER LE POISSENOT - GEANTET PANSIOT 2018
nameSanitized: gerry chambertin 1er le poissenot - geantet pansiot 2018
sort: GERRY CHAMBERTIN 1ER LE POISSENOT - GEANTET PANSIOT 2018
tastingDescription: The 2018 Gevrey-Chambertin 1er Cru Le Poissenot has a ripe, candied bouquet with vanilla scents infusing the macerated mixed berries, cherries and creme de cassis, along with hints of smoked meat, spices and undergrowth in the background. Mouth-coating bu

name: GETARIAKO TXAKOLINA TXAKOLI - BASA LORE
tastingDescription: False

name: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN - DAVID DUBAND 2016
tastingDescription: False

name: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN - DOMAINE TAUPENOT MERME 2016
tastingDescription: 88-90 Points, Wine Advocate: “The 2016 Gevrey-Chambertin Village has been a consistent performer at the domaine. It has a clean and precise bouquet... The palate is medium-bodied with fine tannin, elegant and bright with tart red fruit with a tang of spice towards the finish. Drink: 2019 - 2030.” (December 2017)

name: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN - SERAFIN PERE & FILS 2014
tastingDescription: 87-90 Points, Burghound: "This is a classic Gevrey with aromas of dark berries, pungent earth and plenty of sauvage character. There is good volume to the lush,round and generously proportioned middle weight flavors that are also rather robust." (January 2016)

name: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN 1ER  LES CAZETIERS - SERAFIN 2014
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Advocate: "The 2014 Gevrey-Chambertin 1er Cru Les Cazetiers has a lifted bouquet, very well defined… The palate is medium-bodied with supple tannins, fine acidity, the oak neatly integrated here and allowing the terroir to show through on the clean, precise, minerally finish. This is just a lovely Gevrey-Chambertin from Serafin. Drink: 2020 - 2038." (June 2017)

name: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN 1ER ESTOURNELLES ST JACQUES - DOM JADOT
nameSanitized: gevrey chambertin 1er estournelles st jacques - dom jadot
sort: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN 1ER ESTOURNELLES ST JACQUES - DOM JADOT
tastingDescription: 92-94 Points, Antonio Galloni's Vinous - "The 2017 Gevrey-Chambertin Estournelles Saint-Jacques 1er Cru has a slightly minty, generous bouquet compared to the Les Cazetiers, very pure in style and nicely defined. The palate is supple on the entry and smooth in texture, with a plump, caressing and quite detailed finish that is very classy. A little gem from Jadot." (Janurary, 2019).

name: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN 1ER LAVAUX ST JACQUES - ALBERT BICHOT 2016
nameSanitized: gevrey chambertin 1er lavaux st jacques - albert bichot 2016
sort: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN 1ER LAVAUX ST JACQUES - ALBERT BICHOT 2016
tastingDescription: 88-90 Points, Wine Advocate: "…It has a tightly wound bouquet with dark berry fruit, a touch of damp soil and dried blood with good vigor all around. The palate is medium-bodied with slightly sharp tannin and plenty of sour cherry and strawberry fruit… Drink: 2020 - 2033." (December 2017)

name: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN 1ER LAVAUX ST JACQUES - DOM TORTOCHOT 2016
nameSanitized: gevrey chambertin 1er lavaux st jacques - dom tortochot 2016
sort: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN 1ER LAVAUX ST JACQUES - DOM TORTOCHOT 2016

sort: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN 1ER LES CAZETIERS - DOMAINE FAIVELEY 2016
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "This wine is already well balanced. Ripe strawberries and red cherries are shot through with the acidity of the vintage. The tannins are present, complementing the already attractive fruits. The aftertaste shows the considerable potential with its tannins. Drink from 2020." (August 2016)

name: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN 1ER PETITE CHAPELLE - DUGAT PY 2015
nameSanitized: gevrey chambertin 1er petite chapelle - dugat py 2015
sort: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN 1ER PETITE CHAPELLE - DUGAT PY 2015
tastingDescription: 91-93 Points, Wine Advocate: "...[this] comes from three parcels of vine that are an average of 70 years old… The palate is medium-bodied with succulent ripe black fruit, the new oak absorbed well and allowing tension and energy to flow through the sorbet-fresh finish... Drink: 2021 - 2045." (December 2016)

name: GEVREY CHAMBERTIN EN CHAMPS - GEANTET PANSIOT 2016
nameSanitized: gevrey chambertin en champs - geantet pansiot 2016
