name: LAMBRUSCO REGGIANO FRIZZANTE - LINI 910 LABRUSCA
tastingDescription: “It seems like we are at the beginning of a huge Lambrusco trend. Bursting with bright berry, this purple bubble will make you smile. It has balanced aromas and flavours of ripe blueberry and raspberry with an intensely flavourful and slightly tannic finish. Very food-friendly!” - Barbara Philip, MW, Category Manager for Wines of Europe, Sparkling & Fortified

name: LAMBRUSCO REGGIANO FRIZZANTE - MEDICI ERMETE CONCERTO
nameSanitized: lambrusco reggiano frizzante - medici ermete concerto
sort: LAMBRUSCO REGGIANO FRIZZANTE - MEDICI ERMETE CONCERTO
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine & Spirits - "This wine’s glass-staining magenta hue signals densely concentrated flavors of ripe plum, crushed raspberry and black cherry. A black loam earthiness underlies those fruit flavors, and a firm mousse propels the flavors forward to a refreshing finish."

name: LANCELOT ROYER - CUVEE RESERVE BRUT RR
nameSanitized: lancelot royer - cuvee reserve brut rr
sort: LANCELOT ROYER - CUVEE RESERVE BRUT RR
tastingDescription: False

name: LANCELOT-PIENNE - TABLE RONDE GRAND CRU BLANC DE BLANC EXTRA
nameSanitized: lancelot-pienne - table ronde grand cru blanc de blanc extra
nameSuffix: PIENNE - TABLE RONDE GRAND CRU BLANC DE BLANC EXTRA
sort: LANCELOT-PIENNE - TABLE RONDE GRAND CRU BLANC DE BLANC EXTRA
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Advocate: "Bursting with aromas of warm bread, fresh peach, citrus fruit and dried white flowers, it's full-bodied, fleshy and open, with an enveloping core of fruit, ripe but lively acids and a pillowy mousse". (September, 2020).

name: LANGHE ARNEIS - MASSIMO RIVETTI AURELIA ORGANIC
nameSanitized: langhe arneis - massimo rivetti aurelia organic
sort: LANGHE ARNEIS - MASSIMO RIVETTI AURELIA ORGANIC
tastingDescription: False

name: LANGHE NEBBIOLO - BORGOGNO NO NAME 2015
tastingDescription: 89 Points, Wine Advocate: “Here's a Barolo, non-Barolo that prefers to go incognito as the 2014 Langhe Nebbiolo No Name... The approach is cheerful and informal, yet you also get the depth and aromatic intensity that you should demand of an aged Nebbiolo released four years after the harvest. Drink: 2020 - 2030.” (September 2018)

name: LANGHE NEBBIOLO - GIOVANNI ROSSO 2017
tastingDescription: Burgundy-trained winemaker Davide Rosso leads one of Barolo’s most fascinating wineries. The Rosso family’s Serralunga d’Alba vineyard plots are farmed according to organic and biodynamic practices. Langhe Nebbiolo is made in an earlier-drinking style than Barberesco and Barolo – a “Baby Barolo,” if you will.

name: LANGHE NEBBIOLO - PRODUTTORI DEL BARBARESCO 2019
tastingDescription: The Langhe Nebbiolo is made with hand-selected grapes from 100 hectares of vineyards owned by members of the Produttori's co-operative. Their vines strategically face south, west and east for optimal exposure and heard from the same plots as their nine single vineyards. The 2019 vintage is full-bodied with silky tannins, fresh acidity and notes of red cherry, star anise, and leather.

name: LANGHE NEBBIOLO - SOTTIMANO
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Advocate: You could easily stock up guilt-free on the 2020 Langhe Nebbiolo. The wine knocks it out of the ballpark in this vintage. It shows lovely concentration and lots of color saturation that only comes to Nebbiolo in the best vintages. The bouquet reveals quality fruit with bold cherry and fresh blackberry. The results are especially bright and full of juicy fruit flavors. This is a well-priced option to recommend en masse for your favorite weekday meals. Production is 10,000 bottles.

name: LANGUEDOC CHARDONNAY - GERARD BERTRAND DOMAINE DE L'AIGLE
nameSanitized: languedoc chardonnay - gerard bertrand domaine de laigle
sort: LANGUEDOC CHARDONNAY - GERARD BERTRAND DOMAINE DE L'AIGLE
tastingDescription: 90 Points Robert Parker: "This wine includes both tank and barrel-matured components. It's ripe and fairly full-bodied, with tropical notes (guava and pineapple), hints of toasty oak and bright lemon-lime flavors. Custard-textured and plump on the palate, it finishes with hints of silk and grilled citrus." (June 2020)

name: LANGUEDOC GRES DE MONTPELIER - CLOS DE L'AMANDAIE 2017
nameSanitized: languedoc gres de montpelier - clos de lamandaie 2017
sort: LANGUEDOC GRES DE MONTPELIER - CLOS DE L'AMANDAIE 2017
tastingDescription: 91 points, winescores.ca - "This classic earthy Languedoc rouge dives deep into the savoury spectrum with notes of toasted spice, pipe tobacco and charred meat underscored by blackberry, plum and dried violets. It has a fresh entry, grows textural mid-palate and delivers a muddle of wild berries, garrigue, grilling meat, dark cocoa and espresso flavours." (January 2021)

name: LANGUEDOC PICPOUL DE PINET - ORMARINE
tastingDescription: Few wines are as fresh and quenching as this Picpoul de Pinet. It is perfect as an aperitif with or without fresh seafood. This aromatic white from the Languedoc on the Mediterranean coast is a brilliant pale gold colour and bursting with scents of white flowers, passion fruit and citrus peel. Dry, fruity and lively in the mouth, this new varietal is ideal with grilled fish, seafood, rich cheese and charcuterie.

name: LANGUEDOC ROSE - GERARD BERTRAND COTE DES ROSES 2020
nameSanitized: languedoc rose - gerard bertrand cote des roses 2020
sort: LANGUEDOC ROSE - GERARD BERTRAND COTE DES ROSES 2020
tastingDescription: Gold Medal 92+ Points, Global Rose Master: "The bouquet releases aromas of summer fruits, cassis and redcurrant. Floral notes of rose along with hints of grapefruit complete the picture. The finish is fresh, offering notes of candy, with great aromatic persistence and balance."

name: LANGUEDOC ROSE - GERARD BERTRAND COTE DES ROSES 2020
nameSanitized: languedoc rose - gerard bertrand cote des roses 2020
sort: LANGUEDOC ROSE - GERARD BERTRAND COTE DES ROSES 2020
tastingDescription: Gold Medal 92+ Points, Global Rose Master:  "The bouquet releases aromas of summer fruits, cassis and redcurrant. Floral notes of rose along with hints of grapefruit complete the picture. The finish is fresh, offering notes of candy, with great aromatic persistence and balance."

name: LANGUEDOC ROUSSILLON - GERARD BERTRAND L'HOSPITALITAS
tastingDescription: 95 Points Wine Advocate: "The 2018 La Clape L'Hospitalitas is a blend of Syrah and Mourvèdre, aged a year in new French oak. Garrigue, blackberries, black olives and salted licorice on the nose, a full-bodied palate supported by ripe tannins and plenty of length and intensity on the finish. It's a big, beautiful beast capable of drinking well for a decade or more." (June 2020)

name: LANGUEDOC ROUSSILLON - GERARD BERTRAND ORANGE GOLD
nameSanitized: languedoc roussillon - gerard bertrand orange gold
sort: LANGUEDOC ROUSSILLON - GERARD BERTRAND ORANGE GOLD
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Jamie Goode: "Fermented for 10-15 days on skins, then pressed to stainless steel, and then finished off in barrel. A golden colour with aromas of mandarin, spice, marmalade and table grapes. The palate is complex, fresh, spicy and grippy with grapefruit, spice and a refined structure. So interesting." (February 2021)

name: LANGUEDOC WHITE -  GERARD BERTRAND COTE DES ROSES
nameSanitized: languedoc white -  gerard bertrand cote des roses
sort: LANGUEDOC WHITE -  GERARD BERTRAND COTE DES ROSES
tastingDescription: This cuvée boasts a lovely yellow colour with golden tints. It is fresh and intense on the nose, revealing aromas of citrus and exotic fruits, flowers and notes of candy, pear and pineapple. The fresh, flavoursome palate is lively, precise and pure thanks to the clear mineral backdrop.

name: LANSON - BRUT ROSE
tastingDescription: Beautiful salmon hues with brilliant small bubbles. The nose recalls aromas of roses and delicate red berry notes. On the palate, the impact is gentle leading into a very long finish. Its unmistakable originality is its most attractive feature along with the harmonious balance it strikes between fullness and freshness.

name: LANSON - LE GREEN LABEL BRUT
tastingDescription: 95 points - James Suckling; 94 points - Wine Enthusiast; 92 points Wine Spectator - Highly Accolated! The palate starts vibrant, dynamic and full of potential. The mid-palate is well rounded, with notes of pomegranate and papaya with a long and spicy finish. A perfect balance between power and freshness.

name: LANZAROTE LISTAN NEGRO - LOS BERMEJOS MACERACION CARBONICA
nameSanitized: lanzarote listan negro - los bermejos maceracion carbonica
sort: LANZAROTE LISTAN NEGRO - LOS BERMEJOS MACERACION CARBONICA
tastingDescription: Ruby red with aromas of dark black fruits, blueberry, clove, and baking spice. Dry on the palate with moderate acidity, soft tannins, balanced alcohol, and lively fruit flavours leading to a warm finish. Excellent with pasta in tomato sauce, duck, Osso Buco, or simply a juicy steak.

name: LANZAROTE MALVASIA VOLCANICA - LOS BERMEJOS SECO 2019
nameSanitized: lanzarote malvasia volcanica - los bermejos seco 2019
sort: LANZAROTE MALVASIA VOLCANICA - LOS BERMEJOS SECO 2019
tastingDescription: Light gold with a green tint, this Malvasia has a floral aroma mingled with mango, citrus, and mineral notes. Crisp on the palate with good fruit, nuances of dried herbs, and a minerality that leads to a medium-long finish. Excellent with light appetizers, shellfish, seafood, and cheeses.

name: LARCH HILLS - GRANDVIEW BENCH RED 2018
tastingDescription: This Northern Okanagan winery (Larch hills is located at Salmon Arm) has crafted a red blend from five varietals that shows currant berry, spicy hints and red fruits. Try with everyday menus like pasta, grilled meats and veggies.

name: LARCH HILLS - ORTEGA 2020
tastingDescription: A German varietal that seems to thrive in cooler BC locations, Ortega offers subtle tree fruit notes and crisp acidity. A great sipper or try with salad courses, seafood recipes or poultry dishes.

name: LARMANDIER BERNIER - LATITUDE BLANC DE BLANCS EXTRA BRUT
nameSanitized: larmandier bernier - latitude blanc de blancs extra brut
nameSuffix: LATITUDE BLANC DE BLANCS EXTRA BRUT
sort: LARMANDIER BERNIER - LATITUDE BLANC DE BLANCS EXTRA BRUT
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Decanter: "Chalky minerality, lemon peel and spring blossom on the palate and the smell of freshly-baked bread. Tiny bubbles."

name: LAUGHING STOCK VINEYARDS - PORTFOLIO 2017
tastingDescription: The 2016 Portfolio is a Merlot-based Bordeaux blend that features dark and red plum notes that leap onto the palate, followed by some vanilla, cedar and tobacco notes.

name: LAURENT PERRIER - CUVEE ROSE BRUT
tastingDescription: 92 points, James Suckling - Very fruity with lots of strawberry and cherry character. Full and flavorful. Soft and fruity. Delicious and opulent aftertaste. Fruitier style. Drink now." (September 2 , 2019)

name: LAURENT PERRIER - CUVEE ROSE BRUT
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "This great rosé combines texture with bright fruit and a bit of age. It is poised between a ripe dosage and a crisp texture, with red fruits and toastiness marking the flavors. It is a fine bottling to enjoy now." (December 2020)

name: LAURENT-PERRIER - BLANC DE BLANCS BRUT NATURE
nameSanitized: laurent-perrier - blanc de blancs brut nature
nameSuffix: PERRIER - BLANC DE BLANCS BRUT NATURE
sort: LAURENT-PERRIER - BLANC DE BLANCS BRUT NATURE
tastingDescription: False

name: LAZIO CESANESE - CASALE DEL GIGLIO 2017
tastingDescription: Produced from Cesanese, an indigenous grape of Italy, this wine is deep ruby red with intense aromas of marasca cherry followed by spicy notes of white pepper, black pepper and violets. On the palate, it is soft and well balanced with persistent tannins and pronounced acidity, essential criteria for long aging. Excellent with white meat, turkey, or savory stew.

name: LE CLARENCE DE HAUT-BRION ROUGE 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Le Clarence de Haut-Brion is an absolutely gorgeous, vivid wine endowed with tremendous aromatic intensity and stunning beauty. Gravel, tobacco, smoke and dark fruit all open up in the glass, but it is the wine's total sense of allure that is most captivating. The Clarence seems to have firmed up a bit following its bottling in June, but that is not at all a bad thing. Today, it is memorable. There is not much more I can add.”
94 Points, Vinous

name: LE CONTRADE - CO.PRO.VI 2016
tastingDescription: A full-bodied red wine, rich with fruity aromas that reveal flavours of berries on the palate. Vinous, harmonious and with the right amount of tannins. A very versatile wine, Le Contrade Rosso is an excellent companion to pasta dishes, barbecue or roasted meats and cheeses.

name: LE CORTON GRAND CRU - DOMAINE BOUCHARD PERE 2015
nameSanitized: le corton grand cru - domaine bouchard pere 2015
sort: LE CORTON GRAND CRU - DOMAINE BOUCHARD PERE 2015
tastingDescription: 93-95 Points, Burghound: "...there is excellent verve to the intense, pure, robust and beautifully well-detailed flavors that are underpinned by moderately rustic tannins, all wrapped in a reserved, structured, powerful and impressively persistent finish. This is a big wine and should be capable of a long life." (May 2011)

name: LE DEFI DE FONTENIL 2015
tastingDescription: 94 Points, James Suckling: "The wood is turned up here, adding toasted spices to ripe plum and cassis aromas; this is a showy nose. The palate has a smooth, dense array of fine tannins that carry plenty of flavor. Good depth and detail here. Long and fresh. Carries the oak nicely. Try from 2022." (February 2018)

name: LE DEFI DE FONTENIL 2016
tastingDescription:
“The deep garnet-purple colored 2016 Le Defi Fontenil sings of crushed black plums, chocolate-covered cherries and raspberry tart with hints of roses, espresso, licorice and cloves plus a waft of cedar. Medium to full-bodied, the palate delivers a great core of black fruit and loads of spicy accents, framed by grainy tannins and finishing long and earthy. Drink: 2019 - 2037.”
93+ Points, Wine Advocate

name: LE VILLAGEOIS RED - CELLIERS LA SALLE
nameSanitized: le villageois red - celliers la salle
sort: LE VILLAGEOIS RED - CELLIERS LA SALLE
tastingDescription: False

name: LE VILLAGEOIS WHITE - CELLIERS LA SALLE
nameSanitized: le villageois white - celliers la salle
sort: LE VILLAGEOIS WHITE - CELLIERS LA SALLE
tastingDescription: A fresh and dry white wine with a hint of floral aroma. It is an excellent aperitif and is a perfect companion with white meat, grilled meat, pastas, fish and cheeses. Serve between 8° and 10°C.

name: LESSONA - VIGNETI DE MARCHI PROPRIETA SPERINO 2015
nameSanitized: lessona - vigneti de marchi proprieta sperino 2015
sort: LESSONA - VIGNETI DE MARCHI PROPRIETA SPERINO 2015
tastingDescription: The finest, mineral and aromatic side of Nebbiolo: perfumed with aromas of wild berries, violets and a touch of smoky spice from the oak ageing. Its lifted acidity is balanced by ripe, delicate fruit and lovely raspberry fruit on the finish.

name: LIEBFRAUMILCH - KRAEMER
tastingDescription: A pleasant blend of Riesling and Sylvaner with good fruit aromas, a light body and a  slightly sweet finish. A wine for everyday that pairs well with spicy foods.

name: LILLET BLANC
tastingDescription: This versatile fortified aromatic wine is produced from a blend of macerated liqueurs steeped in secret botanicals to meld a balance of bitter and sweet. It’s perfect for solo sipping pre-dinner – just add a slice of orange or lemon. Lillet is also a crucial component in many classic cocktails.

name: LIRAC - DOMAINE MABY LA FERMADE 2018
tastingDescription: 91 points, Jeb Dunnick - “This Lirac is 54% Grenache, 24% Mourvèdre, 22% Syrah and is medium to full-bodied, concentrated and textured, with the fruit forward, sexy fruit profile of this terrific vintage. Leafy herbs, lavender, blueberries emerge from the glass and it has sweet tannin and outstanding length.”

name: LISBOA - CASA SANTOS LIMA LAB
tastingDescription: Very aromatic with notes of ripe black and red fruits. In the palate, juicy plums and dark berry fruit flavour with plenty of fresh yet fine tannins that take over at the finish, along with flavours of spice and liquorice.

name: LISBOA - CASA SANTOS LIMA LAB

name: LISBOA - VIDIGAL PORTA 6
tastingDescription: A complex wine with hints of red fruits, berries and dry fruit. Fruity and soft finish.

name: LISBOA RED BLEND - CASA SANTOS LIMA
nameSanitized: lisboa red blend - casa santos lima
sort: LISBOA RED BLEND - CASA SANTOS LIMA

nameSanitized: lisboa reserva - casa santa lima confidencial
sort: LISBOA RESERVA - CASA SANTA LIMA CONFIDENCIAL
tastingDescription: 10 "confidential" grape varieties go into this intensely lush wine. Aromatics of ripe plums, dark coffee, spice and vanilla lead into fleshy flavours of ripe fruit and shaved chocolate. Fine tannins hold this medium bodied wine together with medium acidity, revealing its graceful balance. Pair with bean casseroles, Shepherd's Pie or a savoury Tortière.

name: LISTRAC - CHATEAU CAP LEON VEYRIN 2016
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Cap Leon Veyrin is medium to deep garnet-purple in color with a nose of blackcurrant cordial, warm plums and cherries with touches of violets and cigar box. Medium-bodied, grainy and oak-laced, it offers plenty of juicy fruit and good length. Drink: 2019 - 2030.”
90 Points, Wine Advocate

name: LONGHAND - PINOT GRIGIO 2018
tastingDescription: Pinot Gris is a great wine for west coast cuisine. Offering apple, citrus and tropical hints, the juicy palate is so refreshing and made to be a sipper, with pasta dishes or salmon recipes.

name: LOUIS ROEDERER - BRUT PREMIER
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Spectator - "A bright and lacy Champagne, in an aperitif style, with citronella and smoke aromas to the rich flavors of crushed currant, lemon pastry cream and toast. Minerally finish. Drink now through 2021." (November 2017)

name: LOUIS ROEDERER - CRISTAL BRUT 2009
tastingDescription: Bright yellow hue flecked with gold. Its lively sparkle forms beautiful, even streams of bubbles. Aromas of citrus fruit (lemon) and fresh, zesty notes combined with soft tones of grilled hazelnuts and heady acacia flowers. After aeration, the wine develops hints of fresh wood, subtle spices (pepper, cardamom), cocoa beans, and honey nougat which add depth. The palate is simultaneously smooth, rounded and fresh. The attack is juicy, direct, concentrated and pure, yet exceptionally soft and gives way to a saline freshness endowing it with remarkable mineral precision and discreet elegance.

name: LOUIS ROEDERER - CRISTAL BRUT 2013
tastingDescription:
This product is restricted to 1 bottle limit.
98 Points, Vinous "The 2012 Cristal is another absolutely stellar wine this flight of recent releases. Rich, vinous and beautifully textured, the 2012 has been nothing short of magnificent on the three occasions I have tasted it so far. In the glass, the 2012 is radiant and luscious, yet it possesses remarkable transparency and striking aromatic depth. Light tropical notes develop in the glass, giving the 2012 a real feeling of exotic beauty. The 2012 is the first vintage of Cristal done with 100% organically-farmed fruit, an approach introduced gradually starting with the 2007 that has profoundly changes Cristal, especially in its aromatic breadth. Two thousand twelve is the vintage where endless trials and experiments in farming and winemaking are fully realized. The 2012 is just stunning. It's as simple as that. Dosage is just over 7 grams per liter, the lowest it has even been for Cristal. (Jan 2020)

name: LOUIS ROEDERER - CRISTAL ROSE 2012
tastingDescription: 98 Points, Wine Advocate " The 2012 Cristal Rose is showing brilliantly, unwinding in the glass with a beautiful bouquet of fresh peach, bergamot, strawberries, tangerine and blanched almonds that's still quite reserved. On the palate, the wine is full-bodied, deep and strikingly complete, its vinous attack segueing into a multidimensional core that exemplifies the ideal of power without weight, built around a racy but integrated spine of animating acidity and complemented by an exquisitely refined mousse. All the concentration of the 2012 vintage is on display, but it's rendered with terrific finesse. Decidedly youthful and introverted-indeed, I spent several hours with a bottle to compose this note-the 2012 will really come into its own with five or six years in the cellar and displays all the attributes necessary for considerable longevity. It's a blend of 56% Pinot Noir and 44% Chardonnay that saw no malolactic fermentation, and it was disgorged with eight grams per liter dosage.  (Feb 2020)

name: LOUIS ROEDERER - VINTAGE BRUT 2014
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Spectator - "This elegant Champagne is bright, with well-cut acidity married to a fine and creamy mousse and flavors of currant, toast, smoke-tinged mineral, white cherry and mandarin orange peel, followed by a fresh, lingering finish. Drink now through 2027." (November 2016)

name: LOVEBLOCK - PINOT NOIR 2017
tastingDescription: Bright crimson in colour. Aromas of big, ripe black cherry with hints of mushroom and beef Bovril peeking out behind rich fruit. Fleshy black plum, with layers of cherry and sweet berries that play on the palate and dance with hints of violet and savoury notes. Dry tannins and hints of cigar make this a versatile wine to pair with turkey, salmon, lamb and beef.

name: LOXTON - CABERNET SAUVIGNON
tastingDescription: False

name: LOXTON - SEMILLON CHARDONNAY
tastingDescription: False

name: LUBERON - LA VIEILLE FERME
tastingDescription: The flavours of the southern Rhône can transform your meal. Hints of fruit, spice and youth make this a good sipper before the meal or with pasta, seafood or grilled chicken dishes.

name: LUSTAU - EAST INDIA SOLERA
tastingDescription: 96 Points, Wine Advocate - “Readers looking for something weighty, sweet, and provocative should check out the non-vintage East India Solera. A blend of soleras averaging 15 to 50 years of age, it boasts a dark amber color as well as a huge nose of melted toffee, caramel, figs, and prunes. This over-the-top yet surprisingly vibrant (because of good acidity) effort is best drunk as dessert at the end of a meal.” (August 2013)

name: MAC & FITZ - SHIFT'S END RED
tastingDescription: This blend from CedarCreek is mostly Bordeaux varietals that deliver ripe fruit flavours, some complexity and a long linger. This is good value that works with everyday menus.

name: MAC AND FITZ - SHIFT'S END WHITE
nameSanitized: mac and fitz - shifts end white
sort: MAC AND FITZ - SHIFT'S END WHITE
tastingDescription: This blend is based on Viognier, Chardonnay and Pinot Gris. From the CedarCreek winery, this white blend is fresh and fruity, offering tree fruit flavours and BC freshness. Will work with all kinds of menu, from salad courses to seafood to grilled fare. Kickback and enjoy.

name: MACON FUISSE - DOMAINE CORDIER
tastingDescription: This delicious Mâcon-Fuissé is made by father-and-son team Roger and Christophe Cordier. They are always among the last to harvest every year, waiting till the grapes are fully ripe. There's still plenty of freshness here though, allied with citrus notes and some round butteriness.

name: MACON LUGNY - BOUCHARD PERE ST PIERRE 2018
nameSanitized: macon lugny - bouchard pere st pierre 2018
sort: MACON LUGNY - BOUCHARD PERE ST PIERRE 2018
tastingDescription: Fresh nose offering a lovely bouquet of wildflowers. Pleasant, very perfumed and nicely rounded on the palate, this wine should be drunk in its youth in order to enjoy its freshness. Pair with fried fish, fresh water fish abd crayfish.

name: MACON LUGNY - JADOT
tastingDescription: Lemon-gold colour. Notes of ripe stone fruit and white flowers. Flavours of lemon, yellow apple and light herbs are backed up by vibrant acidity and a long, lingering finish. Pair it with pasta with pancetta, spaghetti alla vongole or with pan seared halibut cheeks.

name: MACON VERZE - DOMAINE THIBERT PERE & FILS 2017
nameSanitized: macon verze - domaine thibert pere & fils 2017
sort: MACON VERZE - DOMAINE THIBERT PERE & FILS 2017
tastingDescription: 88-90 Points, Burghound: “Notes of smoky reduction, petrol and a wisp of citrus. There is both good volume and intensity to the lightly mineral-inflected flavors where the sneaky long and grapefruit-inflected finish is markedly dry. This too will need a year or so of cellaring to flesh out as it's very tight today.” (October 2017)

name: MACON VILLAGES MILLY LAMARITINE - HERITIERES COMTES LAFON 17
nameSanitized: macon villages milly lamaritine - heritieres comtes lafon 17
sort: MACON VILLAGES MILLY LAMARITINE - HERITIERES COMTES LAFON 17
tastingDescription: 90 points, Burghound, "There is enough reduction present to mask all but citrus nuances. Otherwise there is excellent punch to the tighter and racier medium weight flavors that possess fine delineation on the bone dry finish." April 2018

name: MADIRAN - BRUMONT CHATEAU MONTUS 2013
tastingDescription: "This is the latest release from this Madiran showpiece estate on steep vineyards surrounding a grand chateau. The wine is black, firm and full of tannins while allowing room for swathes of dark fruits and a bold structure. It is still in the aging process."

name: MADIRAN - CHATEAU PEYROS VIEILLES VIGNES 2016
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Enthusiast - "Power and concentration from the old vines behind this wine is expected, as is the density and dark black fruits. A delicious surprise awaits in the elegance and balance of this wine. It is still a little young, so drink from 2021." (Apr 2020)

name: MADIRAN TANNAT CABERNET FRANC - CHATEAU PEYROS 2015
nameSanitized: madiran tannat cabernet franc - chateau peyros 2015
sort: MADIRAN TANNAT CABERNET FRANC - CHATEAU PEYROS 2015
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine Enthusiast - "This wine comes from the southernmost estate in Madiran. Its blend of Tannat and Cabernet Franc allows softer tannins than pure Tannat and full, ripe berry ﬂavors. The wine is elegant and aging well. Drink from 2020." (Jun 2019)

name: MAGNOTTA - VIDAL ICEWINE 2018
tastingDescription: Intense, enticing aromas of apricot, mango and pineapple are the hallmark of this exceptionally rich and concentrated Icewine. Flavours of banana and honey, along with a hint of cloves contribute further to produce a truly outstanding taste experience. Creamy and sensuous in its mouthfeel, this wine is truly layered in its character.

name: MAJELLA - SPARKLING SHIRAZ COONAWARRA 2017
tastingDescription: Black fruit aromas with similar characters on the palate, which is luscious with nice spicy fruit flavours with hints of plum, nutmeg and gentle tannins with a generous finish.

tastingDescription: 90 Points, Robert Parker: A full bodied white with refreshing acidity and a long aftertaste.The colour is yellow pale with greenish reflections. The nose is marked by explosive aromas of citrus fruits, white flowers and bergamot orange. It is ideal for matching with green salads, pasta or dishes of intense flavour.

name: MALBEC - ALAMOS MENDOZA
tastingDescription: Dark, blackish purple in colour, this wine has aromas that show ripe black fruits, black pepper spice and floral notes. The mouth feel is full, yet soft and supple. Black raspberry and currant flavours mingle with notes of sweet spice and a touch of leather.

name: MALBEC - AMALAYA SALTA VALLE CALCHAQUI 2019
tastingDescription: 97 Points and Platinum Medal, Decanter World Wine Awards 2020 - 85% Malbec, 10% Tannat, 5% Petit Verdot. Perfumed attractive nose with layers of spice, crunchy strawberries, ripe red plums and fresh violets. Vibrant on the palate with a lovely freshness in harmony with a dense chocolatey character, ending in an elegant spicy finish.

name: MALBEC - CATENA HIGH MOUNTAIN VINES 2019
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Advocate - "The excellent and floral 2019 Catena Malbec shows the typicity of the grape, violets and red berries, and the freshness of the year. It has the textbook aromas and a soft and velvety mouthfeel, with very fine grainy tannins." (March 2021)

name: MALBEC - CATENA ZAPATA ADRIANNA VINEYARD FORTUNA TERRAE 2017

name: MALBEC - DONA PAULA LOS CARDOS
tastingDescription: Mendozan grapes offer an intense purplish red colour and sweet, spicy and intense aromas of red fruits and herbs. In the mouth, the wine is soft, velvety, fresh and well-balanced.

name: MALBEC - ESCORIHUELA 1884 ESTATE GROWN MENDOZA
tastingDescription: From the high altitude vineyards at the foot of the Andes, this rich Malbec has a deep reddish purple colour and aromas of ripe black fruit and red plum. Smooth and concentrated tannins in the mouth result in a long and firm finish with minor hints of oak.

name: MALBEC - ESCORIHUELA 1884 LIMITED PRODUCTION 2018

name: MALBEC - FINCA LOS PRIMOS
tastingDescription: Aromas of blackberry, black cherry, and spice on the nose lead to round textured tannins that are excellent with heavier dishes like pot pies and roast beef.

name: MALBEC - KAIKEN SELECCION ESPECIAL
tastingDescription: The excellent 2018 vintage sources from estate vineyards in Agrelo just outside the city of Mendoza. Grapey black, red and blue fruit is in full force here with hints of oak complexity.

name: MALBEC - LA LINDA PRIVATE SELECTION OLD VINES 2018
nameSanitized: malbec - la linda private selection old vines 2018

name: MALBEC - LAS MORAS PAZ
tastingDescription: This marvellous Malbec from the magnificent Pedernal Valley features ripe plums and violets with an elegant touch of smoke, vanilla and chocolate on the nose. Full-bodied, yet sweet tannins lead into a long and delicious finish. A perfect pairing with grilled red meats and ripe cheese.

name: MALBEC - LAYER CAKE MENDOZA 2019
tastingDescription: Big, brooding, black fruit, then rich earth, truffles and dark cocoa are at the front. The Sea of Stones vineyard is at its core, always evident with the thread of minerality that the deep alluvial cobblestones lend. This wine is elegant in the mouth with fresh-picked blackberries, simmering chocolate sauce on the stove, and somewhere someone’s cooking bacon…so many layers, so little time. Drinking a bottle of this wine will certainly lead to, well, opening another.

name: MALBEC - LUIGI BOSCA MENDOZA 2019
tastingDescription: 91, Points James Suckling: "Aromas of blackberries, brambleberries, tobacco, oyster shell and black olive. It's medium-to full-bodied with sleek, fine tannins. Succulent and juicy with layers of fresh, ripe fruit. Delicious now."

name: MALBEC - LUIS SEGUNDO LAS ACEQUIAS MENDOZA 15

name: MALBEC - MICHEL TORINO CUMA ORGANIC
tastingDescription: Intense aromas of blueberry and pomegranate burst through on the nose. Juicy  black cherry, plum and almost brambly flavours appear on the palate that stays  fresh from first to last sip. Try it alongside as well as in the sauce of your  next pot roast!

name: MALBEC - MICHEL TORINO DON DAVID RESERVE

name: MALBEC - NACIDO Y CRIADO MENDOZA
tastingDescription: A supple, silky, smoky Malbec that has bright purple red colours. On the nose, it has complex aromas of red and black fruits combined with subtle floral notes. On the palate, it is round with sweet tannins and flavours of red fruit with a persistent finish. The ultimate steak and barbecue red.

name: MALBEC - PASCUAL TOSO ESTATE
tastingDescription: 2019 - 90 Points, James Suckling "Violets and blueberries abound here with a fresh palate that has supple, ripe-fruit flesh and a long, succulent finish. (Apr 2020)

name: MALBEC - PONCHO CRIOLLO MENDOZA
tastingDescription: Great value! Named for the traditional garb of the Argentine cowboy (Gaucho), the wine is true to the country's wine culture as the taste is rich in Malbec flavours.

name: MALBEC - SANTA JULIA RESERVA UCO VALLEY

name: MALBEC - SUSANA BALBO CRIOS
tastingDescription: The appeal of Malbec is that it tastes like what people expect red grapes to taste like made into wine. Here is the perfect example to enjoy all summer long.

name: MALBEC - TRAPICHE BROQUEL MENDOZA
tastingDescription: 90 Points, James Suckling - "Plenty of dried fruit, spice and light coffee. Full body, light and round tannins and a clean finish. Tangy undertone. One of Trapiche's oldest labels."

name: MALBEC - TRAPICHE ESTATE VARIETAL
tastingDescription: A rich, red-coloured wine with violet hues, reminiscent of plums and cherries. Round in the mouth with a touch of truffle and vanilla.

name: MALBEC - TRAPICHE PURE VALLE DE UCO
nameSanitized: malbec - trapiche pure valle de uco
sort: MALBEC - TRAPICHE PURE VALLE DE UCO
tastingDescription: Opaque, deep ruby with purple hues; aromas show some plum, blackberry, cherry and spice notes; the palate is dry and full with flavours of plum, blackberry, smoke and spice.

name: MALBEC - TRAPICHE RESERVE MENDOZA
tastingDescription: Beautiful, intense red color with violet hues. Sweet aromas of blackberries and plums. Elegant touch of smoke and vanilla. Velvety texture and a sweet, long aftertaste.

name: MALBEC - TRIVENTO GOLDEN RESERVE LUJAN DE CUYO 2018
nameSanitized: malbec - trivento golden reserve lujan de cuyo 2018
nameSuffix: TRIVENTO GOLDEN RESERVE LUJAN DE CUYO 2018
sort: MALBEC - TRIVENTO GOLDEN RESERVE LUJAN DE CUYO 2018
tastingDescription: Aged in French oak barrels for 12 months, with an additional 12 months spent in the bottle. Golden Reserve Malbec has a vigorous red colour with violet hints. Its aromatic profile expresses the sharpness of red fruits such as raspberries and strawberries. Golden Reserve Malbec is complex and intense on the nose, achieving an excellent balance with oak. The palate is pleasant, sweet and profound, with vibrant tannins. It has a juicy and persistent finish.

name: MALBEC - TRIVENTO RESERVE
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Decanter - "Crunchy and fresh red and black fruit, with perfumed violet notes. The palate is very balanced and fresh, with lovely energy and purity. An approachable, fruity style. Plenty of strawberry and raspberry notes." (October 2018)

name: MALBEC - TRIVENTO TRIBU
tastingDescription: Youthful Malbec is always a treat, gushing with grapiness, plums, blueberries and more. A great sipper it goes with all kinds of menu including barbecue, roasts of beef and ham, pizza or burger night, soup and sandwich.

name: MALBEC - UKO SELECT UCO VALLEY 2018
tastingDescription: From one of the more prestigious sub-areas of the Uco Valley, this is an exciting wine from the exceptional 2018 vintage. Rated 90 points by James Suckling, it confirms the shift in grape growing over a century, from East Mendoza to the classic zone to Uco Valley.

name: MALBEC - VINA COBOS FELINO MENDOZA 2019
tastingDescription: A deep red colour with intense violet shades introduces aromas of red berries, floral notes and spices leading to pure, fresh flavours of raspberries and ripe plums. Velvety and refreshing, this wine shows a touch of complexity given by the oak as well as rounded tannins that create a very pleasant finish.

name: MALBEC -TEPERBERG VISION KOSHER 2019
tastingDescription: The colour is deep red with hints of purple. Aromas of black fruit and spices dominate the nose. On the palate, taste a deep and layered wine that combines a wealth of fruit with vibrant acidity. Perfect to pair with beef dishes, charcuterie, and beet salads.

name: MALBEC CABERNET - FINCA LOS PRIMOS
tastingDescription: The combination of Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon offers rich red berry flavours, more current-like drive and structure, and an overall juicy palate to savour. A versatile wine that pairs well with everything from pizza and burgers to grilled veggies and pasta.

name: MALBEC CORVINA - MASI PASSO DOBLE TUPUNGATO ORGANIC
nameSanitized: malbec corvina - masi passo doble tupungato organic
sort: MALBEC CORVINA - MASI PASSO DOBLE TUPUNGATO ORGANIC
tastingDescription: In this well-structured and balanced wine, expect rich dark fruit flavours that reveal red plum and cherries as the palate opens.

name: MALBEC MERLOT - GLEN CARLOU PETITE CLASSIQUE
nameSanitized: malbec merlot - glen carlou petite classique
sort: MALBEC MERLOT - GLEN CARLOU PETITE CLASSIQUE
tastingDescription: Winemaker, Johnnie Calitz - This blend of Malbec and Merlot is beautifully silky with soft tannins and a long layered finish. Dark chocolate, blackcurrant, and almond flavours frame a smooth mouthfeel. The nose entices with vibrant berry and plum aromas.

name: MALBEC ROSE - SALENTEIN PORTILLO 2020
tastingDescription: This wine displays pale rose colours accentuated by bright red hues. The very scented nose hints at aromas of fresh strawberries, ripe summer cherries and jam. On the palate, it delivers delightful notes of red berry fruit and freshly made strawberry jam. The finish lingers pleasantly with warm notes.

name: MANTINIA WHITE DOMAINE TSELEPOS 2020
tastingDescription: "Gold Medal, Berliner Wein Trophy 2021. The gorgeously floral Moschofilero variety is indigenous to Greece and thrives in the highlands of the Peloponnese Peninsula, whence this one hails. Expect heady aromas of fresh flowers and flavours of tangy citrus, and pair with grilled prawns or pan-seared scallops."

name: MARAGAUX - CHATEAU D'ISSAN 2017
tastingDescription:
"The 2017 d'Issan is pliant, supple and nuanced. This is an especially rich, voluptuous style, with a real feeling of lushness from the Merlot. Dark plum, tobacco, leather, cedar, licorice and spice build into a creamy, racy finish wrapped with silky tannins. Creamy and textured, with impeccable balance, the 2017 Issan is a winner from Emmanuel Cruse and his team. Drink: 2025 - 2037."
90 Points, Vinous
6 bottle limit

name: MARANGES VIEILLES VIGNES - MICHELLE PHILIPON 2018
tastingDescription: Aromas of cherries, strawberries and pepper with hints of tar and earth introduce the 2018 Maranges Vieilles Vignes. The palate is medium-bodied with firm, fine-grained tannins and tangy acidity support the flavours of red berry fruits, bittersweet dark c

name: MARCHESI DI BAROLO - BAROLO DOCG DELLA TRADIZIONE 2016
nameSanitized: marchesi di barolo - barolo docg della tradizione 2016
sort: MARCHESI DI BAROLO - BAROLO DOCG DELLA TRADIZIONE 2016
tastingDescription: 93 points, James Suckling -"A vivid and bright perfume to this beautiful young Barolo with cherries and roses galore. Full body, very firm and silky tannins and a flavorful finish. Linear and refined. Drink from 2022. (November 7, 2019).

name: MARCHESI DI BAROLO - MOSCATO D'ASTI ZAGARA 2018
nameSanitized: marchesi di barolo - moscato dasti zagara 2018
sort: MARCHESI DI BAROLO - MOSCATO D'ASTI ZAGARA 2018
tastingDescription: There are abundant fine beads in this straw-yellow sparkling wine that boasts golden highlights. The fragrance is intense and full of aromatic scents, especially those of orange, peach and apricot flowers, which is perfectly balanced with the low alcohol content and the moderate acidity, making this wine pleasantly fresh.

name: MAREMMA TOSCANA - ANTINORI LE MORTELLE VIVIA
nameSanitized: maremma toscana - antinori le mortelle vivia
sort: MAREMMA TOSCANA - ANTINORI LE MORTELLE VIVIA
tastingDescription: Vivia 2019 is bright straw yellow in color, aromas of lemons and green apples blend together with hints of ripe pears and pineapples, creating a complex yet delicate bouquet complemented by sensations of aromatic herbs such as sage and rosemary.  Vivia's palate is fresh and creamy with a mineral finish.

name: MAREMMA TOSCANA - FATTORIA LE PUPILLE SAFFREDI 2018
nameSanitized: maremma toscana - fattoria le pupille saffredi 2018
sort: MAREMMA TOSCANA - FATTORIA LE PUPILLE SAFFREDI 2018
tastingDescription: 97 Points, James Suckling: "Gorgeous blackberries, dark chocolate, spice and lightly roasted coffee. Full body. Layered and creamy. Lovely, silky tannins that melt into the wine. A beautiful red from the vintage with class and finesse to the depth of fruit."

name: MAREMMA TOSCANA VERMENTINO - CECCHI LA MORA
nameSanitized: maremma toscana vermentino - cecchi la mora
sort: MAREMMA TOSCANA VERMENTINO - CECCHI LA MORA
tastingDescription: 91 points, James Suckling - "Bright citrus, white pepper and herbs. Solid density and herbal interest on the medium-bodied palate. Drink now." (June 2019)

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU BOYD CANTENAC 2017
tastingDescription:
"Medium to deep garnet-purple in color, the 2017 Boyd-Cantenac gives pronounced cassis, stewed plums and cedar with earthy undertones and an herbal waft. It has a chewy frame, and the oak stands out on the palate, finishing with a good core of mid-palate flesh. Drink: 2020 - 2029."
88 Points, Wine Advocate

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU BOYD CANTENAC 2018
tastingDescription:
Despite being right next door, this stands above sibling estate Pouget in 2018. It demonstrates excellent freshness, with sculpted dark fruits, good balance and a lift through the mid-palate. It's unquestionably broad-shouldered and serious in approach, and it works extremely well."
93 pts, Decanter

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU BRANE CANTENAC 2017
tastingDescription:
"A tight, focused center palate to this red with blackberries, dark chocolate, hazelnuts and smoke. Medium to full body, polished tannins and a juicy, lightly chewy mouthfeel. A blend of 74% cabernet sauvignon, 21% merlot, 4% cabernet franc and 1% petit verdot. Try after 2022."
94 Points, James Suckling
6 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU BRANE CANTENAC 2018
tastingDescription:
"A quintessential Margaux as well as one of the finest wines I've tasted from this estate, the 2018 Château Brane-Cantenac is based on 74% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Merlot, and the rest Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, all aged in 70% new French oak. Beautiful cassis and mulberry fruits as well as notes of leafy tobacco, spice, cedarwood, and spring flowers emerge from the glass. Medium to full-bodied, beautifully balanced, and elegant, it has loads of fruit, a seamless texture, and a good spine of acidity. Give bottles 4-5 years and enjoy over the following 30 years or more."
95+ pts, Jeb Dunnuck
12 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU BRANE-CANTENAC 2017
tastingDescription:
"A tight, focused center palate to this red with blackberries, dark chocolate, hazelnuts and smoke. Medium to full body, polished tannins and a juicy, lightly chewy mouthfeel. A blend of 74% cabernet sauvignon, 21% merlot, 4% cabernet franc and 1% petit verdot. Try after 2022."
94 Points, James Suckling
6 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU CANTENAC BROWN 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Cantenac Brown is fabulous. Dark rich and expansive, the 2018 wraps around the palate with stunning depth. Dark red/black fruit, iron, cedar, chocolate, dried herbs and a whole range of earthy notes are pushed forward as this ample Margaux shows off its considerable allure. The 2018 is a big, rich wine. Drinking Window: 2026 - 2048."
95 pts, Vinous

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU CANTENAC BROWN ROUGE 2017
tastingDescription:
"A lush wine packed with tannins and rich dark fruits, this will be dense and complex. Its solid structure is balanced with good acidity from the fruitiness. Drink from 2024."
93 Points, Wine Enthusiast
6 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU D'ISSAN 2018
tastingDescription:
"This is a brilliant Issan with richness and poise joined by a delicate acidity that pulls the fruit along. The tannins are deceptive, as they are supple and appealing, but the density and power builds over the palate and clearly indicates long ageing. A wine that feels like it's rooted in its appellation. Drinking Window: 2027 - 2042."
96 pts, Decanter
12 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU DEYREM VALENTIN 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Deyrem Valentin is very perfumed on the nose, offering blackberry, blueberry, touches of violet petal and light incense aromas. The palate is medium-bodied with supple tannins, a fine bead of acidity, a silky-smooth texture and a vibrant, minerally finish that lingers. This is a gorgeous, finely tuned and precise Margaux that is going to give 20 years of drinking pleasure. Drinking Window: 2023 - 2045."
92 pts, Vinous

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU DU TERTRE 2017
tastingDescription:
"Made by the same team as Giscours, this wine reflects the same attention to detail. Ripe tannins give the wine its firm side while the structure is powerful and dense. Drink this wine from 2024."
95 Points, Wine Enthusiast

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU FERRIERE 2017
tastingDescription:
"This much-improved Lurton-owned estate has produced a richly structured wine. Firm and toasty it has the fruit weight to age well. The rich structure needs to soften, so drink the wine from 2024."
92 Points, Wine Enthusiast

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU FERRIERE 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Ferrière is a powerful, tightly wound wine. Inky dark fruit, gravel, cured meats, graphite, smoke and lavender all run through the 2018. Yields are down from an average of 45 hectoliters per hectare to just 26, which no doubt contributes to the wine's natural intensity. The blend is 68% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot, 5% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Franc, in other words, the Cabernet Sauvignon is especially high, a recent trend here because of climate change. Drinking Window: 2026 - 2048."
94 pts, Vinous

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU GISCOURS 2017
tastingDescription:
"The 2017 Giscours is the result of an especially stringent selection, the most dramatic at the property going back to 1995. Medium in body, with terrific freshness and energy, the 2017 shows very well today. Dark red cherry, red plum, spice, licorice, tobacco and savory herbs all grace the glassy, understated Giscours. I can't wait to see how the 2017 ages given its vibrancy and terrific sense of harmony. Drink: 2025 - 2037."
93 Points, Vinous
6 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU GISCOURS 2018
tastingDescription:
"Black currant, dried-blueberry, oyster-shell, black-olive, black truffle, and bitter-chocolate aromas. It's full-bodied with firm, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Savory and mineral layers interplay with the black fruit. Powerful and chewy yet very polished and beautiful. Try from 2024."
97 pts, James Suckling
12 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU KIRWAN 2018
tastingDescription:
"This drapes wonderfully, with its range of warmed cassis, plum reduction and blackberry preserve flavors displaying a cashmere feel while warmed anise, alder, juniper and bay details peek in throughout. Rich yet defined finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best from 2023 through 2036."
94 pts, Wine Spectator

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU LABEGORCE 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Château Labegorce is a perfumed, already complex Margaux based on 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 44% Merlot, and the rest Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Its medium ruby hue gives way to lovely notes of blueberries, raspberries, flowers, sandalwood, and assorted baking spice cabinet-like nuances. Medium to full-bodied, with beautifully pure fruit and silky tannins, it's a wine that grows on you with time in the glass. Enjoy bottles any time over the coming 20-25 years or more."
94 pts, Jeb Dunnuck

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU LASCOMBES 2016
tastingDescription:
“Deep garnet-purple colored, the 2016 Lascombes features beautiful candied violets, Black Forest cake, cassis and menthol with hints of underbrush, cloves, pencil lead and tar. Medium-bodied with good intensity and firm, grainy tannins, it finishes long and perfumed. Drink: 2019 - 2037.”
94+ Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU LASCOMBES 2017
tastingDescription:
"Medium to deep garnet-purple in color, the 2017 Lascombes leaps from the glass with black raspberries, mulberries and blackcurrant pastilles with hints of earth, herbs, meats and cedar. Medium-bodied, it has plenty of juicy fruit and is fresh and plush, finishing long with a mineral lift. Drink: 2020 - 2039."
94 Points, Wine Advocate
6 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU LASCOMBES 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Lascombes is deep garnet-purple in color, slowly unfurling in the glass to reveal evocative cassis, black cherries and blackberry pie scents, followed by hints of pencil lead, menthol, lavender and cedar chest with a touch of damp soil. The medium to full-bodied palate gives a great core of muscular black fruits, framed by firm, grainy tannins and just enough freshness, finishing long and savory. Drink Date: 2023 - 2040."
93+ pts, Wine Advocate
12 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU MARGAUX 1990
tastingDescription: 100 Points, Wine Advocate: "… Fleshy and corpulent for Chateau Margaux, and yet surfeit with breeding and finesse… I feel that this 1990 Château Margaux is at its peak and yet the harmony, the sheer swagger of this wine just wins you over. Magnificent. Drink: 2016 - 2040." (October 2016)

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU MARGAUX 2000
tastingDescription: 100 Points, James Suckling: "The 2000 Margaux kicked off a string of great wines. The aromas are spellbinding, with notes of raspberry and strawberry. The palate is incredibly silky yet structured. Impeccable balance." (April 2014)

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU MARGAUX 2005
tastingDescription: 99 Points, Wine Advocate: "The Château Margaux 2005 has a nigh perfect bouquet... The palate is effortless with sumptuous ripe tannin, perfect acidity, layers of sensual ripe red fruit with a precise mineral finish. This is sheer class, a crystalline beauty and the persistence is simply breathtaking. Drink: 2020 - 2060." (February 2015)

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU MARGAUX 2013
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "This wine is smooth, ripe with fine tannins and red plum and black-currant fruits that are soft and gentle. Acidity dominates at this stage, supported by the tannins. It brings out the fruit and freshness of the year while also keeping some structure... Drink from 2025." (March 2016)

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU MARGAUX 2016
tastingDescription:
“Deep garnet-purple colored, the 2016 Château Margaux (blended of 94% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Cabernet Franc, 2% Merlot and 1% Petit Verdot) sashays out of the glass with glamorous red currants, candied violets, kirsch and crushed blackcurrants scents followed by notions of tilled black soil, forest floor, cast iron pan and cigar box with subtle wafts of lavender and oolong tea. Medium-bodied, mineral laced accents hover over the palate with an ethereal sensation of weightlessness, yet it is super intense with layers of red and black flavors supported by a firm texture of silt-fine tannins, finishing wonderfully fragrant and incredibly long. Drink: 2024 - 2063.”
99 Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU MARGAUX 2017
tastingDescription:
"The 2017 Chateau Margaux is a blend of 89% Cabernet Sauvignon, 8% Merlot, 2% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot. Deep garnet-purple colored, it needs a little coaxing to reveal alluring notes of blackcurrant cordial, Black Forest cake and black raspberries with suggestions of candied violets, tilled soil, fallen leaves, licorice and espresso plus wafts of underbrush and rosehip tea. Medium-bodied, the elegance and finesse on the palate is simply bedazzling, exuding a quiet intensity of fresh black fruits layered with oh-so-subtle floral and earth nuances. It has a soft, velvety texture and seamless freshness to support the tightly wound flavors, finishing long and perfumed. Beautiful! Drink: 2024 - 2060."
98 Points, Wine Advocate
3 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU MARGAUX 2018
tastingDescription: False

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU MARGAUX 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Château Margaux is composed of 90% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Merlot, 4% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot. It slowly unfurls to reveal tantalizing scents of crème de cassis, wild blueberries and Black Forest cake with hints of redcurrant jelly, rose oil, dark chocolate and cedar chest plus a touch of star anise. The medium to full-bodied palate bursts with opulent black fruit, fragrant earth and floral layers, supported by a rock-solid structure of exquisitely ripe, finely grained tannins and seamless backbone of freshness, finishing with fantastic length. This is classic Margaux at its most seductive, although it is, rather amazingly, approachable and absolutely delicious right now. But, to enjoy its full glory, you will want to cellar it for at least 6-8 years and then watch it metamorphize over the next 40+ years. Drink Date: 2027 - 2067."
100 pts, Wine Advocate
6 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU MARQUIS D'ALESME ROUGE 2018
tastingDescription:
"A rock star Margaux that should be snatched up by readers, the 2018 Château Marquis D'Alesme reveals a dense purple hue as well as ripe, sexy notes of blackcurrants, spicy oak, tobacco leaf, earth, and cedar. Deep, full-bodied, and gorgeously concentrated, it has velvety tannins, a layered, mouthcoating texture, and a great finish. It's a baby, but wow, what a wine. Hide bottle for 5-7 years if you can (you'll be forgiven for opening a bottle early) and it's going to evolve for 30-40 years."
97 pts, Jeb Dunnuck
12 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU MARQUIS DE TERME 2018
tastingDescription:
"Fresh and racy in feel, with a zip of acidity driving through the middle, lending support to the mix of blackberry, plum and cassis flavors. Dried anise, alder and lilac accents add range on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2022 through 2034."
93 pts, Wine Spectator
12 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU PALMER 2016
tastingDescription:
“Technical Director Thomas Duroux and his team made one of the most brilliant wines of the 2016 vintage. Palmer is simply exceptional. Rich and dramatically sweeping in the glass, the 2016 is breathtaking. All the elements simply fall into place in a wine of mesmerizing beauty. The counterpoint of dark, sumptuous fruit and floral notes makes for an utterly compelling Palmer that will take its place among the estate's finest vintages. Dark cherry, lavender, spice and mocha are some of the many notes that build into a deep, substantial finish that is truly unforgettable. In a word: magnificent! Drink: 2026 - 2066.”
100 Points, Vinous
1 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU PALMER 2017
tastingDescription:
"A blend of 54% Merlot, 42% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Petit Verdot, the deep garnet-purple colored, 2017 Palmer gives a very serious nose of pronounced blackcurrant cordial, warm plums and blackberry preserves with hints of cedar chest, pencil shavings, violets, dark chocolate and star anise plus exotic wafts of sandalwood and cassia. Medium-bodied, the palate features fantastically vibrant, crunchy black fruits with a firm texture of ripe, grainy tannins and tons of freshness, finishing very long and mineral laced. It will need a good 5-7 years to really blossom with all those tightly wound nuances, but it should be a stunner! Drink: 2025 - 2065."
97+ Points, Wine Advocate
6 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU PALMER 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Palmer is a legend in the making. It storms from the glass with black fruit and floral scents, crushed violet and incense that knock your senses sideways while retaining brilliant delineation and focus. The palate is not quite as bold and brassy as when I tasted it from barrel, though I can vouchsafe that among over 20 vintages of Palmer that I have tasted at this stage, this is easily the most extroverted and powerful, displaying a kind of millefeuille of intense black fruit counterpoised by a razor-sharp line of acidity. This audacious Palmer was still revving its engines 48 hours after opening. There will never be another Palmer like this, sui generis. It was a massive risk. But by throwing caution to the wind, something extraordinary was born. Drinking Window: 2030 - 2070."
100 pts, Vinous
1 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU POUGET 2017
tastingDescription:
"This medium-bodied wine is centered around its earthy, floral and bright, red berry character. This should drink well with just a few years of age."
89 Points, Wine Cellar Insider

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU POUGET 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Pouget, which has been on a good run of form recently, has ample blackberry and raspberry fruit on the nose, touches of potpourri and peony emerging with time and rendering this Margaux quite floral. The palate is medium-bodied with supple tannins and well-judged acidity. Quite spicy toward the finish, revealing white pepper and just a very slight garrigue and brown spice note. Drinking Window: 2023 - 2036."
90 pts, Vinous

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU PRIEURE LICHINE 2017
tastingDescription:
"This is the definition of a wine to buy in an off-vintage. It has the signature of the last few years, but in an early-drinking package. It's a little oaky and smoky for sure, but handles it well and delivers punch and personality without overstating the case. Ripe damson fruits help to deliver impact, even if the fruit is generally a touch below the exuberance of the last two years. Planted in the vineyard to 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 45% Merlot, 5% Petit Verdot. Drink: 2025 - 2038."
94 Points, Decanter

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU PRIEURE LICHINE 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Prieuré-Lichine is a gorgeous, elegant wine. Strong Cabernet aromatics give the 2018 striking savory notes to play off the natural radiance of the year. Plush and sensual, with no hard edges and terrific balance, the 2018 hits all the right notes. Dried herbs, rose petal, cedar, tobacco and mint linger on the finely cut, persistent finish. Drinking Window: 2028 - 2048."
94 pts, Vinous

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU RAUZAN SEGLA 2017
tastingDescription:
"Medium to deep garnet-purple colored, the 2017 Rauzan-Segla rocks up with vibrant notions of cherry pie, warm cassis, blackberry preserves and red roses with hints of cinnamon stick and cloves. Medium to full-bodied, the palate is completely filled with wonderfully pure red and black fruits, framed by firm, very ripe, fine-grained tannins and just enough freshness, finishing long and spicy. Yum! The blend is 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 36% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot. Drink: 2024 - 2050."
96+ Points, Wine Advocate
6 bottle limit

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU SIRAN 2017
tastingDescription:
"Features alluring black cherry and plum puree flavors gliding through, inlaid with subtle alder, lilac and black tea notes. Perfumy and velvety, with a suave finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2030."
91 Points, Wine Spectator

name: MARGAUX - CHATEAU TAYAC 2018
tastingDescription:
"This 90-acre vineyard has produced a wine powered by dark tannins, rich black-plum fruits and a concentrated texture. It shows touches of the elegance associated with a fine Margaux, with a dry core of tannins and licorice as well as fruit flavors. Drink from 2024."
90 pts, Wine Enthusiast

name: MARGAUX - MARQUIS DE TERME 2017
tastingDescription:
"Fresh, featuring a profile of slightly high-toned cherry and red currant flavors, with extra blood orange, balsam, incense and black tea hints chiming through the finish. Not dense, but shows range. Finely beaded acidity stretches this out nicely. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2030."
91 Points, Wine Spectator

name: MARGAUX - PAVILLON ROUGE DU CHATEAU MARGAUX 2018
nameSanitized: margaux - pavillon rouge du chateau margaux 2018
sort: MARGAUX - PAVILLON ROUGE DU CHATEAU MARGAUX 2018
tastingDescription:
"This cuvée has been in the running for the best second wine in the vintage for a number of years now, and I think it just might be there in 2018. The 2018 Château Margaux Pavillon Rouge checks in as 69% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Merlot, and the rest Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc, and it's no lightweight effort, revealing a dense purple color as well as gorgeous crème de cassis, black cherry, crushed violets, sandalwood, smoke tobacco, and incense. It's loaded with Château Margaux character, has medium to full-bodied richness, ample structure, and a great finish. Don't underestimate this second wine – it's incredibly impressive. Hide bottles for 3-5 years and enjoy over the following two decades."
95 pts, Jeb Dunnuck
6 bottle limit

name: MARQUES DE LARES - CAVA BRUT ROSADO
nameSanitized: marques de lares - cava brut rosado
sort: MARQUES DE LARES - CAVA BRUT ROSADO
tastingDescription: This lovely sparkling Rosado made from 100% Grenache is brimming with the ripe aromas of raspberry and cherry fruit. Red fruit steals the show on the surprisingly creamy and fresh palate.

name: MARSANNAY LES LONGEROIES - CHATEAU DE MARSANNAY 2015
nameSanitized: marsannay les longeroies - chateau de marsannay 2015
sort: MARSANNAY LES LONGEROIES - CHATEAU DE MARSANNAY 2015
tastingDescription: Elegant, harmonious and pleasant nose of wood, red fruit with floral notes. Beautiful structure, with a soft density uplifted by soft tannins and a velvety texture. Nice and long finish.

name: MARTINI - ASTI
tastingDescription: Delightful bubbles rise to the top of the glass releasing aromas of peach, apple, melon and grapefruit. Fruity and fun with a lovely sweetness, it's ideal served with desserts.

name: MARTINI - ASTI
tastingDescription: Delightful bubbles rise to the top of the glass releasing aromas of peach, apple, melon and grapefruit. Fruity and fun with a lovely sweetness, it's ideal served with desserts.

name: MARTINI - BIANCO
tastingDescription: Pale straw colour; aromas of pistachio, citrus peel and spice that follow through on to the palate; nutty sweet flavours are balanced with zesty orange, grapefruit and herbal notes.

name: MARTINI - DRY
tastingDescription: Complex aromas including florals, herbs and spices; dry and palate-refreshing.

name: MARTINI - DRY
tastingDescription: Complex aromas including florals, herbs and spices. It is dry and palate-refreshing.

name: MARTINI - ROSSO
tastingDescription: False

name: MARTINI - ROSSO
tastingDescription: Copper/ amber in colour. Floral aroma with herbs, spice and orange in flavour. It is sweet with a good balance.

name: MASI - MODELLO PROSECCO
tastingDescription: A harmonious, elegant wine with great softness, freshness and notes of apple, pear, apricot and white flowers.

name: MASI MERLOT MODELLO
tastingDescription: The Modello is a medium bodied red from some exciting, indigenous varieties including Refosco and Raboso. Try it with roasted pork.

name: MASUKAGAMI - SUPER PREMIUM JUNMAI DAI GINJO SAKE
nameSanitized: masukagami - super premium junmai dai ginjo sake
nameSuffix: SUPER PREMIUM JUNMAI DAI GINJO SAKE
sort: MASUKAGAMI - SUPER PREMIUM JUNMAI DAI GINJO SAKE
tastingDescription: This sake is a thoroughbred of Dai Ginjo, the ultra premium style, with complex nose of fresh fruits and flowers. Dry on the palate with a big structured mouthfeel and the finish is full, long and very satisfying. Simply stunning.

name: MATEUS ROSE - SOGRAPE
tastingDescription: A fresh wine with a fine and intense bouquet and all the joviality of young wines. The palate is well-balanced, brilliantly complemented by a soft and slightly fizzy finish. Perfect to pair with seafood, salad, light Italian dishes and Asian cuisine.

name: MATEUS ROSE - SOGRAPE
tastingDescription: A fresh wine with a fine and intense bouquet and all the joviality of young wines. The palate is well-balanced, brilliantly complemented by a soft and slightly fizzy finish. Perfect to pair with seafood, salads, light Italian dishes and Asian cuisine.

name: MAYHEM - MERLOT CABERNET FRANC 2018
tastingDescription: Flavours of blackcurrant, black cherries and chocolate linger on the palate. Beautifully balanced, this wine has velvety smooth tannins and a seamless finish. Try this with BBQ pork ribs, a striploin steak or with a pepperoni pizza.

name: MAZOYERES CHAMBERTIN - DOMAINE DES BEAUMONT 2014
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Decanter: "Powerful nose of red berries and spice, velvety palate and blood orange finisy. A very characterful wine." (February 2016)

name: MAZOYERES CHAMBERTIN - DOMAINE DES BEAUMONT 2015
tastingDescription: Powerful and complex nose of dark fruit and liquorice. The palate reveals velvety textures with fine tannins. Beautifully balanced, powerful, complex and rich. Long and persistent finish.

name: MAZOYERES CHAMBERTIN - DOMAINE TAUPENOT MERME 2015
tastingDescription: 94-96 Points, Wine Advocate: "The 2015 Mazoyeres Chambertin Grand Cru has a very intense bouquet with lifted redcurrant, raspberry, spice box and quite a noticeable marine influence coming through with time. The palate is medium-bodied with tensile tannin. This is one of the best Mazoyeres Chambertin that I have tasted." (December 2016)

name: MEADOW VISTA - BLISS SPARKLING CHERRY HONEY WINE
nameSanitized: meadow vista - bliss sparkling cherry honey wine
sort: MEADOW VISTA - BLISS SPARKLING CHERRY HONEY WINE
tastingDescription: Dark, juicy Okanagan cherries were added to give BLISS a beautiful blush colour, notes of cherry, plum and pinot noir. Delight in this bubbly with grilled foods such as seasonal veggies, meats and fruit.

name: MEDITERRANEE - MAISON NO 9 ROSE
tastingDescription: False

name: MEDOC - CHATEAU D'ESCURAC 2018
tastingDescription:
"The firm tannins of this wine indicate aging potential, because they complement the bold blackberry fruits and fragrant acidity. Woody at this stage it will be a full, rich wine from 2023."
91 pts, Wine Enthusiast

name: MEDOC - CHATEAU DE CHANDELLIERE 2015
tastingDescription:
“The 2015 la Chandellière is medium garnet-purple in colour with an earthy, meaty nose with red fruit nuances. The medium-bodied palate is taut, chewy and fresh with an herbal lift on the finish. Drink: 2018 - 2025.”
85 Points, Wine Advocate

name: MEDOC - CHATEAU LA BRAVOURE DE LA TOUR CARNET 2010
nameSanitized: medoc - chateau la bravoure de la tour carnet 2010
nameSuffix: CHATEAU LA BRAVOURE DE LA TOUR CARNET 2010
sort: MEDOC - CHATEAU LA BRAVOURE DE LA TOUR CARNET 2010
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Advocate: "Probably La Tour Carnet’s best since their 2001, the 2010 La Tour Carnet exhibits wonderful ripeness... It is medium to full-bodied, with attractive sweetness of tannin, good acidity, excellent delineation to its component parts, and a full-bodied, impressively long finish. Drink: 2018 - 2035." (February 2013)

name: MEDOC - CHATEAU LA GORCE 2015
tastingDescription: This medium-bodied wine is produced from 50% Cabernet Sauvignon and 50% Merlot grapes from 35-year-old vines. It is a traditionally-made claret, with spicy herb and dried fruit aromas and intense cherry and blackberry flavours. Soft tannins are evident on the long, smooth finish.

name: MEDOC - CHATEAU LA GORCE 2016
tastingDescription: This property is situated north of Saint-Estèphe, close to the banks of the Gironde Estuary; it produces a classic Médoc of great richness and depth. The aromas are perfumed and attractive, with concentrated cassis fruit and sweet spice. This is a full-bodied, supple wine, with a gentle texture, good structure, and a long, vibrant finish.

name: MEDOC - CHATEAU LES GRANDS CHENES 2018
tastingDescription:
"Deep garnet-purple in color, the 2018 les Grands Chênes comes bounding out of the glass with exuberant notes of stewed black plums, warm cassis and boysenberries, plus suggestions of pencil shavings, wild sage and crushed rocks. The medium to full-bodied palate is packed with energetic, crunchy black fruits, supported by fine-grained tannins and tons of freshness, finishing with a compelling herbal lift. Drink Date: 2022 - 2036."
91 pts, Wine Advocate

name: MELNIKON KERATSUDA - SVETI VRAC 2019
tastingDescription: Keratsuda is a rare white grape from southwest Bulgaria that is grown only in a small part of the Kresna Canyon. Only 1,200 bottles produced.

name: MENDOZA RED - CLOS DE LOS SIETE 2017
nameSanitized: mendoza red - clos de los siete 2017
sort: MENDOZA RED - CLOS DE LOS SIETE 2017
tastingDescription: 94 Points, James Suckling - Blackberries, blueberries, crushed violets, hot stones and dried herbs. Full-bodied with structured tannins, great acidity drive and a medium-chewy finish. A wine that really grows on you, as it exudes charm and finesse.

name: MENDOZA RED - DOMINIO DEL PLATA BENMARCO EXPRESIVO 2017
nameSanitized: mendoza red - dominio del plata benmarco expresivo 2017
sort: MENDOZA RED - DOMINIO DEL PLATA BENMARCO EXPRESIVO 2017
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Advocate - "There is great purity in the 2016 BenMarco Expresivo. It's floral, ethereal, fresh and complex. This year the blend is 75% Malbec and 25% Cabernet Franc, with all the wild herbs and flowers from Gualtallary. Drink: 2018 - 2023." (June 2018)

name: MENDOZA RED - NORTON PRIVADA
tastingDescription: This robust Bordeaux- style blend of Malbec, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon has dark fruits and spice that dominate with a toasty licorice finish.

name: MERCUREY - MICHEL JUILLOT PINOT NOIR 2018
tastingDescription: Expressive and fresh nose tinged with red fruit aromas generously sprinkled with hints of warm earth. The palate is medium-bodied with supple tannins, a fine bead of acidity, dark berry fruit with hints of cedar and tobacco on the finish.  that make this wine a very solid village.

name: MERCUREY BLANC - MICHEL JUILLOT CHARDONNAY 2018
tastingDescription: Expressive and rich nose of white flowers, with aromas of melon, white peach and pear. Fat, fullness and richness, all in a slender and saline style. Beautiful concentration balanced by a creamy, silky texture and striking minerality. Long, vibrant with an almost exotic finish.

name: MERCUREY ROUGE - CHATEAU DE CHAMIREY
tastingDescription: 90 Points:, Burghound: "A restrained, yet ripe nose reflects notes of both red and dark fruit along with evident earth and soft wood nuances. The supple, round and delicious middle weight flavours possess good energy before terminating in a mildly rustic and warm finale.

name: MERLOT  DONINI
tastingDescription: A great red Italian table wine with plumy jam aromas and ripe berry flavours on the palate. Matches well with grilled or BBQ red meat, lamb chops or ribs.

name: MERLOT - BAREFOOT CALIFORNIA
tastingDescription: Delicious flavours of boysenberry and hints of chocolate. Subtle notes of anise and silky tannins complete the mouthfeel, offering an enjoyable finish.

name: MERLOT - COLUMBIA CREST GRAND ESTATES
tastingDescription: Classic Merlot aromas of spice, blackberry and cocoa carry through the palate of this complex artisanally-crafted wine. The balance of oak and black fruits creates a velvety, seductive finish.

name: MERLOT - COLUMBIA CREST H3 HORSE HEAVEN VINEYARD 2016
nameSanitized: merlot - columbia crest h3 horse heaven vineyard 2016
nameSuffix: COLUMBIA CREST H3 HORSE HEAVEN VINEYARD 2016
sort: MERLOT - COLUMBIA CREST H3 HORSE HEAVEN VINEYARD 2016
tastingDescription: 90 Points, James Suckling - "Oak plays a reasonable role in adding spicy sweetness to this approachable, plum-fruited merlot. Soft easy tannins. Drink now." (May 2018)

name: MERLOT - CONCHA Y TORO FRONTERA
tastingDescription: Cherries and pepper aromas with a slight touch of cacao. This Merlot is elegant, round and full-bodied, with a long lasting aftertaste. It is the perfect match for pasta, cheese, red meat and grilled chicken.

name: MERLOT - CONO SUR BICICLETA
tastingDescription: A soft and serious Merlot, a wine of great typicity and remarkable fruit expression. This wine's plum-red coloring is dark and intense. In nose, concentrated notes of black fruit and soft hints of sweet toasted oak. The palate surprises with its excellent structure, balanced acidity, fruity intensity and pleasantly ripe tannins.

name: MERLOT - DUCKHORN DECOY 2019
tastingDescription: This wine is soft, rounded and succulent in waves of plum and dark cherry. Moderate in weight and ripeness, it is solidly backed by integrated oak, baking spice and a lasting hint of dried herb. - Wine Enthusiast December 2019

name: MERLOT - DUCKHORN NAPA 2017
tastingDescription: Combining lovely structure and alluring appeal, this is a classic expression of Duckhorn Vineyards Merlot. Intense aromas of ripe cherry, plum and black fig rise from the glass, underscored by hints of leather and cedar. On the palate, it is lush and supple, with bright acidity and velvety tannins supporting layers of raspberry and black cherry, as well as hints of coffee and chocolate that carry through on the long finish.

name: MERLOT - DUCKHORN NAPA VALLEY THREE PALMS 2017
nameSanitized: merlot - duckhorn napa valley three palms 2017
sort: MERLOT - DUCKHORN NAPA VALLEY THREE PALMS 2017
tastingDescription:
Available on May 29.
"Powerful, rich and complex, with a refined mix of currant, dark cherry and plum tart flavors backed by suave, medium-grained tannins. Well-defined slate and loamy notes stretch out nicely on the finish, with black olive hints. Drink now through 2027."
96 points, and ranked 15 Top 100 of 2020, Wine Spectator

name: MERLOT - EMMOLO NAPA
tastingDescription: A dark plum colour, this wine opens with the lush scents of baking chocolate and fig, enhanced by notes of dried stone fruit, Christmas spice and wisps of Mesquite smoke. The palate is wonderfully rich and supple, driven by dark berry flavours. On the finish: a harmony of fresh earthiness and smoky notes rounded out with tannins that are leathery and smooth.

name: MERLOT - GRAPE GRINDER CAPE FYNBOS
tastingDescription: Gold medal, Gilbert & Gaillard International Wine Challenge 2021 "Presenting a deep ruby colour, this juicy and generous Merlot offers a wonderfully smooth palate of mixed berries and cherry with a lovely pleasing finish."

name: MERLOT - J LOHR LOS OSOS PASO ROBLES 2017
nameSanitized: merlot - j lohr los osos paso robles 2017
nameSuffix: J LOHR LOS OSOS PASO ROBLES 2017
sort: MERLOT - J LOHR LOS OSOS PASO ROBLES 2017
tastingDescription: Wine Advocate - "The 2016 Merlot Los Osos is ripe, supple and fruit-driven, structured around fine tannins and laden with creamy aromas and flavors of raspberries and new oak. Competently made and pleasure-bent, it's an accessible, user-friendly red for near-term consumption. Drink: 2018 - 2020." (May 2018)

name: MERLOT - OYSTER BAY HAWKES BAY 2019
tastingDescription: Essentially Oyster Bay Merlot is about elegance and intensity of fruit. The hero is always freshness of ripe fruit, spice and soft tannins on the palate.

name: MERLOT - RIEBEEK CELLARS COLLECTION SWARTLAND
tastingDescription: False

name: MERLOT - ROBERT MONDAVI PS RUM BARREL AGED
nameSanitized: merlot - robert mondavi ps rum barrel aged
nameSuffix: ROBERT MONDAVI PS RUM BARREL AGED
sort: MERLOT - ROBERT MONDAVI PS RUM BARREL AGED
tastingDescription: This  merlot blends the craftmanship of California winemaking with the exotic tradition of dark rum barrel aging, resulting in an incredibly bold sensory expression. Dark ruby red in colour, it opens with rich, sweet aromas and flavours of blackstrap molasses, black cherry, spiced rum cake and mocha.

name: MERLOT - SPIER SIGNATURE
tastingDescription: Clear, medium ruby with light bricking around the rim; the nose offers armoas of cherry, cedar, earth and mulled red berry. The palate is dry with low acid and medium tannins on a medium body; look for flavours of cherry, plum, dusty rose and blueberry followed by a medium legnth finish.

name: MERLOT - STERLING NAPA 2016
tastingDescription: The Sterling Vineyards Napa Valley Merlot is a vivid ruby-red colour in the glass with aromas of blackberry fruit, plum and ripe black cherry. The appealing bouquet leads to a mouthcoating, rich palate where additional red and black fruit flavours mingle with notes of graphite and dried spice. The viscous mouthfeel of the wine is plush and the ripe tannins are refined and polished. The Napa Valley Merlot is well-balanced and elegant, offering true varietal characteristics and a sleek, flavourful finish.

name: MERLOT - STERLING VINTNER'S COLLECTION
tastingDescription: The Sterling Vintner’s Collection Merlot boasts vivid aromas of fresh mixedberry jam, red cherry, milk chocolate and baked spice. The wine is round and with good weight and generous flavours of blackberry bramble, sweet toasted oak and mocha. The wine is full-bodied with great concentration, silky tannins and a lengthy finish.

name: MERLOT - VILLA TERESA ORGANIC
tastingDescription: A smooth medium- bodied Merlot, exhibiting red plum, raspberry and spices on the palate. Perfect for this mulled dessert.

name: MERLOT - VONDELING
tastingDescription: The wine displays a bright ruby red colour. It shows a vibrant, fruit filled aroma of sleek cherries, subtle raspberry and soft, black pepper. The nose carries through beautifully to the palate and is nicely supported by refined tannins with a smooth finish. A dynamic wine, which can be enjoyed at many levels.

name: MERLOT - WOLF BLASS YELLOW LABEL
tastingDescription: Lifted berry fruits are given gentle complexity with notes of warm spice, cocoa and a subtle touch of oak. A plush, juicy palate with generous fruit flavours and soft, velvety tannins, comes together in an approachable, medium-bodied style.

name: MERLOT - YELLOW TAIL
tastingDescription: This Merlot is everything a great wine should be – soft, velvety and easy to drink. Dark plums, mulberries and spice on the palate.

name: MERLOT VENEZIE  DONINI
tastingDescription: A great red Italian table wine with plumy jam aromas and ripe berry flavours on the palate. Matches well with grilled or BBQ red meat, lamb chops or ribs.

name: MEURSAULT - ALBERT BICHOT
tastingDescription: False

name: MEURSAULT - BERNARD MILLOT CUVEE ALEXIE 2017

sort: MEURSAULT - CHATEAU DE MEURSAULT LE LIMOZIN
tastingDescription: Pretty layered nose with notes of citrus, hazelnut and pear. Broad and rich on the palate with stone fruit aromas combined with tropical fruit notes and a hint of toasted flavours. It has a classic buttery Meursault presence and body with a hint of wild honey. Structured and powerful. A good tension brings a great length and beautiful finish.

name: MEURSAULT - DOMAINE BERNARD MILLOT 2017
tastingDescription: From 40- to 50-year-old vines, the 2017 Meursault Cuvee Alexie bursts from the glass with bright and lifted aromas of lemon zest, poached apple, Anjou pear, ginger and crushed oyster shells framed by hazelnut, subtle spices and a whiff of smoke.

name: MEURSAULT - DOMAINE BOUCHARD PERE 2016
tastingDescription: The soils in Meursault are of exceptional variety and the different "terroirs" on this appellation are of incomparable diversity and richness, even if exposure to the sun is globally the same. Very perfumed nose of fruits and flavorus. Expresses its richness with a nervous hint, very pleasant wine. Good ageing potential. Pair with fish and poultry in cream sauce.

name: MEURSAULT - DOMAINE LATOUR GIRAUD CUVEE CHARLES MAXIME 2017
nameSanitized: meursault - domaine latour giraud cuvee charles maxime 2017
nameSuffix: DOMAINE LATOUR GIRAUD CUVEE CHARLES MAXIME 2017
