tastingDescription: Exclusively produced at the estates' vineyards, the Mersault from Domaine Latour Giraud conveys elegance and femininity. The wine display roundness, softness and fresh acidity with nuances of hazelnuts.

name: MEURSAULT - HEITZ LOCHARDET 1ER PERRIERES
tastingDescription: False

name: MEURSAULT 1ER CHARMES - PIERRE BRISSET 2015
tastingDescription: 17.5/20, Jancis Robinson: “Richly scented... This is utterly delicious! Gun flint and tarragon and spearmint and green-crystal fruit. Like tasting liquid green glass. So fresh! So focused. So direct. Spear-like and racy and tucked in and yet there is a power and breadth that underlies everything. Stunning.”

name: MEURSAULT 1ER GENEVRIERES - BOYER MARTENOT 2018
tastingDescription: Pale yellow. Reserved aromas of tangerine, tangy peach, hazelnut and spicy oak are complicated by wet-stone minerality. At once thick and piquant, conveying a racier character than the broader, silkier Charmes. Classic dense, vibrant Genevrieres with a long, slowly mounting finish that throws off notes of white truffle and flowers. This is superb.

name: MEURSAULT 1ER GENEVRIERES - DOM JADOT 2018
tastingDescription: 91-93 Points, Robert Parker's The Wine Advocate - "The 2018 Meursault 1er Cru Genevrieres (Domaine Louis Jadot) has turned out very well, wafting from the glass with aromas of green pear, citrus oil, nutmeg and spices. On the palate, it's medium to full-bodied, fleshy and layered, with lively acids, good depth at the core and a long finish." (January, 2020).

name: MEURSAULT 1ER GENEVRIERES - DOMAINE ANTOINE JOBARD 2018
tastingDescription: 91 points, Vinous - "This has a very feisty bouquet, quite feral compared to its peers, showing just a touch of warmth compared to the more refined Poruzots. The palate is more "controlled" but still quite rich and maybe overly generous at the expense of tension and nervosite, especially on the finish." (January, 2020).

name: MEURSAULT 1ER GENEVRIERES - LATOUR GIRAUD CUVEE DES PIERRE
nameSanitized: meursault 1er genevrieres - latour giraud cuvee des pierre
sort: MEURSAULT 1ER GENEVRIERES - LATOUR GIRAUD CUVEE DES PIERRE
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Burghound: "Intense and mineral-driven...flavours brim with old vine sap that imparts a sappiness to the mouthfeel while buffering the very firm acid spine shaping the impressively long finish. This is terrific and impeccably well-balanced and a wine that should age for a very long time..." (June 2020)

name: MEURSAULT 1ER LES CHARMES - ALBERT BICHOT ORGANIC
nameSanitized: meursault 1er les charmes - albert bichot organic

tastingDescription: 93 points, Wine Spectator - ‘‘The creamy texture and oyster shell aromas and flavors set the pace here, along with peach, lemon, vanilla, butter and spice notes. Well-balanced, with a lingering finish of butter and spice. Drink now through 2025’’  (October 2019)

name: MEURSAULT 1ER PERRIERES - CHATEAU DE MEURSAULT 2018
tastingDescription: Very saline, mineral and stony on the nose with hints of stone fruit and apples. The palate impresses with a lovely texture and tension, plus savoury nutty, stone fruit and stone fruit characters with a dash of blood orange. The finish is lovely and persistent. A beautiful chardonnay from one of the best premiers crus in Meursault.

name: MEURSAULT 1ER PORUZOTS - ANTOINE JOBARD 2019
tastingDescription: 94 points, Vinous - "It is well defined on the nose, offering scents of hazelnut and grilled walnut, hints of orange blossom and a very faint menthol notes. The palate is well balanced with a fine bead of acidity, a judicious tang of ginger that lends tension, and impressive depth toward the finish, which lingers in the mouth. Superb." (January, 2020).

name: MEURSAULT CLOS DU DOMAINE - HENRI DARNAT 2018
nameSanitized: meursault clos du domaine - henri darnat 2018
sort: MEURSAULT CLOS DU DOMAINE - HENRI DARNAT 2018
tastingDescription: Henri Darnat's 2018 Meursault Clos Du Domaine comes across as perfumed, weightless and very beautiful. Floral aromatics of honeysuckle and jasmine, along with oak nuances of vanilla and hazelnut, lead to stone fruit, pear and lemon in this compelling, lay

name: MEURSAULT DOMAINE DU PAVILLON - ALBERT BICHOT ORGANIC

name: MGM - ACQUESI BRACHETTO
tastingDescription: This Brachetto has an enticing deep rose color with an elegant perlage. The bouquet consists of raspberry, cherry, and delicate rose petals. A pleasant acidity complements the sweet flavour, matching perfectly with fresh cheeses, savoury or spicy cuisine, and sexy chocolate desserts.

name: MICHEL LORIOT - BLANC DE NOIRS AUTHENTIC MEUNIER BRUT
nameSanitized: michel loriot - blanc de noirs authentic meunier brut
nameSuffix: BLANC DE NOIRS AUTHENTIC MEUNIER BRUT
sort: MICHEL LORIOT - BLANC DE NOIRS AUTHENTIC MEUNIER BRUT
tastingDescription: A Champagne 100% Meunier as elaborated by German Loriot, Michel’s grandfather from the 1930s. This champagne of pleasure is the revelation of the black Meunier grape variety. A fruity discovery, all in flexibility and roundness that will delight all guests.

name: MINERVOIS - LA CONDAMINE PAULIGNAN 2015
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Anthony Gismondi: "The mix is Syrah, Grenache, Carignan and Cinsault, all grown on the clay limestone terroir of Siran and La Livinière, and it overdelivers right from the glass. The nose has an amazingly fragrant floral note previewing red and black fruits with a peppery undertone...Real wine and solid value." (May 2018)

name: MIONETTO - PROSECCO TREVISO BRUT
tastingDescription: This well-structured sparkling Prosecco stands out for its luminous straw yellow hue and for its emphatic yet stylish mousse. The bouquet is redolent of Golden Delicious apple, while the palate is appealingly marked by aromatic notes of honey.

name: MISSION HILL - FAMILY ESTATE COMPENDIUM 2016
tastingDescription: On the nose, notes of ripe red cherries and fresh cassis with expressions of fresh blackberry and leaf. The palate shows a great depth of intense ripe dark fruit with hints of dried herbs. The wine is structurally complete with fine and explicit tannins in a long, persistent finish.

name: MISSION HILL - FIVE VINEYARDS CABERNET MERLOT
nameSanitized: mission hill - five vineyards cabernet merlot
sort: MISSION HILL - FIVE VINEYARDS CABERNET MERLOT
tastingDescription: Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, and Petit Verdot for extra body and tannins. Red currant and cherry aromas are on the nose and extend through to the first sip. Wild sage and vanilla notes intermingle. Eighteen months of oak barrel aging complete the lingering finish.

name: MISSION HILL - FIVE VINEYARDS CHARDONNAY
tastingDescription: The aromatics begin with yellow peach, lemon, and jasmine. The mouthfeel exudes flavours of green apple, fresh pineapple, lime, and a pleasant creaminess from oak aging. The finish lingers on this medium-bodied wine.

name: MISSION HILL - FIVE VINEYARDS PINOT BLANC
nameSanitized: mission hill - five vineyards pinot blanc
sort: MISSION HILL - FIVE VINEYARDS PINOT BLANC
tastingDescription: This vibrant Pinot Blanc begins with aromas of Golden Delicious apple and white peach then unfolds into flavourful layers of pink grapefruit, nectar and a lemon-lime crisp acidity throughout the bright mouthfeel.

name: MISSION HILL - FIVE VINEYARDS PINOT GRIGIO 2018
nameSanitized: mission hill - five vineyards pinot grigio 2018
sort: MISSION HILL - FIVE VINEYARDS PINOT GRIGIO 2018
tastingDescription: An enticing bouquet of Anjou pear, guava, and kiwi. The mouthfeel is lush and crisp with white peach, apricot, and orange blossom honey flavours intermingling with candied ginger and spice for a tangy finish. This unoaked Pinot Grigio is a perfect marriage of fruit and acidity. Delicious and refreshing on the palate.

name: MISSION HILL - FIVE VINEYARDS SAUVIGNON BLANC
nameSanitized: mission hill - five vineyards sauvignon blanc
sort: MISSION HILL - FIVE VINEYARDS SAUVIGNON BLANC
tastingDescription: This wine is dry and zesty beginning with the nose of lemon zest and honey. Lime and tropical fruit enter the flavour spectrum along with lemongrass. Crisp on the finish.

name: MISSION HILL - OCULUS 2013
tastingDescription: Rich notes of plum, blackberry, boysenberry, leather and spice notes are supported by a dense structure that adds depth. The harmony between fruit, tannins and acidity should allow this to age beautifully.

name: MISSION HILL - RESERVE CABERNET SAUVIGNON 2018
tastingDescription: Structured and complex, our Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon delivers balanced black fruit, spice, anise and mocha all supported by a lengthy finish.

name: MISSION HILL - RESERVE CHARDONNAY 2019
tastingDescription: A constant star of the Okanagan, this wine shines with notes of citrus, apple, pineapple, coconut and spice. Beautifully bright, fresh and round.

name: MISSION HILL - RESERVE MERITAGE 2020
tastingDescription: Elegant and complex, with fleshy blackberry, cassis and dark cherry perfectly complimented by a sophisticated earthy finish. Great structure, balance, and length.

name: MISSION HILL - RESERVE MERLOT 2018
tastingDescription: This stellar southern Okanagan estates deliver this fruit froward and voluptuous Merlot. Power and structure dance while lush, round flavours of plum, blackberry, cedar and fig flourish. Fifteen months of oak barrel aging completed this wine.

name: MISSION HILL - RESERVE PINOT GRIS 2019
tastingDescription: The food-pairing ability of this grape speaks to its heritage in Germany (where it is known as both Rulander & Grauburgunder) and France (from the Alsace region). So pasta dishes, salad courses, seafood and for BC a specialty, planked salmon.

name: MISSION HILL - RESERVE PINOT NOIR 2018
tastingDescription: A charming classic, our Reserve Pinot Noir delights with layers of red fruit and brambleberry. Delicate tannins, savoury notes and a subtle hint of herbal spice deliver a complex wine that is sure to enchant.

name: MISSION HILL - RESERVE RIESLING ICEWINE 2016
tastingDescription: The Reserve Riesling Icewine has bright aromas of vanilla and citrus fruit announcing flavours of ripe pear, pineapple and hints of orange peel. The sweetness is offset by mouth-watering acidity. A definite treat for the senses.

name: MISSION HILL - RESERVE SAUVIGNON BLANC 2020
tastingDescription: Zesty grapefruit flavours zip across a palate edged with notes of damp herbs and snow peas, as well as a hint of roasted nut. It's a rich yet refreshing wine with intense aromas of passion fruit, nettle, grapefruit, lemon and lime.

name: MISSION HILL - RESERVE SYRAH 2019
tastingDescription: The Reserve Syrah is inky in colour with aromas of dark fruits, violet and peppercorn. This vintage is full-bodied with flavours of Bing cherries, rosemary, anise, and brambleberry. A touch of cedar from 14 months of oak barrel aging rounds out the pleasant, long finish.

name: MISSION HILL - RESERVE VIDAL ICEWINE 2016
tastingDescription: This delicious Icewine tastes like peaches in cream covered with liquid honey, pineapple purée and a dash of slivered almond, with a bright orange citrus note to keep the palate refreshed.

name: MISSION HILL FAMILY ESTATE - OCULUS 2016
tastingDescription: Lifted and intense with notes of dark plum, black cherry and cassis. The palate is structured, concentrated and well balanced with notes of fresh herbs, tobacco and spice. A tremendous tannin structure and excellent length on the finish.

name: MISSION HILL FAMILY ESTATE - QUATRAIN 2016
tastingDescription: 2016 Quatrain has a distinguished nose with perfumed violets and blue fruits, nuances of black pepper, and savoury spices. The palate brings a rich concentration of ripe bramble fruit and impressions of sweet licorice and an earthiness. The satin-smooth finish is beautifully persistent with silky fine grained texture to finish.

name: MISSION HILL FAMILY ESTATE - RESERVE BRUT
nameSanitized: mission hill family estate - reserve brut
sort: MISSION HILL FAMILY ESTATE - RESERVE BRUT
tastingDescription: Tremendously fresh with notes of crisp apple, white peach and Anjou pear all highlighted by vibrant acidity and bright citrus on the finish. Blend of Chardonnay (89%) and Pinot Noir (11%).

name: MISSION HILL FAMILY ESTATE OCULUS 2014 3L
tastingDescription: 2014 Oculus is complex and deep, with great purity and elegance. Rich notes of plum, blackberry, boysenberry, leather and spice notes are supported by a dense structure that adds depth. The harmony between fruit, tannins and acidity should allow this to age beautifully.

name: MISSION HILL FAMILY ESTATE QUATRAIN 2014 1.5L
tastingDescription: Our 2014 Quatrain is highlighted by dark cherry, violet, dark plums and baking spice. This full-bodied and dense red is incredibly well balanced with fine tannin, elegant structure and a lengthy finish. A blend of 44% Merlot, 28% Syrah, 14% Cabernet Franc, 14% Cabernet Sauvignon.

name: MISSION RIDGE - PREMIUM DRY RED
tastingDescription: A well balanced Red with supple tannins and notes of cassis. The finish is velvety with notes of spice.

name: MISSION RIDGE - PREMIUM DRY RED
tastingDescription: A well balanced red with supple tannins and notes of cassis. The finish is velvety with notes of spice.

name: MISSION RIDGE - PREMIUM DRY WHITE
tastingDescription: An approachable white with a round mouth feel and balanced acidity. Finishing with subtle and refreshing notes of pineapple.

name: MISSION RIDGE - PREMIUM DRY WHITE
tastingDescription: An approachable White with a round mouth feel and balanced acidity. Finishing with subtle and refreshing notes of pineapple.

name: MOET AND CHANDON - BRUT IMPERIAL
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Spectator - "Bright and balanced, featuring a fine, lively bead, mouthwatering acidity and a lightly toasty profile of poached pear and black currant flavors, with rich hints of lemon curd and pastry cream. Drink now through 2020." (November 2018)

name: MOET AND CHANDON - BRUT IMPERIAL
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Spectator - "Bright and balanced, featuring a fine, lively bead, mouthwatering acidity and a lightly toasty profile of poached pear and black currant flavors, with rich hints of lemon curd and pastry cream. Drink now through 2020." (November 2018)

name: MOET AND CHANDON - BRUT IMPERIAL
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Spectator - "Bright and balanced, featuring a fine, lively bead, mouthwatering acidity and a lightly toasty profile of poached pear and black currant flavors, with rich hints of lemon curd and pastry cream. Drink now through 2020." (November 2018)

name: MOET AND CHANDON - BRUT IMPERIAL
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Spectator - "Bright and balanced, featuring a fine, lively bead, mouthwatering acidity and a lightly toasty profile of poached pear and black currant flavors, with rich hints of lemon curd and pastry cream. Drink now through 2020." (November 2018)

name: MOET AND CHANDON - GRAND VINTAGE 12
tastingDescription: 92 Points, James Suckling - "Some houses have threaded this riper vintage into a handy cuvée and Moët is one of these. Ripe-pear and toasted-brioche aromas here, while the palate has attractive, vinous, fleshy fruit. Peach and light cherry notes to close. Drink or hold." (September 2018)

name: MOET AND CHANDON - NECTAR IMPERIAL
tastingDescription: 90 Points, James Suckling - "Strong lemon, grapefruit and peach fruit aromas are on offer here. This is upfront and fresh on the nose. The palate has forward fruit in the same vein. Tangy, tropical finish. Drink now." (October 2017)

name: MOET AND CHANDON - NIRO ROSE
tastingDescription: A delicious nose of intense fruitiness of ripe berries: wild strawberry, redcurrant and blackcurrant and powerful notes of ripe yellow peach. A sensual palate persistent of red fruits, nutmeg and caramel.

name: MOET AND CHANDON - ROSE IMPERIAL
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Spectator - "Mouthwatering acidity drives this sleek rosé Champagne, with juicy star fruit and raspberry flavors riding the lively mousse, accented by hints of pastry, orange peel, smoke and dried herb. Drink now." (November 2018)

name: MOET AND CHANDON - ROSE IMPERIAL MINI
nameSanitized: moet and chandon - rose imperial mini
sort: MOET AND CHANDON - ROSE IMPERIAL MINI
tastingDescription: False

name: MOMOKAWA PEARL NIGORI SAKE
tastingDescription: Rich and creamy with bright and bold tropical notes like banana, pineapple and coconut. Vanilla and pineapple on the nose. Pair with sweet treats, spicy cuisine and barbecue.

name: MONFERRATO - ACCORNERO FREISA BERNARDINA
tastingDescription: Freisa is widely cultivated throughout Piedmont and is the closest relative to Nebbiolo. Delicate nose with hints of raspberries, violet and dark plums, complemented by notes of fragrant herbs and spices. The taste of wine is full, intense, fairly fresh, harmonious, perfectly balanced, with juicy fruitiness, moderate acidity, well-integrated tannins and a long, persistent aftertaste.

name: MONFERRATO BIANCO - TENUTA MONTEMAGNO SOLIS VIS 2018
nameSanitized: monferrato bianco - tenuta montemagno solis vis 2018
sort: MONFERRATO BIANCO - TENUTA MONTEMAGNO SOLIS VIS 2018
tastingDescription: This Timorasso from Piedmont displays an Intense nose with with flowers and pear notes, hints of gunflint and honey, all of which come together in a rich, harmonious style. Smooth, enveloping and savory, the palate offers yellow peach, lemon zest and honeyed nut before a saline finish. Fresh acidity lifts the long and persistent finish. This is a wine with great aging potential.

name: MONTAGNY 1ER  - BOUCHARD PERE 2017
tastingDescription: The Montagny appellation, although it is not very well known as of yet, deserves the attention of lovers of pleasant, fresh, mineral white wines. Delicate aromas of fruit and honey. Lively and aromatic on the palate, this wine reveals an appealing personality. Pair with seafood (lobster, crab, etc.) and fresh water fish in cream sauce.

name: MONTAGNY 1ER LES CHANIOTS - ALBERT SOUNIT 2015
tastingDescription: This 100% Chardonnay has aromas of hazelnut and roasted notes. The palate is round and structured with woody aromas. Enjoy with foie gras or lobster.

name: MONTE CREEK  - LIVING LAND SPARKLING ROSE 2020
nameSanitized: monte creek  - living land sparkling rose 2020
sort: MONTE CREEK  - LIVING LAND SPARKLING ROSE 2020
tastingDescription: No special occasion is required for this elegant, bubbly rosé. With aromas of strawberries, citrus and a hint of peach, it is crisp and worth celebrating in itself. Ripe strawberry and juicy watermelon come through clearly on the palate. Made from 100% estate grown Marquette using the Charmat method.

name: MONTE CREEK - LIVING LAND PINOT NOIR
nameSanitized: monte creek - living land pinot noir
sort: MONTE CREEK - LIVING LAND PINOT NOIR
tastingDescription: False

name: MONTE CREEK RANCH - CABERNET MERLOT 2017
tastingDescription: This Cabernet Merlot is a 50/50 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Cabernet Sauvignon brings structure and body, while the Merlot brings plushness and softens the wine. The fruit was partially fermented in our 7,000 L oak vats, creating a rounder, smoother texture than fermentation in stainless steel, then aged 18 months in French oak barrels. The wine has ripe plum fruit and cassis liqueur characters lifted by notes of forest floor and savory herbs. It is medium-bodied with abundant ripe and polished tannins. This is balanced by rich plum and black cherry fruit, enhanced by blackberry and subtle baking spice notes. The fruit and substantial structure stands up beautifully to smoked duck breast with berry compote.

name: MONTEFALCO SAGRANTINO - BELLAFONTE COLLENOTTOLO 2013
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Spectator: “A well-spiced, fresh red, with chewy tannins providing a sculpted frame for flavors of crushed black cherry, hot stone and iron, and dried thyme and strawberry. Firm finish. Drink now through 2027.” (November 2018)

name: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO - ANGELO
tastingDescription: Bright and deep colour. At the nose, dark cherry, raspberry with interesting notes of pepper and hints of vanilla.

name: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO - CANTINA TOLLO PIETRAME LIMITED EDI
nameSanitized: montepulciano dabruzzo - cantina tollo pietrame limited edi
sort: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO - CANTINA TOLLO PIETRAME LIMITED EDI
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Luca Maroni  'Annuario del Migliori Vini' 2021: "Made from 100% estate Montepulciano d'Abruzzo, the Pietrame Edizione Limitata is harvested at the beginning of October and refined in stainless steel for up to twelve months before bottling.  The wine is ruby red in colour with brilliant violet reflections.  Floral aromas of violets and of flavours of wild cherries, woodland berries and spice fill the glass.  Full bodied and well structured this wine has both elegance and balance and finishes soft with subtle, integrated tannins.  A wonderful match with pasta and baked pasta (pasta al forno) as well as roasted and grilled meats and semi-mature cheeses."

name: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO - CITRA
tastingDescription: Pleasant, lingering fruit aromas. The palate is dry, well-balanced and delightfully tannic, with concentrated berry flavours. A perfect accompaniment to grilled meats, rich pasta dishes and vegetarian entrees.

name: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO - MARRAMIERO LA CHIAVE
tastingDescription: A good introduction to the Montepulciano grape variety, La Chiave, meaning “the key” in Italian, is a soft, fruity and approachable expression from the Abruzzo region that, until now, has been safely locked away. Enjoy with pizza!

name: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO - TALAMONTI MODA
tastingDescription: Multiple nuances of violet blend with intense and persistent aromas of cherry, plum and fresh raspberry in a harmonious bouquet. On the palate, the rich red fruit flavours express great elegance. Short-lived aging in oak barrels produces a distinctive wine with tannins that are dense but unobtrusive.

name: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO - TIBERIO 2018
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Eric Guido, Vinous: "...The dark, floral-laced black cherry beneath is unmistakeable, as are the smoky mineral tones that evolve alongside. Here I find wonderfully silky textures, ushering in ripe red and blue fruits, offset by tactile minerals that saturate all that they touch. This comes across as both ample yet also refined. The finish is like a basket of sweet violets and cherries, perfectly framed by round tannins. The 2018 is one of the best young vintages I've tasted on Tiberio's Montepulciano." (April 2021)

name: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO - TOLLO COLLE SECCO RUBINO
nameSanitized: montepulciano dabruzzo - tollo colle secco rubino
sort: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO - TOLLO COLLE SECCO RUBINO
tastingDescription: This medium-bodied wine with bright red fruits, earthy spices and a savoury hint, has fresh acidity and well-integrated tannins to round out the profile.

name: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO - ZACCAGNINI TRALCETTO 2017
tastingDescription: This beautiful Montepulciano d’Abruzzo with a piece of vine cutting on the bottle shows depth with strawberry, vanilla, plum, herbs and a cedary spice character

name: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO RISERVA- CANTINA TOLLO MO 2014
nameSanitized: montepulciano dabruzzo riserva- cantina tollo mo 2014
sort: MONTEPULCIANO D'ABRUZZO RISERVA- CANTINA TOLLO MO 2014
tastingDescription: A reserve Montepulciano d’Abruzzo with intense fruit aromas and notes of black cherry and forest fruits. It is aged 24 months in oak casks followed by six months in the bottle prior to release.

name: MONTEPULCIANO DABRUZZO - CITRA NIRO 2016
tastingDescription: 100% Montepulciano.  A fresh and juicy nose with notes of wild cherry, flowers and liquorice with hints of prunes and tobacco. This wine has finesse and fine length, balanced by lovely energy and a fine texture. Very drinkable. (2016 vintage: 95 points, Decanter World Wine Awards).

name: MONTES - CHERUB ROSE 2020
tastingDescription: Brilliant, pale coral in colour with an intense and expressive nose; a predominant aroma of fresh red fruits, like raspberry and tart cherry. The palate is balanced and fresh, with crisp, natural acidity and a medium finish. A very versatile wine; ideal for any occasion.

name: MONTLOUIS SUR LOIRE - LA GRANGE TIPHAINE CLEF DE SOL CHENIN
nameSanitized: montlouis sur loire - la grange tiphaine clef de sol chenin
nameSuffix: LA GRANGE TIPHAINE CLEF DE SOL CHENIN
sort: MONTLOUIS SUR LOIRE - LA GRANGE TIPHAINE CLEF DE SOL CHENIN
tastingDescription: Biodynamic. Crafted with old vine chenin, this organic wine displays note of of honeysuckle on the nose, linden with pear and lime flavours. Broad-shouldered, featuring electric acidity and a mineral streak cutting through, delivering focus and precision. Offers a silky mouthfeel and an exotic side, with ginger, Korean pear, persimmon and green almond notes running through the mineral-infused finish.

name: MONTRACHET GRAND CRU- DOMAINE JACQUES PRIEUR 2018
nameSanitized: montrachet grand cru- domaine jacques prieur 2018
sort: MONTRACHET GRAND CRU- DOMAINE JACQUES PRIEUR 2018
tastingDescription: 94-96 points, Vinous:  "The 2018 Montrachet Grand Cru is matured in 60% new oak. It has a finely tuned bouquet with scents of granite filtering through the green apple and pear aromas, and just a little linseed oil in the background. The well-balanced palate displays a fine bead of acidity, good tension from start to finish and a crescendo of concentration that leaves you feeling that you are in the presence of a famous (the most famous?) vineyard. This is a very worthy "Monty" with great potential." (January 2020).

name: MONTSANT - CELLER DE CAPCANES MAS DONIS NEGRE
nameSanitized: montsant - celler de capcanes mas donis negre
nameSuffix: CELLER DE CAPCANES MAS DONIS NEGRE
sort: MONTSANT - CELLER DE CAPCANES MAS DONIS NEGRE
tastingDescription: 90 Points, WinesScores.ca - "Made from Garnacha with Tempranillo, Merlot, Cabernet and Samsao...this wine expresses fragrant blueberry and black raspberry, pretty violet notes, licorice and vanilla. It is supple and delicious, generous purple fruit and sarsaparilla roll across the palate. Fleshy and juicy it has a long fresh finish and is entirely quaffable." (Jun 2020)

name: MONTSANT - CELLER DE CAPCANES PERAJ PETITA 2017 KOSHER
nameSanitized: montsant - celler de capcanes peraj petita 2017 kosher
nameSuffix: CELLER DE CAPCANES PERAJ PETITA 2017 KOSHER
sort: MONTSANT - CELLER DE CAPCANES PERAJ PETITA 2017 KOSHER
tastingDescription: 90 Points, James Suckling - “Lots of blackberries, some flowers and licorice on the nose. In spite of the generous ripeness, it's quite dry and slightly sappy on the palate...A very good food-wine. Drink now or hold." (December 2018). Certified Kosher for Passover by the Orthodox Union.

name: MONTSANT - CELLER DES CAPCANES MAS DONIS OLD VINES 2017
nameSanitized: montsant - celler des capcanes mas donis old vines 2017
nameSuffix: CELLER DES CAPCANES MAS DONIS OLD VINES 2017
sort: MONTSANT - CELLER DES CAPCANES MAS DONIS OLD VINES 2017
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Jebb Dunnuck - "The finest vintage of this cuvée to date, the 2016 is 85% Garnacha and 15% Syrah...Tasting like a top Priorat with its beautiful blue fruits, violets, ground pepper, rose petals, and amble minerality, it hits the palate with medium to full-bodied richness, remarkable purity of fruit, and a great, great finish." (Apr 2019)

name: MONTSANT - CELLER EL MASROIG SOLA FRED 2018
nameSanitized: montsant - celler el masroig sola fred 2018
sort: MONTSANT - CELLER EL MASROIG SOLA FRED 2018
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Daenna Van Mulligen - Expect smoked spice and roasted meat, fleur de sel and iodine all wrapped up in strawberry and saddle leather. It is supple yet juicy, with licorice, spiced and strawberry flavours dominating the palate. Wonderfully balanced, and that savouriness you experience on the nose returns on a lengthy finish. (August 23, 2019)

name: MOON CURSER - BORDER VINES 2019
tastingDescription: Great accolades here, Moon Curser Vineyards received the 2019 Best Performing Small Winery in Canada from Wine Align in their National Wine Awards for Canada. Exciting stuff just like this 5 varietal Bordeaux blend that is always a treat. A taste of Osoyoos, as all the fruit comes from this desert zone along the border. Full of fruit and character, the black cherry and cassis notes combine with structure and persistence.

name: MORAINE - GEWURZTRAMINER 2019
tastingDescription: "A bouquet of exotic flowers: gardenia, jasmine and orange blossom conjure luscious summer days. On the palate, these flowers are freshened by spicy ginger and bright, mouthwatering lime zest. Luscious and Alsatian in style, this wine makes a beautiful apertif on it's own, or would pair deliciously with braised pork dishes and Asian-inspired dishes featuring simple fresh ingredients.

name: MORAINE ESTATE WINERY - PINOT NOIR 2019
tastingDescription: From the Naramata Bench, this really shows the Okanagan success with this grape. Pinot Noir textures and red berry fruits abound and set the stage for so many food options.

name: MORELLINO DI SCANSANO - LE PUPILLE 2019
tastingDescription: 92 Points, James Suckling: “The plum and berry character is rich and intense with dried berries as well as ripe cherries. Hints of flowers. Medium-bodied, round textured with pretty bark, earth and hints of dried spice. Delicious finish. Drink now.” (July 2018)

name: MOREY SAINT DENIS - GEANTET PANSIOT 2019
tastingDescription: False

name: MOREY SAINT DENIS - GERARD RAPHET 2018
tastingDescription: Aromas of summer berries, warm earth, baking spices. Medium-bodies tannins and good concentration but never heavy. Red plums, black cherries and chocolate dust

name: MOREY ST DENIS - DOMAINE TORTOCHOT 2019
tastingDescription: Burghound: "There is a sleek and nicely refined texture to the middle weight flavors thanks to the relatively fine-grained tannins shaping the slightly tangy and warm finish..." (January 2018)

name: MOREY ST DENIS 1ER LA RIOTTE - DOMAINE TAUPENOT MERME 2015
nameSanitized: morey st denis 1er la riotte - domaine taupenot merme 2015
sort: MOREY ST DENIS 1ER LA RIOTTE - DOMAINE TAUPENOT MERME 2015
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Advocate: "The 2015 Morey-Saint-Denis 1er Cru La Riotte opens in the glass with a pretty nose of sweet cherry, warm spice and strawberry. On the palate, the wine is medium to full-bodied, with a chalky chassis of tannin, bright acids and a firm, grippy finish. Drink: 2020 - 2030." (April 2018)

name: MOREY ST DENIS 1ER LES RUCHOTS - DOMAINE DES BEAUMONT 2015
nameSanitized: morey st denis 1er les ruchots - domaine des beaumont 2015
sort: MOREY ST DENIS 1ER LES RUCHOTS - DOMAINE DES BEAUMONT 2015
tastingDescription: Notes of crushed stone, earth, animal musk and undergrowth. Fresh and complex nose. The palate reveals silky textures with tart red fruits. Beautifully balanced with fine tannins. Long dark fruit palate-coating  with a delicate velvety texture. Long finish.

name: MORGON - MATHIEU & CAMILLE LAPIERRE 2018
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Decanter: "Marcel Lapierre is something of a hero to the natural wine movement, and his Morgon has been called The Original Natural Wine. This delivers star-bright, sappy, mouthwatering dark fruit with a completely irresistible energy. His wines sell out fast, so buy when you see it." (November 2017)

name: MORGON - MICHEL GUIGNIER CANON 2019
tastingDescription: 96 Points, James Suckling - "Great wines are often paradoxical and this has a deep, floral nose with such earthy subtlety, which might sound ridiculous, but is anything but that. On the palate, this is a masterpiece of racy and mineral elegance, the fine tannins building beautifully at the very long, filigree finish." March 2021

name: MOSCATO - BAREFOOT CELLARS
tastingDescription: Barefoot Moscato is delightfully sweet with lush fruity aromas. Hints of citrus skip across flavours of juicy peach and ripe apricots. A bright, crisp finish dances in at the end. Paring well with spicy Asian cuisine and light desserts. It's good at keeping things fresh with some fruit or mild cheese too.

name: MOSCATO - JACOB'S CREEK
tastingDescription: This sweet wine has an attractive nose of tropical fruits and white peach aromas with undertones of honeysuckle and lemon, a fantastic pairing for desserts like lemon meringue pie or peach cobbler. The delicate frizzante style is balanced with lively and soft fruit sweetness.

name: MOSCATO - JACOB'S CREEK DOTS LIGHTER
tastingDescription: False

name: MOSCATO - PICNIC BASKET
tastingDescription: Light, fresh and naturally sweet with a wonderful mix of citrus, pineapple and floral flavours. A subtle spritz enhances the juicy, refreshing fruit flavours of this wine.

name: MOSCATO - YELLOW TAIL
tastingDescription: This [yellow tail] Moscato is everything a great wine should be – zingy, refreshing and easy to drink. Aromas of orange blossom, white peach, rose water and honey suckle; the palate is off-dry, light bodied with flavours of stone fruit, mandarin oranges and floral notes; balanced with a refreshing finish.

name: MOSCATO D'ASTI - RUFFINO
tastingDescription: The bouquet is very fragrant and displays aromas characteristic of the Moscato varietal. Hints of sage and citrus fruit give way to distinct notes of peach and orange blossoms. The wine delivers a pleasantly sweet taste, perfectly tempered by the freshness offered by its refined bubbles. Flavors of sage and fresh white stone fruit linger on the palate.

name: MOSCATO ROSE - JACOB'S CREEK
tastingDescription: Fresh, fragrant raspberry and strawberry aromas with hints of pear. Light and refreshing on the palate with red summer berry flavours, balanced with lively and soft fruit sweetness. Serve chilled. Ideal as an aperitif with spicy seafood dishes or fruit.

name: MOSEL RIESLING BRAUNEBERGER JUFFER - FRITZ HAAG GROSSES GEW
nameSanitized: mosel riesling brauneberger juffer - fritz haag grosses gew
sort: MOSEL RIESLING BRAUNEBERGER JUFFER - FRITZ HAAG GROSSES GEW
tastingDescription: False

nameSanitized: mosel riesling spatlese - dr loosen urziger wurzgarten
sort: MOSEL RIESLING SPATLESE - DR LOOSEN URZIGER WURZGARTEN

name: MOSEL RIESLING SPATLESE - TONI JOST BACHARACHER
nameSanitized: mosel riesling spatlese - toni jost bacharacher
sort: MOSEL RIESLING SPATLESE - TONI JOST BACHARACHER
tastingDescription: False

name: MOULIN A VENT - J P BRUN TERRES DOREES 2017
nameSanitized: moulin a vent - j p brun terres dorees 2017
sort: MOULIN A VENT - J P BRUN TERRES DOREES 2017
tastingDescription: 93 Points, James Suckling: "Aromas of very ripe strawberries with lemon rind and floral undertones. Medium- to full-bodied, dense and juicy. Love the depth and focus to this wine. Drink now." (February 2018)

name: MOULIN A VENT - THIBAULT LIGER BELAIR VIEILLES VIGNES 14
nameSanitized: moulin a vent - thibault liger belair vieilles vignes 14
sort: MOULIN A VENT - THIBAULT LIGER BELAIR VIEILLES VIGNES 14
tastingDescription: 92 Points, VInous: "Exotic, highly perfumed aromas... Juicy and sharply focused, offering concentrated black raspberry, cherry compote and violet pastille flavors and a touch of allspice on the back half. Finishes smooth, sweet and very long, with sneaky tannins adding structure and gentle grip to the wine's plush fruit." (August 2016)

name: MOULIS - BRANAS GRAND POUJEAUX 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Branas Grand Poujeaux is backward but finely detailed on the nose, where precise blackberry and wild strawberry fruit intermingles with briary and, later, cassis and violet aromas. The palate is medium-bodied with supple tannins, almost understated at first, but it gains depth with aeration and leaves traces of tobacco and tar on the aftertaste. Excellent. Drinking Window: 2023 - 2040."
92 pts, Vinous

name: MOULIS - CHATEAU BRANAS GRAND POUJEAUX 2009
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine Advocate: "A sleeper of the vintage... A big-time wine, opaque purple in color, with loads of cassis, smoke, incense and licorice as well as an earthiness reminiscent of a St.-Estephe, this wine is full-bodied and long, with sweet tannin and an overall classic constitution. Drink: 2012 - 2032." (December 2011)

name: MOULIS - CHATEAU BRILLETTE 2009
tastingDescription: False

name: MOULIS - CHATEAU CHASSE SPLEEN 2017
tastingDescription:
"The 2017 Chasse-Spleen has really come together nicely today. From bottle it is bright, vibrant with a good bit of energy and drive. Sweet tobacco, grilled herbs, mint, dried berry and cedar lead into the super expressive finish."
90 Points, Vinous

name: MOULIS - CHATEAU CHASSE SPLEEN 2018
tastingDescription:
"This structured wine is firm, with dark tannins that promise aging. The fruit hints at delicious black currant flavors and balanced acidity. It will be a stylish wine, but wait to drink until 2026."
94 pts, Wine Enthusiast

name: MOULIS - CHATEAU CHASSE-SPLEEN 2018
tastingDescription:
"This structured wine is firm, with dark tannins that promise aging. The fruit hints at delicious black currant flavors and balanced acidity. It will be a stylish wine, but wait to drink until 2026."
94 pts, Wine Enthusiast

name: MOULIS - CHATEAU MAUCAILLOU 2017
tastingDescription:
"A prominent black currant aroma and ripe tannins give this wine a fine balance. The core is dry and firm, exhibiting the potential to age and certainly offering final richness. Drink from 2022."
90 Points, Wine Enthusiast

name: MOULIS - CHATEAU MAUCAILLOU 2018
tastingDescription:
"Perfumed with a floral character, this is already a balanced wine. Tannins and fruit harmonize with a vanilla edge from the wood aging. This wine should be ready from 2025."
91 pts, Wine Enthusiast

name: MOULIS - CHATEAU POUJEAUX 2017
tastingDescription:
"Right from the nose this has rich, deep cassis and dark fruit notes, as well as a lovely juicy vibrancy through the palate. There are firm tannins that have some vibrancy to them. Although it's not as persistent in structure as in 2016 and 2015, this is an extremely successful wine in the 2017 vintage. Aged in 33% new oak."
92 Points, Decanter

name: MOULIS - CHATEAU POUJEAUX 2018
tastingDescription:
"Poujeaux is a wine that I often hold up as classic example of what the Médoc can achieve, and here again it's a huge success. It has a beautiful nose, with vibrant and well extracted brambly dark fruits on the palate - but not so much that it feels like it's pushing too hard. It's an architectural wine, a more classic take on the vintage, but for me this is where the money is in Moulis. It takes its time to unravel, and the heat of the summer comes through in its rich, ripe mouthfeel. The tannins close in on the finish, which has a menthol and eucalyptus edge that suggests a long life ahead."
93 pts, Decanter

name: MT. BOUCHERIE - MERLOT 2017
tastingDescription: A medium- to full-bodied wine showing soft tannins and a rich mouthfeel. Aromas and flavours of plum, black cherry, chocolate and spice. Fresh acidity frames the lengthy finish. Look for richer red meat dishes or earthy ingredients to pair with this wine.

name: MT. BOUCHERIE - MT. BUBBLES SPARKLING
tastingDescription: An off-dry style of sparkling made "Frizzante" style. This wine is full of vibrant acidity, and green apple aromas. Perfect as an aperitif or with light flavours dishes, summer salads with goat cheese, shellfish.

name: MT. BOUCHERIE - PINOT NOIR 2019
tastingDescription: This medium bodied wine showcases characteristics of bright cherry and vanilla. Filling out with aromas of cigar-box and crisp Autumn leaves.

name: MT. BOUCHERIE - SYRAH 2019
tastingDescription: Mt Boucherie 2018 Syrah was farmed in multiple sites in the South Okanagan and Similkameen Valleys - Black Sage Bench, Golden Mile, and South Cawston. All of these various areas impart their distinctive stamp on the finished wine which showcases aromas and flavours of smoked meat, black cherry, and cracked pepper. A classic match for BBQ and grilled meats.

name: MUMM  NAPA - BRUT PRESTIGE
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Enthusiast - "The winery's signature sparkler...dazzles in rounded oak and a soft texture marked by grapefruit zest and fresh nectarine. Crisp and vibrant, it becomes richer on the finish, showing a spark of honey-baked brioche." (March 2017)

name: MUMM - G.H. GRAND CORDON BRUT CHAMPAGNE
nameSanitized: mumm - g.h. grand cordon brut champagne

tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine Spectator - "Flavors of poached pear, candied lemon zest and biscuit, with a rich hint of roasted almond, ride the lively bead of this crisp, minerally Champagne." (December 2015)

name: MUMM - GRAND CORDON ROSE
tastingDescription: Mumm Grand Cordon Rose:  The Eye: the salmon-pink robe glows with glints of orange, energized by a stream of fine bubbles. The Nose: appetizingly elegant and intense, the wine delivers notes of candied berries: intense, fruity aromas of strawberry and fresh red currants backed with a bit of sweet spice and a subtle yet luscious hint of red-berry coulis. The Palate: a vivacious initial impression: energetic, bracing and fresh. Elegantly structured, it delivers flavors of fragrant summer fruits and a long, bright finish, balanced by the succulent sweetness of red berries.

name: MUSCADET SEVRE ET MAINE - LA MARINIERE
nameSanitized: muscadet sevre et maine - la mariniere
sort: MUSCADET SEVRE ET MAINE - LA MARINIERE
tastingDescription: The Muscadet Sevre et Maine sur Lie appellation is THE wine "par excellence" of the Nantes region.  It owes its name to the two rivers that cross this ideal terroir for the cultivation of the Melon de Bourgogne grape variety. As for the mention "on lees", it indicates that the wine has spent the winter (no more and no less!) in vats on its fine fermentation lees, which gives it all its richness and aromatic complexity.  Beautiful color. Light yellow color with bright reflections.  Due to its aging on lees, the palate is lively, supple and round, with a great liveliness.

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - BOND MELBURY 2014
tastingDescription: 97 Points, James Suckling: “This is so aromatic and beautiful with a floral, dark-berry, blueberry and currant character. An underlying finesse and brightness. Very fine tannins. Long and intense finish. Savory. Drink or hold.” (May 2018)

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - BOND PLURIBUS 2014
tastingDescription: 98 Points, James Suckling: “This is the best Pluribus yet. Extremely aromatic with forest floor, currants and blackberries. Full body, ultra-fine tannins that are immaculately polished and an extremely long finish swathed in flavors of walnuts, chocolate and fruit. Finally, this turns to notes of mushrooms and leaves. Glorious and subtle.” (January 2017)

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - BOND QUELLA 2014
tastingDescription: 97 Points, James Suckling: “Aromas of coffee, dark berries, blueberries and cocoa. Very subtle and perfumed. Full-bodied, firm and very silky with ultra-fine tannins and a savory, mineral and bright finish. Mushroom and bright berry undertones. Needs three or four years for bottle age. Try in 2020.” (May 2018)

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - BOND ST EDEN 2014
nameSanitized: napa valley red - bond st eden 2014
sort: NAPA VALLEY RED - BOND ST EDEN 2014
tastingDescription: 99 Points, James Suckling: “The purity of fruit is fantastic with blackberries, blackcurrants, blueberries and hints of walnut shell. Full-bodied, tight and very focused. Chewy tannins and a long, flavorful finish. Needs three or four years to come together. Try in 2022.” (March 2018)

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - BOND VECINA 2014
tastingDescription: 98+ Points, Wine Advocate: “...a broody, baked blueberries, cassis and anise-laced nose with suggestions of garrigue, dusty earth and bay leaves. Full-bodied, rich, spicy and powerful in the mouth, it offers a lot of latent layers and promises great, great things to come with an incredibly long, layered finish. It needs a bit of time but should cellar beautifully for a good 25 years+.” (Septemer 2017)

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - CONTINUUM 2018
tastingDescription: 100 Points, James Suckling: “This is sensational with blackberries, blueberries and mineral. Extremely floral, too. Full-bodied but so seamless and refined with polished tannins that just melts into the wine. Goes on for minutes. A subtle and glorious wine that will be a new classic for Napa Valley. An emotional red that touches your soul. Energy. Very approachable now but better in 2022.” (December 2018)

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - OPUS ONE 2005
tastingDescription:
This product is part of Discover California Wines Release.
From a long, moderate growing season, according to Silacci, this is fully formed, with gently mulled cassis and cherry preserve flavors that move slowly, yielding hints of savory and iron along the way. A broad swath of tannins emerges on the loamy finish, keeping this firmly grounded in terroir. Gorgeous. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Non-blind Opus One vertical (September 2019). Drink now through 2032. (2019).
96 Points, Wine Spectator.
1 bottle limit.

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - OPUS ONE 2007
tastingDescription:
This product is part of Discover California Wines Release 2020.
Two of the strongest wines ever made at Opus One, the 2007 has terrific black currant fruit, licorice, incense, and subtle smoke, an opulent, even voluptuous mouthfeel, dazzling purity and texture, and a skyscraper-like mouthfeel. This is a sensational Opus One, with sweet tannin and impressive precision and depth. It can be drunk now or cellared for 25 years. Drink: 2009 - 2034. (December 2009)
95 Points, Wine Advocate.

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - OPUS ONE 2007

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - OPUS ONE 2009
tastingDescription:
This product is part of Discover California Wines Release 2020.
The 2009 Opus One is impeccable. It brings together the silkiness of the 2007 with the power and darkness of the 2008, a combination that is hugely appealing, to say the least. With a little air, the 2009 can be enjoyed young, but it is best cellared for at least a few years, which will allow some of the baby fat to drop off. The blend is 81% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Cabernet Franc, 6% Petit Verdot, 3% Merlot and 1% Malbec. (June 2013)
94 Points, Vinous.

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - OPUS ONE 2010
tastingDescription:
This product is part of Discover California Wines Release 2020.
A glorious perfume of sweet charcoal, truffle, black currants and spice box soars from the glass of the saturated purple-colored 2010 Opus One. The gorgeous aromatics are followed by a beautifully knit, full-bodied red blend (84% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5.5% Merlot, 5.5% Cabernet Franc, 4% Petit Verdot and 1% Malbec) displaying lots of spicy black currant fruit, medium to full body, velvety tannins, and not a hard edge to be found. The texture, length and richness are all impressive. This estate has been making great Cabernet-based wines for nearly a decade ... and this is another one. Drink: 2013 - 2033.(October 2013).
96 Points, Wine Advocate.

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - OPUS ONE 2012
tastingDescription:
This product is part of Discover California Wines Release 2020.
Glorious purity of fruit here with black currants, blueberries, dark chocolate, fresh herbs and forest floor. Hints of mint too, plus hazelnut and chocolate. Full body with seamless tannins and balance. Tight and compacted tannins with beautiful fruit and great length. Goes on for minutes. One of the best Opus' in years. Hard not to drink now but better in 2018. This is 79% cabernet sauvignon, 7% cabernet franc, 6% merlot, 6% petit verdot and 2% malbec. (November 2015).
97 Points,  James Suckling.

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - OPUS ONE 2013
tastingDescription:
I love the 2012, but honestly the 2013 just has the edge, because it is just as concentrated and full of fruit but acidity and floral nuance balances out the richness. Dark deep rosemary spice and black olive paste deepens the flavours through the mid-palate and you just have to hang on as this goes spiralling through, drawing the flavours out to a lengthy finish. 2% Malbec, 6% Petit Verdot completes the blend.
100 pts, Decanter

name: NAPA VALLEY RED - OPUS ONE 2013
tastingDescription:

"The greatest Opus ever. Terrific aromas of crushed black currants, blueberries, and flowers with hints of sweet tobacco. Roses continue to exude opulence and class. Full body, superb balance of ultra-fine tannins and vibrant acidity. Complex aftertaste of black fruits and citrus fruit. Extremely persistent. So approachable now and enjoyable. But will be even better in 2019 and beyond. 79% cabernet sauvignon, 7% cabernet franc, 6% merlot, 6% petit verdot, 2% malbec. This will always be beautiful to drink." (September 2016)

tastingDescription: 94 points, Wine Enthusiast - Foaming, vibrant and loaded with finesse, this radiant sparkler opens with delicate but enticing scents of fragrant spring blossom and white stone fruit. The dry elegant palate delivers Granny Smith apple, Bartlett pear and white almond alongside bright acidity. (December 2019)

name: NK'MIP - DREAMCATCHER 2020
tastingDescription: This beautiful off-dry white blend complements many meal choices with sweet apple, ripe peach, hints of spice and bright acidity that all culminate in a refreshing finish.

name: NK'MIP - MERLOT 2018
tastingDescription: As always a solid red that is loaded with south Okanagan black fruit character and soft tannins. Will work with a wide array of menu; at the winery they recommend pork roast, bbq ribs or stuffed peppers.

name: NK'MIP - QWAM QWMT CHARDONNAY 2019
tastingDescription: False

name: NK'MIP - QWAM QWMT SYRAH 2016
tastingDescription: Osoyoos fruit from the hot 2015 vintage drives this Syrah that is a bold and ripe, with black pepper, black cherry and blueberry underscored by dark chocolate, sage and cedar. On the palate, the tannins are plush and round which allows early-drinking, or a cellar choice for up to 10 years.

name: NK'MIP - RIESLING ICEWINE QWAM QWMT 2018
tastingDescription: Apricots, peaches and apples dominate the nose and palate. Look for a strong acid backbone to counterbalance the sugar and provide length to the finish. Pair with spicy Asian, Thai or curry entrees; the fruity sweetness of the icewine softens the spiciness of the food. If pairing with dessert ensure the icewine is sweeter than the dessert.

name: NOILLY PRAT - EXTRA DRY
tastingDescription: On the nose, hazelnut, nutmeg and green apple. Elderflower, citrus notes, and dried fruits can be found on the palate. On the finish, chamomile and coriander.

name: NOTO NERO D'AVOLA - FEUDO MACCARI 2018
tastingDescription: 92 Points, James Suckling: "A polished, refined nero d'avola with blackberries, black olives and blueberries. Hints of stones. Full-bodied with a nicely formed palate and a long, linear finish. A cooler style, compared with the often jammy rendition of this grape." (June 2020)

name: NUERHONG - FUDIAO TEN YEARS
tastingDescription: This special ten year rice wine collection comes in a hand carved red pottery with relief drawings. This golden coloured sake contains thick nuts mellow and has a long finish.

name: NUIT ST GEORGES "AUX BOUDOTS" - DOMAINE MONGEARD MUGNERET
nameSanitized: nuit st georges "aux boudots" - domaine mongeard mugneret
sort: NUIT ST GEORGES "AUX BOUDOTS" - DOMAINE MONGEARD MUGNERET
tastingDescription: The wine is rigorous and lively with great finesse, soft, perfumed bouquet, reminiscent of blackcurrants and wild blackberries. Deep ruby in colour, possess a vigorous personality, with fennel elements and aromas of red fruits. Fine acidity, perfectly balanced and suitable for lying down.

name: NUITS ST GEORGES 1ER LES PRULIERS - DOM TAUPENOT MERME 2013
nameSanitized: nuits st georges 1er les pruliers - dom taupenot merme 2013
sort: NUITS ST GEORGES 1ER LES PRULIERS - DOM TAUPENOT MERME 2013
tastingDescription: 89-91 Points, Wine Advocate: "...a comparatively conservative bouquet at the moment: a mixture of red and black fruit with just a hint of orange blossom that develops in the glass. The palate is medium-bodied with fine tannin and well-judged acidity. Drink: 2016 - 2026." (January 2015)

name: NUITS ST GEORGES 1ER LES ST GEORGES THIBAULT LIGER BELAIR 14
nameSanitized: nuits st georges 1er les st georges thibault liger belair 14
nameSuffix: NUITS ST GEORGES 1ER LES ST GEORGES THIBAULT LIGER BELAIR 14
sort: NUITS ST GEORGES 1ER LES ST GEORGES THIBAULT LIGER BELAIR 14
tastingDescription: 90-92 Points, Wine Advocate: "The 2014 Nuits St Georges 1er Cru les St Georges has a well defined bouquet, reserved at first but unfurling with wild strawberry and redcurrant fruit infused with minerals. The palate is medium-bodied and strict, and there is a touch of spice here. Drink: 2018 - 2032." (December 2015)

name: NUITS ST GEORGES LES ARGILLATS - PHILIPPE GAVIGNE 2019
nameSanitized: nuits st georges les argillats - philippe gavigne 2019
sort: NUITS ST GEORGES LES ARGILLATS - PHILIPPE GAVIGNE 2019
tastingDescription: 87-89 Points, Wine Advocate: "... The palate is vibrant and fresh, a little chewy in the mouth at the moment, with good weight if not quite the requisite tension on the finish. Still, this is a well-made Nuits Saint Georges to drink over the next 5 or 6 years. Drink: 2013 - 2019." (December 2013)

name: OKANAGAN CELLARS - 35 FORTIFIED WINE
tastingDescription: Distinctively rich and nutty, this Apera is perfect for pairing with strong cheeses or as a dessert.

name: OKANAGAN CRUSH PAD - NARRATIVE ROSE VEGAN 2019

name: OKUNOMATSU - ADATARA GINJO
tastingDescription: Champion Saké, 2018 International Wine Challenge London: "This Saké is fresh with pretty floral notes of honeysuckle, jasmine, peach, distinctive ripe pear and melony fruits. On the palate it is clean and balanced with a silky mouthfeel."

name: OPEN - CABERNET MERLOT
tastingDescription: The perfect blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon to discover their sumptuous red berry fruit aromas and complex, long flavourful finish. Enjoy on its own or as a complement to grilled burgers, sausages or aged hard cheeses. Great value for a VQA red.

name: OPEN - CHARDONNAY 2019
tastingDescription: A luscious Chardonnay with aromas and flavours of green apples, white peaches, citrus and melon. Perfect for everyday menus and occasions. Great value for a VQA white

name: OPEN - SMOOTH RED
tastingDescription: Medium ruby; bright aromas of crushed red berry fruit, plum and wood spice; the palate shows some sweetness and a medium body, powered by juicier red fruit, hints of spice and vanilla and soft tannins.

name: OPEN - SMOOTH WHITE
tastingDescription: Pale lemon; aromas of apple, pear and citrus; the palate is off-dry and medium body with flavours of ripe stone fruit, lemon, apple and a touch of honey on a soft finish.

name: ORVIETO CLASSICO - RUFFINO
tastingDescription: Try pairing this light white wine with chilled seafood at the beginning of the meal. The grapes are sourced from chalky/ limestone soils in Umbria.

name: OSOYOOS LAROSE - LE GRAND VIN 2015
tastingDescription: The nose is rich and complex with toasty caramel and espresso aromas, opulent blackcurrant notes, spices and eucalyptus. The Cabernet Sauvignon typicity is more present than in older vintages (33% of the blend). Ripe velvety tannins enrobe a silky texture. The acidity and tannin structure promise a very long life ahead.

name: OSOYOOS LAROSE - LE GRAND VIN 2016
tastingDescription: This well-structured Bordeaux blend from BC has lots of earthy dark fruit, leather, spice and tobacco in a party-sized bottle

name: OSOYOOS LAROSE - LE GRAND VIN 2017
tastingDescription: Le Grand Vin 2017 is a very smooth version of Osoyoos Larose. This wine has a great balance between the ripe fruit, the volume in the mouth and the smooth tannins.

name: OSOYOOS LAROSE - LE GRAND VIN 2017
tastingDescription: One of the icons in the Okanagan, Osoyoos Larose’s Le Grand Vin is a Bordeaux-inspired red blend made to be cellared for eight to ten years. Expect a rich, bold and intense wine with structured tannins and firm acidity supporting flavours of blackcurrant, black cherry, dark chocolate and savoury spice.

name: OSOYOOS LAROSE - PETALES D'OSOYOOS 2018
tastingDescription: Pétales 2016 is a very fruity Bordeaux blend, with cherry note on the nose, a touch of leather and lightly toasted. The mouth is gourmet with its red fruit note and well balanced with smooth tannins. The after taste stays on cherry, and the smoke note gives a good finish

name: OYSTER BAY - SPARKLING CUVEE BRUT
tastingDescription: Elegant cool climate varietal intensity – radiant lime, citrus and white peach, accentuated by a finely bubbled palate with a crisp, refreshing finish.

name: PAGODA 8 YEAR OLD
tastingDescription: From the highest grade of the “Pagoda” Brand, Shaoxing Rice Wine has been selected as the drinking rice wine especially for the State Banquet by Zhong Nan Hai and the Great Hall since 1993.

name: PAINTED ROCK - MERLOT 2018
tastingDescription: The 2014 Merlot opens with aromas of warm black cherries, black plums and mulberries with hints of chargrill, savoury herbs, earth and graphite. Medium- to full-bodied with firm tannins and fresh acidity, this wine is loaded with structure and aging potential. Pair with flat iron steak and garlic herb butter.

name: PAINTED ROCK - RED ICON 2018
tastingDescription: This has an inviting nose of crushed blackberries, warm black plums, cassis, violets, black pepper and vanilla with hints of dark chocolate, baking spices and smoke. Medium- to full-bodied with firm, velvety tannins, fleshy texture and excellent length, this wine is approachable now but it should evolve gracefully over the next decade.

name: PAINTED ROCK - SYRAH ESTATE GROWN 2019
tastingDescription: This has a compelling nose of warm blackberries, cherries and plums with touches of black pepper, smoked meat and licorice. Rich and rounded on the palate, it offers generous black fruit flavours framed by velvety tannins and balanced acidity, finishing with lingering cigar box notes. Try with barbeque beef, lamb or venison.

name: PANDICULATION RED BLEND - RASCALLION 2016
tastingDescription: A beautiful bouquet of sweet ripe blackberries, infused with a hint of rich plums, combined with delicate oak notes with subtle lavender spicy aromas, creates a wine with a complex, intriguing nose.  Bright garnet red in colour, this full-bodied wine has an elegant juicy creamy entry with soft round tannins and a long lingering finish.

name: PARADISE RANCH - MERLOT ICEWINE 2019
tastingDescription: False

name: PARADISE RANCH - MERLOT LATE HARVEST 2018
tastingDescription: False

name: PASA ROBLES RED - L'AVENTURE ESTATE CUVEE 2018
nameSanitized: pasa robles red - laventure estate cuvee 2018
sort: PASA ROBLES RED - L'AVENTURE ESTATE CUVEE 2018
tastingDescription:
...It offers a huge nose of creme de cassis, white flowers, crushed stone, graphite, and crushed flowers. This carries to a fullbodied, gorgeously textured red with incredible balance, no hard edges, a thrilling mid-palate, and a great, great finish. Hats off to winemaker Stephan Asseo on another incredible wine, as well as, I suspect the wine of the vintage.
100 pts, Jeb Dunnick

name: PASO ROBLES RED - TABLAS CREEK ESPRIT DE TABLAS 2018
nameSanitized: paso robles red - tablas creek esprit de tablas 2018
sort: PASO ROBLES RED - TABLAS CREEK ESPRIT DE TABLAS 2018
tastingDescription:
Available on May 29.
94 Points Wine Enthusiast: "This blend of 40% Mourvèdre, 27% Syrah, 23% Grenache and 10% Counoise is elegantly floral on the nose with lavender and violet as well as ripe plum and sumac aromas. It's tightly wound and energetic on the palate, where lavender and purple-fruit flavors come together with white-pepper, dewy herbs and wet stone elements." (Jan 2021)

name: PASO ROBLES RED - TABLAS CREEK PATELIN DE TABLAS 2018
nameSanitized: paso robles red - tablas creek patelin de tablas 2018
sort: PASO ROBLES RED - TABLAS CREEK PATELIN DE TABLAS 2018
tastingDescription:
Available on May 29.
Traditional Paso Robles turf is well known for its Cabernet Sauvignon but to the west into the hills is where some exciting new wines are being made. "Dark ruby-red. Expansive red and dark berry aromas are complemented by building spice and floral notes. Sappy and seamless in texture, offering juicy raspberry, cherry preserve and spice-cake flavors braced by a spine of juicy acidity. Supple, well-knit tannins build steadily on the long, lively finish, which leaves behind lavender pastille and juicy cherry notes." 92 points, Vinous.

name: PASO ROBLES WHITE - TABLAS CREEK PATELIN DE TABLAS 2019
nameSanitized: paso robles white - tablas creek patelin de tablas 2019
sort: PASO ROBLES WHITE - TABLAS CREEK PATELIN DE TABLAS 2019
tastingDescription:
Available on May 29.
93 Points, Wine Spectator: "Aromatic and complex, with a refreshing thread of acidity weaving in and out among orange blossom, almond cake and Fuji apple notes. Lemon zest and ruby grapefruit details linger on the long, expressive finish." (January 2021)

name: PASSERINA COLLINE TEATINE - IL FEUDUCCIO STA MARIA D'ORAI 18
nameSanitized: passerina colline teatine - il feuduccio sta maria dorai 18
sort: PASSERINA COLLINE TEATINE - IL FEUDUCCIO STA MARIA D'ORAI 18
tastingDescription: Pale bright straw colour with notes of apple, pear, and citrus on the nose. Lively finish with flavours that are crisp and bright.

name: PASSIMENTO ROSSO VENETO IGT - ROMEO & JULIET
nameSanitized: passimento rosso veneto igt - romeo & juliet
sort: PASSIMENTO ROSSO VENETO IGT - ROMEO & JULIET
tastingDescription: Intense aromas of cherry, prune, cedar and hints of sweet tobacco. The palate is well balanced with velvety tannins and a soft and round finish. Try with Linguine Alla Carbonara.

name: PATRIMONIO - YVES LECCIA E CROCE 2017
tastingDescription: Organic. Crafted on the French island of Corsica, Leccia's Patrimonio displays beautiful aromas of red fruit, with notes of liquorice and a bitter chocolate edge that gives a sharp character. The palate is delicious, well structured, full of red fruit and some spices. A wine to enjoy now.

name: PAUILLAC - CARRUADES DE LAFITE 2017
tastingDescription:
"Just as it was from barrel, the 2017 Carruades de Lafite is ample and rich on the palate. Succulent dark cherry, lavender, spice and plum all fill out the wine's frame effortlessly. In 2017, Carruades is especially resonant and creamy, with notable richness and volume. Drink: 2022 - 2032."
92 Points, Vinous
2 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CARRUADES DE LAFITE 2018
tastingDescription:
"Exquisitely fine tannins to the currant, lead-pencil and chocolate character. The palate is full, yet very refined and linear with a long, lingering finish. Such polish and tension. The tannins are intense, yet so fine, giving almost a powdery texture. So Lafite-like. Best Carruades ever? 56% cabernet sauvignon and 38% merlot, the rest cabernet franc. Drink after 2026."
97 pts, James Suckling
6 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU CLERC MILON 2018
tastingDescription:
"This is an extremely successful Clerc Milon in a run of great vintages at the property. Lovely purity, clear big tannins, and real poise and tension. Persistent, succulent, full of cassis, liquorice and crushed mint. Seriously impressive and will go the distance. Blend completed by 3% Petit Verdot and 1% Carmenère."
96 pts, Decanter
12 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU D'ARMAILHAC 2018
tastingDescription:
"Deep garnet-purple colored, the 2018 D'Armailhac (a blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot) hits the ground running with wonderfully open-knit, flamboyant scents of Morello cherries, black raspberries, blackcurrant jelly and rose oil, leading to an undercurrent of cinnamon toast, aniseed and mossy tree bark. The medium to full-bodied palate is charged with energy and expressiveness, delivering red and black berry layers with loads of spicy sparks, framed by plush tannins, finishing long and fragrant. Drink Date: 2022 - 2039."
93+ pts, Wine Advocate
12 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU DUHART MILON 2017
tastingDescription: 95 Points, James Suckling: "This is classical in style with lead pencil and sweet tobacco to the currant and plum undertones. Warm and cool at the same time. Full-bodied, tight and reserved with very polished, creamy tannins. It goes on and on. Compact, creamy texture. Try after 2023"

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU DUHART MILON 2017
tastingDescription:
"This is classical in style with lead pencil and sweet tobacco to the currant and plum undertones. Warm and cool at the same time. Full-bodied, tight and reserved with very polished, creamy tannins. It goes on and on. Compact, creamy texture. Try after 2023."
95 Points, James Suckling
6 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU DUHART MILON 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Duhart-Milon is composed of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon and 35% Merlot. With 14% alcohol, it has a deep garnet-purple color and a seductively ripe, opulent nose of plum preserves, blackberry pie and chocolate-covered cherries with hints of spice cake, potpourri, sandalwood and eucalyptus oil. Medium-bodied, it is jam-packed with rich, spicy black fruit preserves, with floral accents and a velvety texture, finishing long and fragrant. So. Good. Drink Date: 2023 - 2040."
94+ pts, Wine Advocate
12 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU GRAND PUY DUCASSE 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Grand Puy Ducasse is just as impressive as it was en primeur. Readers will find a heady, richly textured Pauillac loaded with character. The result is a wine that delivers on all levels. Succulent dark cherry, plum, mint, licorice, sweet spice and a touch of new oak build into a striking crescendo on the lush, persistent finish. Drinking Window: 2028 - 2043."
94 pts, Vinous
12 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU GRAND PUY LACOSTE 2017
tastingDescription:
"These guys often over-deliver in challenging years, and have done so yet again. As you would expect in a vintage that has produced such an excellent Lacoste Borie, this GPL is exceptional, a real success that's juicy and carefully extracted. It has weight and impact, with a Pauillac tannic hold and presence. It's one of my wines of the vintage, and a must buy. The balanced, sculpted, juicy black fruits fully deliver personality and signature style. Drink: 2025 - 2038."
94 Points, Decanter
6 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU GRAND PUY LACOSTE 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Grand-Puy-Lacoste is fabulous. Strong Cabernet inflections soar out of the glass, giving the wine a compelling aromatic profile laced with the essence of graphite, dried herbs, menthol and dark fruit. One of the most classic (for lack of a better word) wines in the Left Bank in 2018, Grand-Puy-Lacoste is super-impressive right out of the gate. Grand-Puy-Lacoste is ultimately a wine of tremendous class that remains restrained and aristocratic in breeding. Drinking Window: 2028 - 2048."
96 pts, Vinous
12 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU GRAND-PUY DUCASSE 2017
tastingDescription:
"The tannins show well in this ripe wine. While it also has lots of fresh black-fruit flavors, it's the structure that shines now, indicating good aging potential. Drink from 2024."
94 Points, Wine Enthusiast

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU HAUT BATAILLEY 2018
tastingDescription:
"Juicy, fresh and nicely compact, with sleek iron along the edges of a core of steeped plum and cassis fruit flavors. Subtle tugs of savory, tobacco and cedar through the finish, with a last, lingering perfumed whiff of dark tea. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2024 through 2038."
94 pts, Wine Spectator
12 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU HAUT-BATAILLEY 2017
tastingDescription:
"The 2017 Haut-Batailley is powerful, dark and racy. Dark cherry, gravel, smoke, menthol, licorice and spice all pulse with notable energy and tons of Cabernet Sauvignon savoriness. For such a big wine, Haut-Batailley has quite a bit of nuance, but it is the sense of vibrancy here that is compelling. Drink: 2022 - 2042."
94 Points, Vinous
6 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHCHILD 2005
tastingDescription: This first-growth Bordeaux from an outstanding vintage is loaded with blackberry, red plum, cedar, mineral, dark chocolate, tobacco and licorice. Layers of velvety tannins confirm the beautiful balance of this dense yet elegant wine. It is ready to drink now, or to be added to your collection

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 1985
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Advocate: "… The acidity here is perfectly judged with an almost nonchalant finish. You almost miss its virtues - it is just so self-effacing and insouciant. Just a really lovely Lafite-Rothschild at the peak of its powers. Drink: 2016 - 2030." (July 2016)

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 1988
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Spectator: "Beautiful and subtle on the nose, with mineral, berry, licorice and dark chocolate. Full-bodied, with supersilky tannins and a pretty balance of fruit and mint. Long and caressing. Real claret here. Everyone talks about 1989, but this is very close in quality. Drink now." (2009)

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 1999
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Wine Advocate: "… This prodigious wine is both elegant and intensely flavored, and almost diaphanous in its layers that unfold with no heaviness. …with extravagant layers of richness yet little weight, and a finish that is all sweetness, ripeness, and harmony. Drink: 2007 - 2030." (April 2002)

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 2001
tastingDescription: 96 Points, Wine Advocate: "The 2001 Lafite Rothschild has a quintessential bouquet for Lafite: very pure, almost understated at first. It then begins to open with briary, blackberry leaf, cedar and freshly rolled tobacco with subtle floral notes emerging after three of four minutes in the glass…" (March 2012)

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 2003
tastingDescription: 100 Points, Wine Advocate: "Fat, rich, opulent and full-bodied with low acidity and stunning seductiveness and complexity, this noble wine possesses a bountiful, generous, heady style. This is one of the candidates for the wine of the vintage. Drink: 2014 - 2039." (August 2014)

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 2008
tastingDescription: 98 Points, Wine Advocate: "A candidate for the -wine of the vintage,- the 2008 should have been purchased before it began to soar in value…it is already showing remarkable complexity and breed, and will last for 30-35 years...at the minimum. Drink: 2017 - 2052." (May 2011)

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 2009
tastingDescription: 99+ Points, Wine Advocate: "Among the most powerful Lafites ever made... A tight, but potentially gorgeous nose of graphite, black currants, licorice and camphor is followed by a full-bodied wine revealing the classic elegance, purity and delineated style of Lafite. Drink: 2022 - 2072." (December 2011)

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 2010
tastingDescription: 100 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "Almost black in color, this stunning wine is gorgeous, rich and dense. It's grand and powerful, with a strong sense of its own importance. The beautiful tannins and the fragrant black currant fruits are palpable. It's a great wine, with huge potential." (May 2013)

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 2010
tastingDescription: 100 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "Almost black in color, this stunning wine is gorgeous, rich and dense. It's grand and powerful, with a strong sense of its own importance. The beautiful tannins and the fragrant black currant fruits are palpable. It's a great wine, with huge potential." (May 2013)

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 2015
tastingDescription: 100 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "This is a great vintage from Lafite. The profile is rich in feel, with a seriously firm tannic structure. Solid, complex and with great authority, this Cabernet Sauvignon-dominant wine is impressively dense in dark-fruit tones. It will age for many years..." (April 2018)

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 2017
tastingDescription:
"Composed of 97% Cabernet Sauvignon, 2.5% Merlot and 0.5% Petit Verdot, the 2017 Lafite Rothschild is deep garnet-purple colored. It opens slowly, cautiously with restrained notes of chocolate-covered cherries, mulberries, warm blackcurrants and wild blueberries, followed by emerging notions of smoked meats, fragrant earth, crushed rocks and lilacs with touches of cast-iron pan and Marmite toast. Medium-bodied, the palate is deceptively light and quite ethereal on entry, growing in the mouth to reveal elegant layers of energetic red and black fruits with tons of savory accents. Framed by exquisitely ripe, wonderfully fine-grained tannins, it has exhilarating freshness and a very long, hypnotically perfumed finish. A total head-turner, I cannot wait to follow the development of this wine! Drink: 2024 - 2057."
97+ Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 2017
tastingDescription:
"Composed of 97% Cabernet Sauvignon, 2.5% Merlot and 0.5% Petit Verdot, the 2017 Lafite Rothschild is deep garnet-purple colored. It opens slowly, cautiously with restrained notes of chocolate-covered cherries, mulberries, warm blackcurrants and wild blueberries, followed by emerging notions of smoked meats, fragrant earth, crushed rocks and lilacs with touches of cast-iron pan and Marmite toast. Medium-bodied, the palate is deceptively light and quite ethereal on entry, growing in the mouth to reveal elegant layers of energetic red and black fruits with tons of savory accents. Framed by exquisitely ripe, wonderfully fine-grained tannins, it has exhilarating freshness and a very long, hypnotically perfumed finish. A total head-turner, I cannot wait to follow the development of this wine! Drink: 2024 - 2057."
97+ Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: PAUILLAC - CHATEAU LAFITE ROTHSCHILD 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Lafite Rothschild is blended of 91% Cabernet Sauvignon, 8.5% Merlot and 0.5% Petit Verdot. It needs a fair bit of swirling to unlock intoxicating scents of blackcurrant cordial, baked plums and black cherry compote with an undercurrent of dark chocolate, licorice, cast-iron pan, cedar chest and fertile loam, plus a waft of pencil lead. The delicately crafted, medium-bodied palate is dripping with class, featuring layers of mineral-laced black fruits and exquisitely ripe, singularly Lafite tannins, finishing with epic length and depth. This simply stunning, delicately crafted expression of 2018 with its singularly evocative imprint of Lafite will require a good 7-8 years in bottle, then should continue to inspire awe over the following 40+ years. Drink Date: 2028 - 2068."
100 pts, Wine Advocate
6 bottle limit
