Available on May 29.
"In 2017, Todos is beautifully perfumed and silky, with lovely red fruit character that comes through nicely. Floral accents add brightness."
93 points, Vinous

name: SANTENAY - DOMAINE MICHELLE PHILIPON 2018
tastingDescription: Made by a tiny, family-owned, exceptionally high-quality producer, this Pinot Noir from the Santenay appellation in the Côte de Beaune is a great value from the fantastic 2015 vintage.

name: SANTERO - ASTI
tastingDescription: This sweeter frizzante in a stunning bottle is balanced by racy acidity with floral, citrus, honey and tree fruits that play happily with a bright limey streak

name: SAPERAVI - GODORI
tastingDescription: The wine is created from Saperavi grape grown in Kakheti Viticulture District of Georgia and appears as a glorious introduction to Saperavi varietal – one of the oldest but still unbeknown grape which has being cultivated for ages exclusively in Georgia. GODORI brand represents a young rejuvenescent version of Saperavi that reveals all of the best qualities of its region. If you love California blends or Malbecs, you should give this wine a try. Dark garnet red, crystal clear. Gentle bouquet with distinct aromas of forest berries, cherry currant. Saperavi has unique extractive, harmonious and pleasant taste with hints of wild berries blended with sour cherry and black currant.

name: SARDEGNA VALLI DI PORTO PINO - SANTADI SHARDANA 2013
nameSanitized: sardegna valli di porto pino - santadi shardana 2013
sort: SARDEGNA VALLI DI PORTO PINO - SANTADI SHARDANA 2013
tastingDescription: “A high percentage of old vines (some over 100-years-old) go into making this Sardinian blend from Carignano and Shiraz grapes. Its ripe black fruit is balanced by exotic herb and scrub brush notes.” - Barbara Philip MW, Category Manager for Wines of Europe, Sparkling & Fortified

name: SASSELLA VALTELLINA SUPERIORE - ALFIO MOZZI
tastingDescription: False

name: SAUMUR LES EPINATS - CAVE DE SAUMUR 2018
nameSanitized: saumur les epinats - cave de saumur 2018
sort: SAUMUR LES EPINATS - CAVE DE SAUMUR 2018
tastingDescription: 89 Points, Gismondionwine: "This dependable Loire cabernet franc often overdelivers for the price, and the 2018 vintage is not an exception. The juicy black fruits have a wild, savoury edge, with a stemmy, spicy component. It's first and foremost, a vin du soif, but the depth here is still above the norm. (March 2021)

name: SAUTERNES & BARSAC - CHATEAU ARMAJAN DES ORMES 2016
nameSanitized: sauternes & barsac - chateau armajan des ormes 2016
sort: SAUTERNES & BARSAC - CHATEAU ARMAJAN DES ORMES 2016
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Anthony Gismondy - "The 65/30/5 semillon/sauvignon blanc/muscadelle blend results from five successive passes through the vineyard, searching for prized botrytised bunches. The wine is barrel aged for 24 months, adding extra complexity to a lush dessert wine. Look for candied citrus and peach flecked with honey and butterscotch. Undervalued and underrated, this is a terrific introduction to Sauternes at a modest price." (November, 2020).

name: SAUTERNES & BARSAC - CHATEAU CLIMENS 2009
tastingDescription: 97 Points, Wine Advocate: “...just fantastic, so energetic and tensile with layers of minerally, honeyed fruit laced with spice, sea salt, a touch of licorice and quince. It will be a multi-dimensional Climens that has a very long future ahead, a killer Sauternes... Drink: 2025 - 2060.” (June 2016)

name: SAUTERNES & BARSAC - CHATEAU D'YQUEM 2005
tastingDescription: 97 Points, Wine Spectator: “This has a deliciously pure feel, with juicy, inviting green plum, ginger, heather, creamed pineapple and Jonagold apple flavors all melded together and gliding through the lengthy finish, which echoes with lilting flowers and dried citrus notes. Best from 2015 through 2045.” (2012)

name: SAUTERNES & BARSAC - CHATEAU D'YQUEM 2007
tastingDescription: 98 Points, Wine Advocate: “...the Yquem 2007 shines like a diamond. ... There is such race and nervosity, and then that finish just purrs with harmony and focus. This Yquem feels just so alive and vivacious, yet there is an effortless quality here that is unmatched by its peers.” (December 2011)

name: SAUTERNES & BARSAC - CHATEAU D'YQUEM 2007
tastingDescription: 98 Points, Wine Advocate: “...the Yquem 2007 shines like a diamond. ... There is such race and nervosity, and then that finish just purrs with harmony and focus. This Yquem feels just so alive and vivacious, yet there is an effortless quality here that is unmatched by its peers.” (December 2011)

name: SAUTERNES & BARSAC - CHATEAU D'YQUEM 2009
tastingDescription: 100 Points, Wine Advocate: “... You are immediately knocked sideways by the palpable weight and volume in the mouth, which is almost “bulbous,” with layer upon layer of heavily botrytized fruit. ... The 2009 is utterly fabulous and decadent, a star that will blaze brightly and undimmed for many years. Drink: 2014 - 2060.” (June 2014)

name: SAUTERNES & BARSAC - CHATEAU D'YQUEM 2010
tastingDescription: 96 Points, Wine Spectator: “Rather restrained now, showing terrific purity and precision, with dried pineapple, persimmon and mango notes, offset by racy honeysuckle, white peach and chamomile hints. The extremely long finish sails on, switching to yet another spectrum, with green almond, green plum and coconut accents... Best from 2020 through 2050.” (May 2014)

name: SAUTERNES & BARSAC - CHATEAU DE FARGUES 2013
tastingDescription: 97 Points, Wine Spectator: “An intense, honeyed style, with lots of mango, glazed peach, tarte Tatin and maple notes flowing together, backed by toasted coconut and warm almond details through the finish. This is deep and ridiculously rich, yet strides through authoritatively. A magnificent wine. Best from 2025 through 2050.” (March 2017)

name: SAUTERNES & BARSAC - CHATEAU RIEUSSEC 2014
tastingDescription: 95-97 Points, Wine Advocate: “...beautifully balanced with nigh on perfect acidity that makes this seem just so…effortless. ...this is classic Rieussec that might...and I stress might...just give that Sauternes beginning with the 25th letter of the alphabet, a run for its money. Drink: 2018 - 2045.” (April 2015)

name: SAUTERNES - CHATEAU DOISY VEDRINES 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Doisy-Vedrines is understated and wonderfully nuanced, just as it was from barrel. Lemon confit, apricot, passionfruit and bright floral accents lend brightness to this elegant and poised Barsac. Doisy-Vedrines is a subtle wine, and yet there is so much to it. Drinking Window: 2026 - 2048."
93 pts, Vinous

name: SAUTERNES - CHATEAU LAFAURIE PEYRAGUEY 2016
tastingDescription:
“The breathtaking nose of this Sauternes is like an essence of fresh pineapples with hints of lemon balm and floral honey. Then comes the most extraordinary marriage of creaminess and freshness that gives the palate a fluffy texture. Vibrant acidity makes this taste almost weightless at the very long, brilliant finish. Drink or hold.”
98 Points, James Suckling

name: SAUTERNES - CHATEAU RAYNE VIGNEAU 2017
tastingDescription:
"Lush and creamy, with papaya, coconut, ginger cream and glazed peach flavors that are well-defined, laced with a singed hazelnut note through the finish. In line with the vintage's tropical side, but this shows freshness as well. Semillon and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now through 2038."
93 Points, Wine Spectator

name: SAUTERNES - CHATEAU RIEUSSEC 2017
tastingDescription: False

name: SAUTERNES - CHATEAU RIEUSSEC 2017
tastingDescription:
"A blend of 83% Semillon and 17% Sauvignon Blanc, the 2017 Rieussec is pale to medium lemon-gold colored. To begin, the nose blows you away with intense lemon tart, lime cordial, mango and quince notes followed by a second wave of floral, orange blossoms and honeysuckle scents, and then notes of crushed rocks, creme caramel and marzipan join the party. Medium to full-bodied, the palate is still very tightly wound with concentrated sweetness and a racy backbone to match, delivering layer upon layer of citrus and savory flavors, finishing on a persistent mineral note. Drink: 2023 - 2057."
97 Points, Wine Advocate

name: SAUTERNES - CHATEAU SUDUIRAUT 2017
tastingDescription:
"Yum. Aromas of orange blossom, lemon curd, dried apricot and cooked pears fill the glass. It's full-bodied and very sweet, yet tangy and lively from the vibrant acidity. Extremely long on the finish. Better in 2025, but already a joy to taste."
97 Points, James Suckling

name: SAUTERNES - CHATEAU SUDUIRAUT 2017
tastingDescription:
"Yum. Aromas of orange blossom, lemon curd, dried apricot and cooked pears fill the glass. It's full-bodied and very sweet, yet tangy and lively from the vibrant acidity. Extremely long on the finish. Better in 2025, but already a joy to taste."
97 Points, James Suckling

name: SAUTERNES - CHATEAU SUDUIRAUT 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Suduiraut is intense on the nose, featuring well-defined pure wild honey mixed with white flowers, quince and quite a strong petrol-like/Germanic note. The palate is very well balanced with a harmonious entry, well-judged acidity and great tension thanks to a bitter orange peel note that counterbalances the rich, honeyed fruit on the finish. Superb. Drinking Window: 2024 - 2050."
95 pts, Vinous
12 bottle limit

name: SAUTERNES - CLOS HAUT PEYRAGUEY 2017
tastingDescription:
"The 2017 Clos Haut-Peyraguey is fabulously rich and dense, not to mention every bit as impressive as it was en primeur. Creamy, nuanced, powerful, sumptuous, the 2017 possesses tons of nuance and sheer depth. Lemon confit, baked pineapple, mint, honey, chamomile and apricot are some of the many aromas and flavors that develop in the glass. The balance of unctuousness and freshness is beguiling."
97 Points, Vinous
6 bottle limit

name: SAUTERNES AND BARSAC - CHATEAU D'YQUEM 2001
tastingDescription: 100 Points, Wine Advocate: “You may ask: what is the point? Another perfect score for the 2001 d'Yquem. Oh well, why not? This bottle, served blind, reinforced the sheer unadulterated brilliance of this legendary Sauternes now at 15 years old. Doesn't time fly. It seems to be aging at a glacial pace... Drink: 2030 - 2101.” (October)

name: SAUTERNES AND BARSAC - CHATEAU D'YQUEM 2006
tastingDescription: 96 Points, Wine Spectator: “Lovely flavors of apricot, dried tangerine, pineapple and papaya rush along, supported by hazelnut, frangipane and coconut notes. Despite the depth, this is very, very pure, with filigreed acidity carrying the long, long finish. Drink now through 2037.” (2012)

name: SAUTERNES AND BARSAC - CHATEAU LAFAURIE PEYRAGUEY 2001
nameSanitized: sauternes and barsac - chateau lafaurie peyraguey 2001
sort: SAUTERNES AND BARSAC - CHATEAU LAFAURIE PEYRAGUEY 2001
tastingDescription: 96 Points, James Suckling: “Wow. This has a seamless texture and wonderful depth of fruit with dried pineapple, pear and hints of honey. Full body, very sweet and dense. Superb. Sliced white truffles. Fantastic. Drink or hold.” (October 2012)

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC  - BURONGA HILL
tastingDescription: To get the best characters out of the Sauvignon Blanc varietal minimal input from the winemaker is necessary. The fruit was harvested in the cool of the night and then crushed so the juice could be clarified prior to fermentation. The fermentation occurred in stainless steel vats where a selected yeast strain was introduced to further enhance the varietal fruit flavours and aromas. Early bottling ensured the natural freshness of this was captured ready to be enjoyed.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - 8 RIOS CHILE 2019
tastingDescription: The 8 Rios Sauvignon Blanc is pleasant and aromatic, and was bottled early to conserve its fruity and floral aromas typical of the Central Valley. It is light, fresh, and balanced.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - ACHERON FOOTPRINT WESTERN CAPE
nameSanitized: sauvignon blanc - acheron footprint western cape

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - ASTROLABE PROVINCE MARLBOROUGH 2020
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Decanter: "Classic bouquet and palate with flavours of tropical fruits and apple, lemon pith and peach tea, fresh herbs of sage and basil. The core of fruit and minerality are accentuated by sweet acidity and its palate refreshing qualities. Well made, lengthy, harmonious and ready."

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - BABICH MARLBOROUGH 2021
tastingDescription: Crisp white with bouquet bursting with passion fruit, gooseberry and red currant, Babich is the kind of Sauvignon Blanc New Zealand is known for. The palate is rich, sweet-fruited and complex with layers of guava, passion fruit and gooseberry. The acidity and fruit are balanced, with an herbal, flinty character and a lingering perfume on the finish.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - BRANCOTT ESTATE MARLBOROUGH
tastingDescription: This wine is pale straw in colour with green highlights. It displays a warm aromatic reminiscent of ripe gooseberry overlaid with highlights of golden stone fruit and rockmelon. On the palate, the wine has sweet fruit flavors across the spectrum with an almost passionfruit pungency adding strength and length to the finish. This is a well-balanced wine showing palate weight, full fruit flavours and the fresh acidity associated with this style.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - CAKEBREAD CELLARS NAPA 2019
tastingDescription: Vibrant, wonderfully fresh aromas of pink grapefruit, melon and white peach introduce zesty flavors of Meyer lemon, lime, guava and juicy melon. Delicious now, this classic Napa Valley sauvignon blanc will age gracefully for the next 3-5 years, and beautifully accompany seafood, poultry, vegetable and salad dishes.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - CARMEN EMBARCADERO
tastingDescription: Pale yellow wine with soft greenish tints. The nose is fresh and expressive, highlighting the notes of tropical fruits and soft floral notes. The palate is long, crisp, fragrant and with a balanced acidity.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - CHILICIOUS
tastingDescription: Aromas of melon and pineapple with citrus notes of lime and grapefruit. Soft and fruity on the palate with medium body and well-balanced acidity.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - CHOCALAN RESERVA
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Wine Scores: "Outstanding value for price. Classic elements; expect racy lime, peach blossoms, gooseberry, star fruit, grass clippings and honey aromas with mineral undertones. It is racy and vibrant, click and concentrated. A mouthwatering Savvy with a taut pithy finish." (March 2021)

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - CLOUDY BAY MARLBOROUGH 2020
tastingDescription: 92 points, James Suckling - "A fresh, creamy-textured white with lots of freshness and lovely pear and green-apple character. Some white pineapple. It's medium-bodied with crisp acidity and a flavorful finish. Less herbs and more clean, ripe fruit. " (September, 2020).

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - CONO SUR ORGANIC

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - CONO SUR RESERVA ESPECIAL CASABLANCA

It’s a fresh and delicate wine with a very pleasant minerality and well-balanced palate.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - CRAGGY RANGE TE MUNA MARTINBOROUGH
nameSanitized: sauvignon blanc - craggy range te muna martinborough
sort: SAUVIGNON BLANC - CRAGGY RANGE TE MUNA MARTINBOROUGH
tastingDescription: 92 Points, James Suckling - "A very fresh, lithe and juicy feel to this Sauvignon with bright, juicy green passion fruit and green mangoes taking center stage, amid fresh, stony resolve. Drink now." (October 2019)

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - CUPCAKE
tastingDescription: Refreshing yet balanced, this Sauvignon Blanc is made with grapes from New Zealand's South Island. Dry and packed with flavours of lime, lemon and grapefruit with hints of passion fruit, this wine will certainly wake up your palate! It will pair beautifully with tapas or salads.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - DOG POINT MARLBOROUGH 2019
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Bob Campbell MW - "Intense, precise sauvignon blanc with grapefruit, citrus, subtle passionfruit and a suggestion of struck flint character. A powerful wine that's long and linear, with strong varietal definition that's made more interesting with a hint of reductive character." (October 2019)

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - DUCK HUNTER

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - DUCKHORN NAPA 2019
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Wine Spectator - "Elegant peach, melon and citrus flavors are juicy and plump, with a pretty floral vein and a sleek, crisp frame. A note of lemon verbena lingers. Drink now." (August 2018)

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - ESTRELLA DE PASCUA
tastingDescription: Attractive citrus and apple notes make this a refreshing Sauvignon Blanc to enjoy. In Chile whites like this go so well with their harvest from the sea. We are similar so try with ceviche dishes, shellfish, oysters or pasta and salad courses.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - GIESEN MARLBOROUGH RIDGE
tastingDescription: This wine is a classic Marlborough white showing fresh citrus aromas with hints of lemonwood and crushed nettle. The palete expresses supple fruit weight, dried herb and citris zest finishing long and balances.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - GREYWACKE MARLBOROUGH 2020
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Decanter: "Seductive bouquet of wild flowers and minerals, fresh aromas and flavours of citrus, peach tea and sweet hay. Crisp, refreshing, fruity and dry. Well made and long." Nov 2020

All these factors have resulted in the plethora of fruit flavours, crisp acidity, and complexity of this stunning wine. It pairs brilliantly with oysters.

tastingDescription: 90 points,  Wine Spectator - “Concentrated, intense and focused Key lime and lemon sherbet flavors are bright, smooth and very refreshing, with a touch of lemon verbena on the finish.”

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - LINDEMANS BIN 95

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - MANCURA ETNIA 2020

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - MATUA HAWKES BAY

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - MCGUIGAN BLACK LABEL

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - MIRAFLORA
tastingDescription: Aromas of melon and pineapple with citrus notes of lime and grapefruit. Soft and fruity on the palate with medium body and well-balanced acidity.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - MONKEY BAY
tastingDescription: With lifted aromas of gooseberry, bell pepper, and fresh-cut grass, this fresh and lively wine has excellent balance and a vibrant presence of the palate. Try matching it with chicken and seafood dishes.

The wine is vibrant on the palate with an impeccable level of natural acidity that gives the wine a long finish with a fresh, vivacious sensation.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - MUD HOUSE MARLBOROUGH

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - NOBILO MARLBOROUGH

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - STARBOROUGH MARLBOROUGH
tastingDescription: This fresh white has aromas of citrus and tropical fruit with hints of fresh herb. Flavours of passion fruit, guava and kiwi layered over a citrus framework culminate in a crisp, fresh palate. Try it with spicy chicken or aged gouda.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - STONELEIGH MARLBOROUGH

Displaying ripe gooseberry flavours on the pallet backed by tropical fruit and a hint of grassiness that lingers, this is an ideal sipping wine, but also excellent served with fish, pasta and poultry dishes.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - VILLA MARIA PRIVATE BIN MARLBOROUGH

It's medium to full-bodied and plump, with a creamy, lush mouthfeel that's frankly luscious, and tropical fruit that lingers elegantly on the finish." (February 2019)

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - VILLA MARIA SOUTHERN CLAYS MARLBOROUGH 18

It's mouth-filling and ripe, with a long, subtle finish." (February 28, 2018)

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - WAIRAU RIVER MARLBOROUGH

The wine offers outstanding fruit purity and power, finishing persistent and delicious." July, 2020

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC - WHITEHAVEN MARLBOROUGH
tastingDescription: The full flavour profile in this medium-bodied wine has gooseberry, grapefruit and hints of stone fruit intertwined with herbal/grassy notes and a backbone of mineral-laced acidity.

Great on its own or with salads, seafood or chicken dishes. Exclusive to BC Liquor Stores.

name: SAUVIGNON BLANC-  STONELEIGH LIGHTER

name: SAVENNIERES - CHATEAU DE VARENNES 2018

Full-bodied and elegant with finesse, freshness, and exceptionally high aromatic persistence.

name: SAVENNIERES COULEE DE SERRANT - NICOLAS JOLY 2018

sort: SAVENNIERES COULEE DE SERRANT - NICOLAS JOLY 2018

The tension is still there, so give this a few years to unravel.'' (November 2020)

tastingDescription: An Italian Sparkling Wine in a can, this Lambrusco is vibrant, fresh with a kiss of sweetness and a wonderful tart finish. Dark ruby red with small shimmering bubbles, aromas of red current and strawberry, flavors of plum, raspberry and Pomegranate.

name: SCHLOSS LADERHEIM
tastingDescription: Fruity and floral on the nose, with fresh peach and melon aroma. Sweetness is balanced with a tart apple finish.

name: SCHLOSS LADERHEIM
tastingDescription: Fruity and floral on the nose, with fresh peach and melon aroma. Sweetness is balanced with a tart apple finish.

name: SCREW IT! - THE RED
tastingDescription: Openly fruity, lush and layered, Screw it! The Red is a tantalizing combination of ripe fruits and velvety textures. Full-bodied and supple, this wine is made in a rich style that ends in a long, juicy red fruit finish. An inviting treat!

name: SCREW IT! - THE RED
tastingDescription: Openly fruity, lush and layered, Screw it! The Red is a tantalizing combination of ripe fruits and velvety textures. Full-bodied and supple, this wine is made in a rich style that ends in a long, juicy red fruit finish. An inviting treat!

name: SCREW IT! - THE WHITE
tastingDescription: Distinctly fruity, lavish and luxurious, Screw it! The White is an alluring combination of bright fruits and satiny textures. Structured and refreshing, this wine is made in a bright style that ends in a long and juicy baked-fruit finish. An extra-special treat for everyday drinking.

name: SCREW IT! - THE WHITE
tastingDescription: Distinctly fruit, lavish and luxurious, this white is an alluring combination of bright fruits and satiny textures. Structured and refreshing, this wine is made in a bright style that ends in a long and juicy baked-fruit finish. An extra-special treat for everyday drinking.

name: SEA CHANGE - PROSECCO ROSE
tastingDescription: Delicate and soft with strawberry notes and floral hints. Dry and perfectly balanced with a light body, refreshing acidity and a delicious lingering finish.

name: SEE YA LATER RANCH - CHARDONNAY 2019
tastingDescription: A long history: Starting with early farming by Major Hugh Fraser in the 1920s that evolved to grape growing. Then it became Lecomte winery with new owner Albert Lecomte. Purchased by Harry McWatters in 1995 it became Hawthorne Mountain Vineyards. One more ownership shift and See Ya Later became the name. A richer style of Chardonnay that has peach and pineapple, butter and vanilla flavours. Along with a freshness courtesy of the 'mountain' vineyard location at Okanagan Falls as one of the highest elevation vineyards in the Okanagan Valley.

name: SEE YA LATER RANCH - GEWURZTRAMINER 2019
tastingDescription: Much of the sourcing comes from the See Ya Later home vineyard. It is unique in the Okanagan as it faces north and is higher elevation then most of the rest of the valley. And the largest single planting of Gewurztraminer in North America. With this vintage we also have a bit of Ehrenfelser as part of the blend. Citrus and rose petal and spice notes are part of the picture with a mouth coating texture and length. Will go with tandoori chicken, spicy ribs or takeout Thai food.

name: SEE YA LATER RANCH - LUNA WHITE 2020
nameSanitized: see ya later ranch - luna white 2020
sort: SEE YA LATER RANCH - LUNA WHITE 2020
tastingDescription: Mouthwatering, refreshing and crisp. A white wine blend of some of the Okanagan's most iconic white varietals. Best served chilled with friends and fur friends. From tacos to poke bowls, this white pairs well with just about anything! It's sure to make you feel like an adult without all the responsibilities.

name: SEE YA LATER RANCH - PING MERITAGE 2018
nameSanitized: see ya later ranch - ping meritage 2018
sort: SEE YA LATER RANCH - PING MERITAGE 2018
tastingDescription: Always a red with distinction from See Ya Later, the Bordeaux blend conveys nobility and complexity plus Okanagan fruit. Try with meaty fare or slow cooker recipes or pasta dishes.

name: SEE YA LATER RANCH - PINOT GRIS 2019
nameSanitized: see ya later ranch - pinot gris 2019
sort: SEE YA LATER RANCH - PINOT GRIS 2019
tastingDescription: This bright white wine has a light salmon pink hue and a complex nose of vanilla, peach pit and spice. The same flavours are consistent on the palate and it has a round, smooth finish. The use of some new oak adds complexity and character.

name: SEE YA LATER RANCH - PINOT NOIR 2019
nameSanitized: see ya later ranch - pinot noir 2019
sort: SEE YA LATER RANCH - PINOT NOIR 2019
tastingDescription: The elegant silky red is all about Pinot Noir and of course the many ways it can enhance a meal. So look for berries, cherries and red fruits to savour on. Match to salmon steaks, slow cooked recipes like duck or pork loin.

name: SEE YA LATER RANCH - POPPY RED 2019
nameSanitized: see ya later ranch - poppy red 2019
sort: SEE YA LATER RANCH - POPPY RED 2019
tastingDescription: Bursting with fruity flavours and easy to love. This red blend showcases iconic flavours of the Okanagan. Best enjoyed with friends and fur friends, a grilled steak or a breakfast sandwich. A laid back, easy drinking red that's worth bringing out when you're hanging with your people.

name: SEE YA LATER RANCH - SPARKLING BRUT

sort: SEE YA LATER RANCH - SPARKLING BRUT
tastingDescription: This sparkling wine offers a delicate toast, melon and orchard fruit bouquet. It is lively, crisp and clean on the palate, with toasty oak notes leading to creamy orchard fruit and citrus flavours.

name: SEGURA VIUDAS - CAVA BRUT RESERVA
tastingDescription: The aromas are of citrus and tropical fruits with a light floral note. The palate is has good citrus acidity and hints of lime and pineapple with a persistent mousse.

name: SEGURA VIUDAS - CAVA BRUT ROSE
tastingDescription: A light and soft bubbly rosé, this Cava from Spain has fresh cranberry, strawberry and pear notes with a light, creamy mousse and a citrus finish.

name: SHIMIZU-NO-MAI - JUNMAI GINJO PURE DAWN
tastingDescription: Subtle notes of green apple and sweet rice. Full-bodied, well-balanced with a hint of banana and fruit flavors. Long, clean finish.

name: SHIRAZ  - BURONGA HILL
tastingDescription: Australian Shiraz has developed a name for itself on the international stage for producing high quality, distinctly varietal and bountiful wines. This wine is a perfect representation of that style. The fruit for this wine was sourced from our vineyards in South Australia, Victoria and New South Wales. The parcels of fruit were treated individually; fermented and matured, before being blended to create this outstanding wine.

name: SHIRAZ - ABALONE CAPE
tastingDescription: Abalone Cape, named after the South African abalone, is endemic to the shores of South Africa. This wine exudes fruity aromas dominated by blackcurrants and blueberries. It is a fresh and vibrant Shiraz, with notes of black fruits and spicy touches of pepper that bring a warm edge, followed by balanced acidity and gripping tannins.

name: SHIRAZ - ACHERON FOOTPRINT WESTERN CAPE
tastingDescription: False

name: SHIRAZ - BAROSSA VALLEY ESTATE BAROSSA 2019
tastingDescription: Rich dark plum, enticing notes of vanilla and cedar spice on a silky texture. Ideal as an aperitif or perfectly matched with steak, lamb and charcuterie, spicy, smoky and barbeque flavours, bernaise and peppercorn sauces, and aged cheeses.

name: SHIRAZ - BERTON METAL LABEL BLACK
tastingDescription: The Black Shiraz is an extreme example of this style, deep colour, huge palate and high alcohol. The Black Shiraz upholds the tradition with strong blackberry and plum aromas over toast, vanillan and spice. The palate is full flavoured and intense with rich blackberry, plum, blueberry and spicy characters. The tannins are very ripe and dense giving great structure and length to the palate. Perfect with slow cooked rich sauce roasts or strong cheeses!

name: SHIRAZ - BERTON OUTBACK JACK

name: SHIRAZ - DOMINIC BLACK LABEL
