name: SHIRAZ - E AND E BLACK PEPPER BAROSSA 2016
nameSanitized: shiraz - e and e black pepper barossa 2016
nameSuffix: E AND E BLACK PEPPER BAROSSA 2016
sort: SHIRAZ - E AND E BLACK PEPPER BAROSSA 2016
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Spectator - "Dense and muscular, showing appealing focus to the dark chocolate, blackberry paste, sage and huckleberry flavors, with espresso notes weaving in and out. Cigar box aromas emerge on the finish, where thick tannins offer a dense backbone and a touch of rusticity. Drink now through 2036." (April 2020)

name: SHIRAZ - FULLGLASS WINES SKULLS 2017
tastingDescription: 94 Points Wine Orbit: "It is fabulously ripe and fragrant on the nose showing blackberry, blueberry jam, cake spice, cedar and cocoa characters, leading to a succulent palate that is opulent and fleshy. The wine offers terrific power and intensity, finishing long and delicious." (February 2019)

name: SHIRAZ - GEORGE WYNDHAM BIN 555
tastingDescription: This popular Shiraz is a sure bet for grilling. The alluring ripe fruit flavours of rich plum and peppery notes are complemented by some oak and fine grained tannin. Ideal for steak, chops or game.

name: SHIRAZ - GLAETZER AMON RA BAROSSA 2017
tastingDescription: 96 Points, Robert Parker's Wine Advocate: "Dramatic, intense and powerful… crammed with layers of fruit, complex, savoury elements and rich, velvety tannins. The product of a warm, sunny climate and ripe grapes, the 2016 does show a sense of decorum, restraint and elegance on the long finish." (September 2018)

name: SHIRAZ - GRANT BURGE BAROSSA INK
tastingDescription: Grant Burge's winemaking team carefully blended vibrant, flavour-packed parcels of premium Barossa wine to create a Shiraz so bold and dark in colour, it’s almost ink. This super-rich, full-bodied wine has a sensual palate offering plenty of texture, fine velvety tannins and soft, round dark fruit flavours.

name: SHIRAZ - HENSCHKE HILL OF GRACE EDEN VALLEY 2014
nameSanitized: shiraz - henschke hill of grace eden valley 2014
nameSuffix: HENSCHKE HILL OF GRACE EDEN VALLEY 2014
sort: SHIRAZ - HENSCHKE HILL OF GRACE EDEN VALLEY 2014
tastingDescription: 99 Points, James Suckling - "Amazing aromas of wet aged beef, spices, crushed elderberries, peppercorns and bay leaf. Full body and polished, fully integrated tannin to the fruit. Finishes very fresh and vivid. Gorgeous to drink now, but will age wonderfully." (May, 2019)

name: SHIRAZ - JACOB'S CREEK DOUBLE BARREL BAROSSA
nameSanitized: shiraz - jacobs creek double barrel barossa
sort: SHIRAZ - JACOB'S CREEK DOUBLE BARREL BAROSSA
tastingDescription: Jacob’s Creek Double Barrel Shiraz has a full and generous palate with a beguiling mix of sweet red fruits and dark chocolate, indicative of its origins as a Barossa Shiraz. Subtle toasty vanilla notes from aging in traditional French oak wine barrels. The careful use of aged Scotch whiskey barrels for finishing has added complex nuances of almond and also softened the dense tannins to create an incredible smoothness.

name: SHIRAZ - JAM JAR SWEET SHIRAZ
tastingDescription: Crafted in a lighter style than your typical Shiraz, this fresh, fruity, semi-sweet wine displays aromas and flavours of ripe, juicy berries with dark chocolate undertones. Refreshing and approachable with the perfect balance between sweetness and acidity, it is a versatile food wine. Best served slightly chilled.

name: SHIRAZ - LANGMEIL BAROSSA VALLEY FLOOR 2018
tastingDescription: This wine is full-bodied and has grippy tannins that gradually relax and allow the mulberries and red plum flavours to come out. The finish is long with some oak spice and licorice notes.

name: SHIRAZ - LAYER CAKE 2018
tastingDescription: The finish lingers on, hanging on the palette while the fruit and spice flavours slowly change and fade. Layer Cake Shiraz screams for a black pepper seasoned steak on the barbecue!

name: SHIRAZ - MCWILLIAMS STOLEN COLT
tastingDescription: Intense red purple. Aromas of bold dark fruit flavours of blueberry and black plums. Intense dark berry fruits, toasty oak and flesh tannins.

name: SHIRAZ - MOLLYDOOKER BLUE EYED BOY 2018
tastingDescription: False

name: SHIRAZ - MOLLYDOOKER CARNIVAL OF LOVE MCLAREN VALE 2017
nameSanitized: shiraz - mollydooker carnival of love mclaren vale 2017
nameSuffix: MOLLYDOOKER CARNIVAL OF LOVE MCLAREN VALE 2017
sort: SHIRAZ - MOLLYDOOKER CARNIVAL OF LOVE MCLAREN VALE 2017
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Spectator - "Strikes the right balance between dense, dark flavors and a juicy, vibrant note. Apricot, cherry and raspberry flavors are pure, ripe and expressive, mingling well with Earl Grey tea, sarsaparilla and orange zest accents. The tannins are concentrated and a tad rustic on the finish, adding a charming chewy element. Drink now through 2027." (March 2018)

name: SHIRAZ - MOLLYDOOKER THE BOXER 2019
tastingDescription: 92 Points Wine Spectator: "Thick, with sink-your-teeth-into-them tannins and powerful, ripe blackberry, huckleberry and blueberry flavors that show aromatic accents of allspice, Earl Grey tea, vanilla bean, milk chocolate and dried violet on the finish. Drink now through 2036." (May 2021)

name: SHIRAZ - MOLLYDOOKER VELVET GLOVE MCLAREN VALE 16/17
nameSanitized: shiraz - mollydooker velvet glove mclaren vale 16/17
sort: SHIRAZ - MOLLYDOOKER VELVET GLOVE MCLAREN VALE 16/17
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Spectator - "Floral white pepper notes announce the juicy core of black tea, plum and tangy cherry flavors, with toasty shadings of spice and cedar that linger on the finish. Shows plenty of harmony and detail against velvety tannins. The density and power sneak up on the finish. Drink now through 2027." (2018)

name: SHIRAZ - PENFOLDS BIN 28 KALIMNA 2019
tastingDescription: Well-balanced. Whirling black fruits and an oscillating shiraz disposition - Bin 28 by any other name, personality intact. Flavours akin to a consomme of dried porcini mushrooms; structurally embedded with grainy/sandy tannins.

name: SHIRAZ - PENFOLDS GRANGE 2013
tastingDescription:
Unfurling and slowly building in the medium to full-bodied mouth with wonderful grace and depth, it reveals an incredible array of ripe black fruit, spice, meat and earth-inspired flavors, with a rock-solid frame to support this beauty (it should easily cellar for 40+ years!), while previously latent flavors emerge fully on the epically long finish, culminating in that ultimate Grange experience. Oh, yes. Drink: 2024 - 2057.
100 pts, Wine Advocate

name: SHIRAZ - PENFOLDS GRANGE 2013
tastingDescription: 97 Points, Wine Spectator - "This is bold, with plenty of power and grace. Dense and lush up front, featuring aromatic notes of espresso and milk chocolate, wild blackberry and maraschino cherry flavors. Perfumed gingerbread, licorice, sandalwood and Kalamata olive details emerge on the epic finish, showing tremendous harmony" (March 2018)

name: SHIRAZ - PENFOLDS GRANGE 2014
tastingDescription: 98 Points, Wine Advocate: "Rich, concentrated and intense, the 2014 Grange delivers exactly what we've come to expect from this Penfolds icon wine. It's full-bodied, velvety in feel and loaded with plummy fruit, framed in vanilla and cedar. Dense, powerful and tannic. Drink: 2025 - 2050." (October 2018)

name: SHIRAZ - PENFOLDS GRANGE 2015
tastingDescription: 100 Points, James Suckling;  100 Points, Andrew Caillard; 98 Points, Wine advocate - Crafted utilising fully-ripe, intensely-flavoured and structured Shiraz grapes, the result is a unique Australian style that is now recognised as one of the most consistent of the world’s great wines.

name: SHIRAZ - PENFOLDS RWT BAROSSA 2019
tastingDescription: RWT is made from fruit primarily selected for its aromatic qualities and fine texture. The result is a wine that helps to redefine Barossa Shiraz at the highest quality level. Continue cellaring. Peak drinking window 2020 - 2040

name: SHIRAZ - PENFOLDS ST. HENRI 2018
tastingDescription: "Aged for 12 months in over 50-year-old large wooden vats. On the nose blueberries, mocha, violets, black olives and touches of fresh eucalyptus leaves and Middle Eastern spices. Drink now, with decanter and protein at hand, or cellar through 2029.  -  94 Points, Wine Enthusiast

name: SHIRAZ - PETER LEHMANN BAROSSA PORTRAIT 2017
tastingDescription: This iconic Shiraz shows great depth of colour, reflecting the splendid vintage. The bouquet has tantalizing aromas of dark plum and black fruits with just a hint of oak in the background. It has an excellent structure, with its rich fruit flavours and peppery spice controlled by firm tannins.

name: SHIRAZ - PETER LEHMANN THE BAROSSAN 2017
tastingDescription: 90 Points, James Suckling - "A big, bold and almost candied-fruit style with toffee-dipped red berries and a herbal streak. The palate delivers a bold ball of rich fruit. Slippery and slick. Drink now." (August 2018)

name: SHIRAZ - PIRRAMIMMA 1892 MCLAREN VALE 2018
tastingDescription: A bouquet of black cherry, spicy plum and cranberry, enhanced by hints of spice and subtle toasted oak. With the palate showcasing satsuma plum, red current and mulberry, complemented by blackberry and vanillin notes. A rich firmly structured wine with fruit, oak and tannin in harmony.

name: SHIRAZ - PIRRAMIMMA MCLAREN VALE 2017
tastingDescription: The quality of the 30 year old grapes shines through in this wine's rich fruit characteristics and is skillfully integrated with oak notes to produce a richly complex palate. This wine will surely appreciate cellaring for many years.

name: SHIRAZ - QUARISA 30 MILE
tastingDescription: Beautiful mint and black fruit on the nose gives way to rich black cherry flavours and soft tannins on the palate. Food Pairing: This would be a great match with lamb and mint pesto.

name: SHIRAZ - ROSEMOUNT ESTATE
tastingDescription: A fruit-driven nose with pronounced aromas of blackcurrants and dark cherries enhanced with subtle hints of oak. A medium-bodied palate with upfront red berry fruit supported by flavoursome vanillin oak that follows through to a soft, generous finish.

name: SHIRAZ - SALTRAM 1859 BAROSSA
tastingDescription: On the nose, blood plums and fresh cherries complemented with hints of strawberries, and pepper spices. This medium to full bodied wine has a vibrant palate with an excellent balance of fruit flavours, silky tannins and a fine lingering finish.

name: SHIRAZ - SELAKS TASTE COLLECTION PEPPER AND SPICE
nameSanitized: shiraz - selaks taste collection pepper and spice
nameSuffix: SELAKS TASTE COLLECTION PEPPER AND SPICE
sort: SHIRAZ - SELAKS TASTE COLLECTION PEPPER AND SPICE
tastingDescription: This Shiraz displays rich dark berry flavours, complemented with a hint of spice and oak, with soft velvety tannins and good length on the finish.

name: SHIRAZ - SIDEWOOD ESTATE STABLEMATE
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Tastings.com - "Aromas and flavors of grilled mushrooms, sun dried tomato, green olives, and peppermint-vanilla with a slightly chewy, vibrant, fruity medium-full body and a peppery, compelling, medium-long finish with notes of incense and brown butter roasted nuts with moderate oak flavor. A complex and captivating Shiraz that will amplify a fine meal." (Jun 2020)

name: SHIRAZ - SMALL GULLY MR BLACK'S LITTLE BOOK 16
nameSanitized: shiraz - small gully mr blacks little book 16
nameSuffix: SMALL GULLY MR BLACK'S LITTLE BOOK 16
sort: SHIRAZ - SMALL GULLY MR BLACK'S LITTLE BOOK 16
tastingDescription: “Small Gully is a real gem for consistently producing affordable wines that over deliver and this little book is more than just a good read! Ripe and rich, it displays blackberry, mint, licorice and juicy cherry fruit layered on velvety, polished tannins and a long finish. A BC Liquor Stores Exclusive with immediate appeal and is sure to be a crowd pleaser.” - Kim Giesbrecht, Category Manager for Wines of Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, BIBC & Cask

name: SHIRAZ - SMOKY BAY WINERY
tastingDescription: Black cherry colour, candied berry bouquet with a hint of mint. Hearty and round on the palate with ripe berry flavours, hints of spices and a soft, pleasant finish.  This is an ideal match for grilled meats or pork.

name: SHIRAZ - THOMAS GOSS MCLAREN VALE
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Orbit - “The wine is fabulously lifted on the nose showing black/blueberry, dark plum, violet and mint chocolate characters, leading to a succulent palate that is velvety and rounded. The wine offers pristine fruit flavours combined with elegant spicy complexity, wonderfully supported by supple tannins. Immediate and delectable.” (August 2017)

name: SHIRAZ - TORBRECK WOODCUTTER'S  2019
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "This wine offers oodles of plush, plump plum and cherry accented by flowers, peppery spice, soy and iron. The palate delivers what the nose suggests. It's broad shouldered but neatly cupped by fine, chalky tannins. There's a lucidity here thanks to minimal oak. Tangy fruit and a saline note carry the finish. It's a charming example of modern Barossa Shiraz."

name: SHIRAZ - TWO HANDS ANGELS SHARE MCLAREN VALE 2018
nameSanitized: shiraz - two hands angels share mclaren vale 2018
nameSuffix: TWO HANDS ANGELS SHARE MCLAREN VALE 2018
sort: SHIRAZ - TWO HANDS ANGELS SHARE MCLAREN VALE 2018
tastingDescription: This full-bodied wine has ripe raspberry, blackberry, cigar box and chocolate wrapped in big but well-integrated tannins.

name: SHIRAZ - WAKEFIELD CLARE VALLEY 2017
tastingDescription: The palate is rich, luscious and round with intense, perfectly ripened fruit characters. Roasted coffee bean and subtle spice characters complement the generous fruit flavours. This Aussie Shiraz is medium- to full-bodied with a soft mid-palate and supple tannins. It has a well- balanced structure with great texture, good length and lashings of fruit on the finish. Pair with pepper encrusted pork tenderloin with sauteed peppers and wild rice.

name: SHIRAZ - WHISTLER ESTATE BAROSSA 2016
tastingDescription: 93 Pts, James Suckling - A bold array of blackberries and dark plums that is swathed in dark chocolate and spicy oak. The palate has a handy sense of depth and density with plenty of rich fruit flavor. Impressive.

name: SHIRAZ - WOLF BLASS YELLOW LABEL
tastingDescription: Wolf Blass Yellow Label Shiraz shows fragrant berry and subtle spice aromas. A juicy, flavoursome palate with fine velvety tannins creates a richly textured red wine with a smooth, lingering finish.

name: SHIRAZ - YALUMBA ORGANIC
tastingDescription: This wine is fruit-driven and medium-bodied with complex flavours of violets and spice with hints of fresh licorice and lingering notes of plum. Fine, soft tannins and a savoury, persistent finish makes this wine highly versatile. Vegan and vegetarian friendly, it's a fabulous wine to drink on its own yet great with food. Enjoy it with barbecue, lasagne, duck or even pizza.

name: SHIRAZ - YELLOW TAIL
tastingDescription: False

name: SHIRAZ - YELLOW TAIL
tastingDescription: This Shiraz is everything a great wine should be – vibrant, smooth, rich and easy to drink. Crushed red berries, sweet spice and cedar notes dominate the nose and mouth, but subtle spice and a hint of dusty tannins join in for good measure on a long, juicy finish.Crushed red berries, sweet spice and cedar notes dominate the nose and mouth, but subtle spice and a hint of dusty tannins join in for good measure on a long, juicy finish. Enjoy with a group of friends and a hearty barbecued steak.

name: SHIRAZ CABERNET - CAPE MENTELLE MARGARET RIVER 2018
nameSanitized: shiraz cabernet - cape mentelle margaret river 2018
sort: SHIRAZ CABERNET - CAPE MENTELLE MARGARET RIVER 2018
tastingDescription: 90 Points, James Suckling: "A fruity rose that shows nectarines, strawberries and peaches. Quite full-bodied on the palate for a rose, but this delivers verve and delight. Drink now." (June 2019)

name: SHIRAZ CABERNET - MOLLYDOOKER ENCHANTED PATH MCLAREN 2017
nameSanitized: shiraz cabernet - mollydooker enchanted path mclaren 2017
sort: SHIRAZ CABERNET - MOLLYDOOKER ENCHANTED PATH MCLAREN 2017
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Spectator - "Plush and plump, offering an expressive mouthful of sarsaparilla-scented blueberry and wild blackberry flavors, accented by plenty of fresh-cracked black pepper and chocolate-covered coffee bean notes. Harmonious and lingering. Drink now through 2027." (March 2018)

name: SHIRAZ CABERNET SAUVIGNON - BRYNE HIGHROLLER RESERVE
nameSanitized: shiraz cabernet sauvignon - bryne highroller reserve
sort: SHIRAZ CABERNET SAUVIGNON - BRYNE HIGHROLLER RESERVE
tastingDescription: False

name: SHIRAZ CABERNET SAUVIGNON - PENFOLDS KOONUNGA HILL
nameSanitized: shiraz cabernet sauvignon - penfolds koonunga hill
sort: SHIRAZ CABERNET SAUVIGNON - PENFOLDS KOONUNGA HILL
tastingDescription: Crushed velvet depth defines the texture of this cassis-scented, persistent and generously fruited wine. Flavours of mint, damp herbs and oak round out the palate. This wine is great with steak or lamb.

name: SHIRAZ CABERNET SAUVIGNON - THE WHALE CALLER
nameSanitized: shiraz cabernet sauvignon - the whale caller
sort: SHIRAZ CABERNET SAUVIGNON - THE WHALE CALLER
tastingDescription: A rich and full-bodied blend of Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon. Lovely aromas of prunes, plums and cherries with oak spice and a hint of cigar. Exclusive to BC Liquor Stores.

name: SHIRAZ CABERNET SAUVIGNON - WOLF BLASS RED LABEL
nameSanitized: shiraz cabernet sauvignon - wolf blass red label
sort: SHIRAZ CABERNET SAUVIGNON - WOLF BLASS RED LABEL
tastingDescription: This classic medium-bodied red blend offers bright and juicy flavors. The Shiraz brings an element of soft, plush berries. Meanwhile the Cabernet Sauvignon brings a solid structure and lasting finish to help compliment the palate.

name: SHIRAZ DURIF - 19 CRIMES VICTORIA
tastingDescription: Picnic Basket is fresh, racy and dry, with a basket of strawberries, herbs and melon flavours. A modern red wine that is sure to be a hit for al fresco dining with barbequed prawns, salmon, salads or perfect for summer sipping. A limited supply for spring and summer, enjoy it while it's here.

name: SHIRAZ GRENACHE - FRANK HELLWIG
tastingDescription: Aromas of cassis and mulberry complements subtle spice with a solid structure.

name: SHIRAZ GRENACHE - GLAETZER WALLACE BAROSSA 2017
tastingDescription: 90+ Points, Robert Parker's Wine Advocate - "The 2017 blend is heavily weighted toward Shiraz (as usual), but it’s the Grenache that makes itself known on the nose, adding lovely florals and raspberries to the slightly darker toned fruit of the Shiraz. Medium to full-bodied, this is supple yet crisp... but finishes with silky tannins and plenty of length." (June 2019)

name: SHIRAZ GRENACHE - SECRET CELLAR
tastingDescription: This delicious blend of spicy Shiraz and delicious Grenache is an intense but velvety soft wine. Showing lovely peppery notes and black cherry on the nose, moving into ripe red and black berry fruit with a hint dark spice on the palate. Exclusive to BC Liquor Stores.

name: SHIRAZ MATARO GRENACHE - PENFOLDS BIN 138 BAROSSA 2018
nameSanitized: shiraz mataro grenache - penfolds bin 138 barossa 2018
sort: SHIRAZ MATARO GRENACHE - PENFOLDS BIN 138 BAROSSA 2018
tastingDescription: 94 points, James Suckling: "A blend of 68% shiraz, 22% grenache and 10% mataro, this is definitely lead by shiraz with a very rich, brambly of ripe red plums, blackberries and raspberries and some blue-fruit tones. The raspberry and redder-fruit flavor sails  in a very plush and velvety texture." (September 2020)

name: SHIRAZ PETITE SIRAH - SHOT IN THE DARK
nameSanitized: shiraz petite sirah - shot in the dark
sort: SHIRAZ PETITE SIRAH - SHOT IN THE DARK
tastingDescription: Intense red with purple hues. On the nose, fresh and voluptuous flavours of black cherry, blackberry, chocolate and spice. On the palate, deep spice engage with notes of ripe berries with hints of smoke and espresso, culminating in a soft velvety finish.

name: SHIRAZ VIOGNIER - BLACK CHOOK MCLAREN VALE 2019
nameSanitized: shiraz viognier - black chook mclaren vale 2019
sort: SHIRAZ VIOGNIER - BLACK CHOOK MCLAREN VALE 2019
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Orbit - "An impressively fruited shiraz with a touch of Padthaway viognier (4%), the beautifully perfumed bouquet shows black/blueberry, cranberry, cocoa, toasted hazelnut and spice aromas. The palate is succulent and rounded, and delivers excellent mid palate weight and texture, brilliantly supported by polished tannins. Hugely appealing." (August 2017)

name: SHIRAZ VIOGNIER - QUARISA JOHNNY Q
tastingDescription: Intense, youthful, fresh and ripe with wild blueberry flavours and black pepper contribute to its savoury complexity. Dense on the palate with flavours of mulberries and ripe black fruits it is balanced with spicy oak and ripe succulent tannins. Try with a roast rack of lamb or mature hard cheeses.

name: SHIRAZ VIOGNIER - TORBRECK RUNRIG 2017
tastingDescription:
As usual, the 2017 RunRig is approximately 2% Viognier. It spent almost 30 months in oak, 40% of which was new. Hints of peach or apricot appear on the nose, alongside notes of hickory smoke, cherries and baking spices. It's full-bodied and concentrated but supple and silky enough to seem lighter in the mouth, showing tremendous length and elegance on the finish, where it adds nuances of cinnamon and cocoa. Drink 2020 - 2035.
98 pts, Wine Advocate

name: SHIRAZ- PENFOLDS BIN 128 COONAWARRA 2019
tastingDescription: An aromatic veil of black-truffled earthiness meshed with porcini mushroom over a dark chocolate base. On the palate a quilt of berried shiraz fruits and lingering tannins provide a structural palate platform.

name: SHIRAZ- PENFOLDS GRANGE GIFT BOX
tastingDescription: The most powerful expression of Penfolds multi-vineyard, multi-district blending philosophy, Grange is arguably Australia's most celebrated wine and is officially listed as a Heritage Icon of South Australia. Crafted utilising fully-ripe, intensely-flavoured and structured shiraz grapes, the result is a unique Australian style that is now recognised as one of the most consistent of the world's great wines.

name: SHO CHIKU BAI - SPARKLING
tastingDescription: False

name: SICILIA CATARRATTO - CARUSO & MININI NATURALMENTE BIO 2017
nameSanitized: sicilia catarratto - caruso & minini naturalmente bio 2017
sort: SICILIA CATARRATTO - CARUSO & MININI NATURALMENTE BIO 2017
tastingDescription: False

name: SICILIA FRAPPATO - ARIANNA OCCHIPINTI II FRAPPATO 2016
nameSanitized: sicilia frappato - arianna occhipinti ii frappato 2016
sort: SICILIA FRAPPATO - ARIANNA OCCHIPINTI II FRAPPATO 2016
tastingDescription: 90+ Points, Vinous - "Dark matte ruby. Intense aromas of currant, black berry, liquorice and herbs. Full and dense. Very ripe but prominent tannins wrap around orange peel, cardamom, red berries and brambles. A substantial wine but extremely easy to drink."

name: SICILIA GRILLO - CURATOLO ARINI 2019
tastingDescription: False

name: SICILIA GRILLO - NICOSIA VEGAN ORGANIC VEGAN
nameSanitized: sicilia grillo - nicosia vegan organic vegan
sort: SICILIA GRILLO - NICOSIA VEGAN ORGANIC VEGAN
tastingDescription: Fragrant bouquet of floral and citrusy notes, featuring hints of aromatic herbs. Great freshness and savoriness, with a full and lingering taste. Pairs well with grilled vegetables, salads, and vegetarian dishes.

name: SICILIA GRILLO - RAPITALA ORGANIC
tastingDescription: The grillo variety is indigenous to Sicily, and grown at higher, cooler elevations. With herbal, floral and citrus aromas, followed on the palate by flavours of white peach, ripe pear and citrus. Light body and good balance, this wine would pair well with pasta, seafood or grilled vegetables.

name: SICILIA GRILLO - SOGNO ITALIANO
tastingDescription: This Sicilian variety produces a delicious wine bursting with lemon and tropical fruit flavours. Youthful and bright, Grillo is a refreshing companion to summer appetizers,salads and Mediterrean grilled seafood.

name: SICILIA NERELLO MASCALESE - ZABU IL PASSO 2019
nameSanitized: sicilia nerello mascalese - zabu il passo 2019
sort: SICILIA NERELLO MASCALESE - ZABU IL PASSO 2019
tastingDescription: This wine is bright ruby red, vivid and full. An intense aroma of red fruits, spices and red flowers lead to warm, full, soft and well-balanced flavours, with aftertaste of red fruits in the finish. Best served with pasta with rich sauces, meat and seasoned cheeses.

name: SICILIA NERO D'AVOLA - CUSUMANO
tastingDescription: Muscular, ripe, supple. Smoky and muscular character with a confiture of sun-ripened black fruits, espresso, grilled meats and spice. It is toasted and earthy, dense and ripe. Sweet black fruit and sarsaparilla lift the palate, it enters with an attractive suppleness and trails powdery skin tannins. Expect great structure and excellent acidity to add levity.

name: SICILIA NERO D'AVOLA CABERNET SAUVIGNON - MONTALTO
nameSanitized: sicilia nero davola cabernet sauvignon - montalto
sort: SICILIA NERO D'AVOLA CABERNET SAUVIGNON - MONTALTO
tastingDescription: This wine has an intense ruby red color with matching highlights. Phenolic, with a bouquet full of spices, dark fruit, and touches of caramel. This wine has an elegant structure due to the soft tannins and sweet vanilla. The spices on the palate pair well with barbecued meat, pizza, salami, and aged cheeses like Pecorino.

name: SICILIA PINOT GRIGIO - FARNESE FANTINI
tastingDescription: Straw yellow with golden highlights. Complex, fruit and herbal aromas, hints of oak, vanilla, nutmeg. Fruity, peach, grapefruit, lemon-lime and mineral favours; medium body with roundness and a pleasant mouthfeel, good balance; finish is long, clean, spicy yet delicate.

name: SICILIA PINOT GRIGIO - MONTALTO
tastingDescription: This wine has a straw yellow color with yellow highlights. The bouquet is full of citrus fruits like grapefruit, juicy exotic fruits, and hints of fresh green herbs. In the palate there is a medium acidity that helps give a good structure and lasting finish to the wine. Enjoy this wine with grilled seafood, vegetables, chicken, or even a savory curry.

name: SICILIA ROSSO - FIRRIATO NARI
tastingDescription: False

name: SICILIANE CATARRATTO ZIBIBBO - CRUDO ORGANIC
tastingDescription: Bright yellow to the eye, the Catarratto Zibibbo has an aromatic bouquet with hints of tropical fruit, pineapple, elderflower and citrus. On the palate, it is fresh and fruity with balanced sweetness, and expresses notes of ripe tropical fruits like pineapple and mango, followed by white flowers and lime.

name: SICILY - TENUTA CASTELLARO YPSILON ROSSO
tastingDescription: 91+ Points, Wine Advocate - From the volcanic island of Lipari, off the coast of Sicily. �60% Corinto Nero, 20% Alicante, 20% Nero d�Avola. Showing sweet cherry fruit, wild raspberry, blue flowers and candied orange peel. Bright, buoyant and fragrant red wine. Nicely balanced by fresh acidity. 12,000 bottles produced.� (October 2019�)

name: SIMES VINEYARD - MARTIN'S LANE RIESLING 2017
tastingDescription: False

name: SMALL MERCY EASYGOING RED
tastingDescription: False

name: SMALL MERCY UPBEAT WHITE
tastingDescription: False

name: SMITH WOODHOUSE - LATE BOTTLED VINTAGE 2008
tastingDescription: A rich, opulent style of LBV brimming with concentrated aromas of black fruits, berries and hints of violets. On the palate the wine is elegant and balanced, with succulent fruit flavours and a firm structure.

name: SOAVE CLASSICO - BOLLA
tastingDescription: Notes of melon, pear and ripe apple abound, followed by a long and lingering finish. A delicate almond aftertaste makes it the perfect quaff to lighter fare like grilled seafood, chicken, fish-based pastas and entrée salads. It also makes a perfect aperitif.

name: SOAVE CLASSICO - TEDESCHI CAPITEL TENDA 2018
tastingDescription: Yellow in colour with green reflections. Clear and transparent. Strong and complex fruity bouquet. Very clean with notes of dry fruits. Rich and elegant. Good body and good acidity. Relatively warm, rounded and well- balanced. Pleasing and elegant.

name: SOAVE CLASSICO GARGANEGA - GINI
tastingDescription: 90 Points, Gismondi on Wine - "These 70 year old Garganega vines are grown on volcanic and limestone soils in the historic hillsides of Soave Classico. This carries the Classico weight, with honeysuckle, river stones and a grip of mineral salts running the sides to a lightly spiced finish. New classic." (August 2019)

name: SOBERBO - VERMOUTH
tastingDescription: False

name: SOLAIA - ANTINORI SOLAIA 2017
tastingDescription: An intense ruby red in color, Solaia  distinguishes itself on the nose by its intensity and its aromatic richness, the notes of ripe dark fruit, particularly blackberries and blueberries, fused with balsamic sensations of aromatic herbs and mint; sweet notes of chocolate and cotton candy alternate with spicy suggestions of white pepper, conferring freshness and complexity to the bouquet.

name: SOLEMME - ESPRIT DE SOLEMME BRUT NATURE ORGANIC
nameSanitized: solemme - esprit de solemme brut nature organic
nameSuffix: ESPRIT DE SOLEMME BRUT NATURE ORGANIC
sort: SOLEMME - ESPRIT DE SOLEMME BRUT NATURE ORGANIC
tastingDescription: False

name: SOMMET BLANC
tastingDescription: Cellared in British Columbia's renowned Okanagan Valley, Sommet Blanc is a crisp, dry French-style wine blended with grapes sourced from premium vineyards around the globe. Traditional winemaking methods, resulting in a smooth and consistent taste, have helped Sommet Blanc win medals of excellence in European competitions.

name: SOMMET ROUGE
tastingDescription: Sommet Rouge is a full-bodied, dry French-style wine blended with grapes sourced from premium vinyeards around the globe. Traditional winemaking methods, resulting in a smooth and consistent taste, have helped Sommet Rouge win medals of excellence in European competitions.

name: SORELLE BRONCA - VALDOBBIADENE PROSECCO SUP EXTRA BRUT P232
nameSanitized: sorelle bronca - valdobbiadene prosecco sup extra brut p232
nameSuffix: VALDOBBIADENE PROSECCO SUP EXTRA BRUT P232
sort: SORELLE BRONCA - VALDOBBIADENE PROSECCO SUP EXTRA BRUT P232
tastingDescription: 91 Points, Vinous - " The 2019 Particella 232 ... boasts crushed stone minerality with hints of ginger and field grasses. It's round and soothing; yet it quickly firms up through a mix of minerals and brisk acids, giving way to notes of sour apple and herbs. This tapers off especially dry with a cheek-puckering tension." Eric Guido.

name: SPATBURGUNDER - THORLE RHEINHESSEN 2018
tastingDescription: Aged in new French oak barrels (15%) Neutral German oak barrels (85%), the wine is unfiltered and unfined. A brilliant ruby colour, Intense with exceptional fruit definition, reminiscent of violets and wild red fruits, brambleberries and cherries, combined with a richly textured palate, great length of finish.

name: SPEARHEAD PINOT GRIS 2020
tastingDescription: Located in Kelowna, this new outfit has garnered good press for their Pinots, both Noir and Gris. Sourcing is from estate and Kelowna area plus select growers in Summerland. An expressive Pinot Gris, it is more crisp then oily, with good citrus and complexity that really lingers.

name: SPERLING VINEYARDS - BRUT 2011
tastingDescription: This classic method sparkling is born of Sperling’s heritage family vineyard on the mountain air cooled east benches of Kelowna, where the grapes reach ideal maturity and development through long, crisp fall days. In the traditional way, they allow the wine to spend extended time on its lees - 36 months, to develop richness and complexity on a delicate, mineral-rich frame.

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU BEAU SEJOUR BECOT 2018
nameSanitized: st emilion - chateau beau sejour becot 2018
sort: ST EMILION - CHATEAU BEAU SEJOUR BECOT 2018
tastingDescription:
"This estate makes an incredibly classic, elegant Saint-Emilion. The 2018 Château Beau-Séjour Bécot is based on 80% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Franc, and the rest Cabernet Sauvignon that was brought up in 65% new French oak. ...it reveals a deep purple/ruby color as well as perfumed cassis and mulberry fruits intermixed with ample spring flowers, chalky minerality, violets, and graphite. Medium to full-bodied and nicely concentrated on the palate, it has terrific mid-palate depth, flawless balance, background oak, and polished yet significant tannins. This warrants 5-7 years of bottle age and will have 30+ years of prime drinking."
96+ pts, Jeb Dunnuck
12 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU BEAUSEJOUR DUFFAU 2017
tastingDescription:
"Deep garnet-purple in color, the 2017 Beausejour (Duffau Lagarrosse) prances out of the glass with energetic notes of crushed black and red plums, black cherries and black raspberries plus wafts of potpourri, oolong tea and lavender. The medium-bodied palate is oh-so-pretty with bags of fragrant fruit and a firm, plush frame, finishing long and perfumed. Drink: 2021 - 2048."
97 Points, Wine Advocate
4 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU BEAUSEJOUR DUFFAU 2018
tastingDescription:
"Deep garnet-purple colored, the 2018 Beausejour Heritiers Duffau-Lagarrosse comes prancing out of the glass with the most gorgeous perfume of plum preserves, kirsch, redcurrant jelly and red roses, followed by suggestions of molten licorice, raspberry leaves, oolong tea and iron ore, with a waft of forest floor. The medium to full-bodied palate is laden with black and red berry preserves layers, framed by fantastically plush tannins and a seamless backbone, finishing long and earthy. Drink Date: 2024 - 2044."
97 pts, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU BEL AIR 2018
tastingDescription:
Deep garnet-purple in color, the 2018 Cuvée Jean Gabriel—a blend of 50% Merlot and 50% Cabernet Franc—spills out of the glass with scents of ripe red and black plums, redcurrant jelly and Morello cherries with wafts of mossy tree bark and damp soil. The medium to full-bodied palate delivers a good amount of juicy red and black fruits with a soft texture and just enough freshness, finishing earthy. Drink Date: 2021 - 2030.
90 pts, Wine Advocate

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU BELAIR MONAGE 2018
tastingDescription:
"Made from 90% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc, the medium to deep garnet-purple colored 2018 Belair Monange rolls effortlessly out of the glass with gregarious scents of black cherry preserves, stewed plums and boysenberries, plus suggestions of Indian spices, rose oil, Ceylon tea and garrigue, with a waft of tilled soil. The rich, seductive, full-bodied palate is laden with black fruit preserves and exotic spice layers, framed by velvety tannins and seamless freshness, finishing long and fragrant. Wonderfully hedonic and conceivably drinkable now, give it 4-5 years in the cellar to allow the earthy/savory nuances to fully emerge from within the fruit and drink it over the next 25 years or more. Drink Date: 2025 - 2050."
98 pts, Wine Advocate
6 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU BELLEVUE MONDOTTE 2007
tastingDescription: 94 Points, Wine Advocate: "Very little wine is produced from this tiny 5-acre vineyard, but it is always among the most concentrated and richest of Bordeaux. The inky/purple-colored 2007 offers sweet cassis fruit notes interwoven with notions of graphite, chalk dust, and toast. Full-bodied with terrific purity and intensity… Drink: 2010 - 2030." (April 2010)

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU BELLEVUE MONDOTTE 2010
tastingDescription: 96 Points, James Suckling: "This is incredibly intense and powerful with aromas of iron, spice and berry. Full body with a dense center palate of dark fruits and chocolate. Very long and refined. Balanced. Try in 2018." (November 2013)

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU BERLIQUET 2017
tastingDescription:
"Deep garnet-purple in color, the 2017 Berliquet gives up expressive notes of baked plums, blackberry preserves and mulberries with hints of licorice, crushed rocks, chargrilled meat and wild sage. Medium-bodied, the palate has a great core of elegantly played flavors framed by soft, plush tannins and bold freshness, finishing long and minerally. The blend is 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Franc and it was aged for 18 months in French oak, 50% new. Drink: 2021 - 2039."
94 Points, Wine Advocate

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CANON LA GAFFELIERE 2018
nameSanitized: st emilion - chateau canon la gaffeliere 2018
sort: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CANON LA GAFFELIERE 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Canon La Gaffelière is bright, punchy and full of character, just as it was from barrel. Sage, blood orange, mocha and spice add pretty aromatic top notes to a core of inky red/purplish berry fruit. All the elements are so well balanced in this super-expressive Saint-Émilion. Bright floral and savory Franc notes punctuate the salivating finish, mineral-drenched finish. The 2018 needs a lot of air to open, but when it does, it is dynamite. Drinking Window: 2026 - 2043."
97 pts, Vinous
12 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CHAUVIN 2018
tastingDescription:
"Checking in as a mix of 85% Merlot, 12% Cabernet Franc, and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon brought up in 50% new oak, the 2018 Château Chauvin is a rich, powerful wine that clearly ranks with the finest wines from this address in the past decade or so. A dense purple hue is followed by awesome black raspberry and spiced cherry fruits as well as notes of chocolate, dried herbs, sandalwood, and tobacco. With full-bodied richness, a round, layered mouthfeel, and ripe yet certainly present tannins, it has some up-front appeal given its beautiful fruit and texture, yet it deserves 4-6 years in the cellar and will be a 20- to 25-year wine. Bravo!"
96 pts, Jeb Dunnuck

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CHEVAL BLANC 2010
tastingDescription: 100 Points, Wine Advocate: "… Full-bodied, big, opulent and built like a brick house, it has super firm tannins and great freshness, packed solid with muscular fruit, finishing very long. Tightly wound and oh-so-youthful, yet perfectly formed and poised to be a blockbuster... Drink: 2028 - 2078." (August 2018)

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CHEVAL BLANC 2011
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Wine Advocate: "The 2011 Cheval Blanc is one of the more plump, opulent and sexy Cheval Blancs made over recent vintages, and its forwardness, lusciousness and complexity seemingly suggest this wine is on a fast evolutionary track. ...a medium to full-bodied opulence, a sumptuous mid-palate (atypical for the vintage)..." (April 2014)

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CHEVAL BLANC 2013
tastingDescription: 95 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "Smoky aromas and layers of tannin and fruit give this wine great complexity. It is smooth, juicy and fresh while also having perfumed tannins and an elegant, lightly mineral structure from the Cabernet Franc... Drink from 2024." (March 2016)

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CHEVAL BLANC 2014
tastingDescription: 97 Points, Wine Spectator: “This has dreamy aromas already, with notes of Lapsang souchong tea, smoldering cigar and cold charcoal wafting up from the core of dense yet supple currant, fig and blackberry preserves. A loamy edge thumps through the finish, giving this an addictive, head-bobbing bass line.” (March 2017)

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CHEVAL BLANC 2015
tastingDescription: 100 Points, Wine Advocate: "… Full-bodied, very rich, very firm/taut and with very ripe, fine-grained tannins, it allows a glimpse at its incredible depth of flavors with a very long multi-layered finish. Wow. Drink: 2027 - 2067." (August 2018)

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CHEVAL BLANC 2017
tastingDescription:
“The 2016 Cheval Blanc is blended of 59.5% Merlot, 37.2% Cabernet Franc and 3.3% Cabernet Sauvignon. Deep garnet-purple in color, the nose is incredibly youthful yet not so shy as some other 2016s at this stage, giving wonderfully intense scents of red currants, black cherries, wild blueberries and violets with nuances of star anise, cinnamon stick, rose hip tea, cigar box and wood smoke plus a touch of beef drippings. Medium to full-bodied, the palate has jaw-dropping elegance and depth, offering up layer upon layer of fragrant red and black fruits plus an extraordinary array of mineral sparks, supported by a rock-solid grainy texture, finishing with epic persistence and an edifying perfume. This is a very different style from the rich, opulently hedonic 2015, yet this wonderfully fragrant, beautifully poised and intellectually compelling 2016 is equally extraordinary. Drink: 2023 - 2070.”
100 Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CHEVAL BLANC 2018
tastingDescription:
"A great Cheval Blanc that stands up to the potential that I found during en primeur. Extremely restrained and classic in its construction, shot through with points of mint, liquorice, raspberry and eucalyptus. The fresh aromatics mean you could almost think that it is from a cool year, except for the huge density that runs through the palate, along with a creamy texture. Extremely good-quality. Something that you are going to want to put away for a good few decades. I get big, chewy tannins on the finish. Exceptionally good and extremely elegant."
100 pts, Decanter
6 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CLOS FOURTET 2017
tastingDescription:
"The 2017 Clos Fourtet is vivid, rich and super-expressive. Beams of salinity give the 2017 its energy and shape. In the glass, the 2017 is wonderfully vivid and nuanced. Lavender, mint, blue fruits and blood orange all build into the beautifully layered, exquisite finish. In 2017, Clos Fourtet is all class. This is a terrific showing from the Cuvelier family. Drink: 2025 - 2047."
95 Points, Vinous
4 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CROIX DE LABRIE 2015
nameSanitized: st emilion - chateau croix de labrie 2015
sort: ST EMILION - CHATEAU CROIX DE LABRIE 2015
tastingDescription: 92 Points, Wine Advocate: "... The palate is well balanced with fresh acidity, taut tannin, bright red cherry and raspberry notes with bay leaf and a pinch of salt toward the finish. This is turning out to be a very fine Croix de Labrie. Recommended. Drink: 2020 - 2035." (February 2018)

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU FAUGERES 2017
tastingDescription:
"Deep garnet-purple in color, the 2017 Faugeres comes sashaying out of the glass with pretty kirsch, Black Forest cake and chocolate box scents followed by hints of rosehip tea, fallen leaves and cloves. Medium-bodied, the palate has a velvety texture and bags of perfumed fruit, finishing long and fragrant. The wine was aged in 50% new and 50% second fill French oak barrels for 15 months. The blend is 85% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink: 2020 - 2036."
93+ Points, Wine Advocate

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU FAUGERES 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Faugères is fabulous. Silky and nuanced, the 2018 is striking right out of the gate. There is plenty of the richness Faugères fans expect, but, at the same time, the wine is so well balanced and harmonious. Hints of rose petal, lavender, spice and dark fruits linger on the memorable close. Drinking Window: 2028 - 2048."
96 pts, Vinous

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU FIGEAC 2017
tastingDescription:
"The 2017 Figeac is outrageously beautiful. Rich, deep and ample, the 2017 soars out of the glass with vertical intensity and explosive power. The flavors are just pulsing with energy. Time in the glass brings out a captivating range of lavender, spice, mint and rose petal overtones. The 2017 Figeac is a towering achievement from Technical Director Frederic Faye and his team. When Michel Rolland was appointed consulting winemaker some years back, many feared the personality of Figeac would be lost. It is impossible for an outsider to truly know how small or large the impact of a single person is, but Figeac has indisputably been one of the very finest wines of the Right Bank over these last few years. The 2017 is a real "wow" wine; don't miss it. Drink: 2027 - 2047."
97 Points, Vinous
2 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU FIGEAC 2018
tastingDescription:
"With its rich swathe of Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine has density and immense structure balanced by stunning black fruits that give impressive promise. This powerful wine is probably the greatest ever produced from this estate. Drink from 2027."
100 pts, Wine Enthusiast
6 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU FIGEAC 2018
tastingDescription:
"With its rich swathe of Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine has density and immense structure balanced by stunning black fruits that give impressive promise. This powerful wine is probably the greatest ever produced from this estate. Drink from 2027."
100 pts, Wine Enthusiast
6 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU FLEUR CARDINALE 2018
tastingDescription:
"Deep garnet-purple in color, the 2018 Fleur Cardinale—composed of 74% Merlot, 22% Cabernet Franc and 4% Cabernet Sauvignon—leaps from the glass with vibrant notes of wild blueberries, crushed blackberries and ripe, juicy plums, plus hints of sandalwood, unsmoked cigars, menthol and licorice. Medium to full-bodied, the palate is chock-full of ripe black and blue fruits, framed by velvety tannins and beautiful freshness, finishing long with lots of mineral and exotic spice layers. A very stylish Saint-Émilion! Drink Date: 2023 - 2040."
94+ pts, Wine Advocate

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU GRACIA 2017
tastingDescription:
"Medium to deep garnet-purple in color, the 2017 Gracia comes galloping out of the glass with expressive plum preserves, black cherries and mulberries scents plus nuances of Chinese five spice, potpourri, underbrush and pencil shavings. Medium to full-bodied, the palate has fantastic poise and grace, with a firm frame of finely grained tannins and loads of freshness, finishing long and perfumed. Impressive! Drink: 2020 - 2044."
95 Points, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU GRACIA 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Gracia is a blend of 70% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, with 14% alcohol. Deep garnet-purple colored, it comes bounding out of the glass with exuberant notes of blueberry compote, baked black plums and Morello cherries, plus suggestions of chocolate box, underbrush, black truffles and tar with an emerging waft of roses. The full-bodied palate packs a fantastic wallop of black and blue fruits, framed by plush tannins and plenty of freshness, finishing long with loads of exotic spice and savory layers. Drink Date: 2024 - 2044."
94+ pts, Wine Advocate
2 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU GRAND CORBIN DESPAGNE 2018
nameSanitized: st emilion - chateau grand corbin despagne 2018
sort: ST EMILION - CHATEAU GRAND CORBIN DESPAGNE 2018
tastingDescription:
"Composed of 75% Merlot, 24% Cabernet Franc and 1% Cabernet Sauvignon, the 2018 Grand Corbin-Despagne has a deep garnet-purple color and flamboyant scents of stewed black and red cherries, mulberries and sassafras with an undercurrent of wild blueberries, potpourri and ground cloves, plus a waft of vanilla pod. The full-bodied palate is densely packed with black and blue fruit preserves, supported by firm, ripe, rounded tannins and seamless freshness, finishing long and perfumed. Drink Date: 2023 - 2040."
93 pts, Wine Advocate

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU GRAND MAYNE 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Grand Mayne keeps everything under wraps on the nose, at least for the first 60 minutes, then it blossoms to offer gorgeous pure blackberry, briary, crushed stone and light rose petal aromas. The new oak is beautifully integrated. The palate is medium-bodied with fine-grained tannins, superb acidity, gentle grip and an almost symmetrical finish of laser-like precision. An outstanding Grand Mayne, certainly one of the finest in recent years. Drinking Window: 2023 - 2045."
94 pts, Vinous

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU LA DOMINIQUE 2017
tastingDescription:
"Lively, with loganberry, damson plum and red currant fruit forming the core. A racy mineral streak runs through the middle, while fresh savory and floral nuances emerge along the edges. Focused, lengthy and elegant. Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2021 through 2031."
92 Points, Wine Spectator
6 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU LA DOMINIQUE 2018
tastingDescription:
"Tasting more like a great Pomerol than a Saint-Emilion (which makes sense given its location), the 2018 Château La Dominique is a knockout winner in this great vintage and should be snatched up by readers. A blend of 85% Merlot, 12% Cabernet Franc, and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, it reveals a dense purple hue as well as gorgeous notes of crème de cassis, ripe black cherries, spring flowers, damp earth, and truffle. These carry to a full-bodied, sweetly fruited, sexy 2018 with incredible purity, a solid spine of acidity, ultra-fine tannins, and a great, great finish. It's already impossible to resist, yet it should evolve for 15-20 years with no issues. Bravo!"
96 pts, Jeb Dunnuck

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU LA SERRE 2017
tastingDescription:
"Juicy and compact, featuring plum and black currant fruit liberally lined with tobacco and mineral notes. Offers a persistent, silky finish. Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2021 through 2029."
91 Points, Wine Spectator

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU LA SERRE 2018
tastingDescription:
"This estate continues to produce a brilliant Saint-Emilion. The 2018 Château La Serre is based on 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc, all from the upper plateau and clay and limestone soils. Its saturated purple hue is followed by a ripe, polished, medium to full-bodied wine with beautiful cassis fruits, succulent aromas and flavors of tobacco, chocolate, and lead pencil, sweet tannins, and a great mix of elegance and richness. It's a beautiful wine that will evolve gracefully for 15-20 years."
94 pts, Jeb Dunnuck

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU LA TOUR FIGEAC 2018
nameSanitized: st emilion - chateau la tour figeac 2018
sort: ST EMILION - CHATEAU LA TOUR FIGEAC 2018
tastingDescription:
"Deep garnet-purple colored, the 2018 La Tour Figeac bursts from the glass with bold notes of baked blackberries, stewed plums and boysenberries, plus hints of tilled soil, pencil lead and spice cake. The medium to full-bodied palate delivers a thirst-quenching line of freshness with soft tannins and bags of black fruits, finishing with a peppery kick. Drink Date: 2022 - 2038."
91 pts, Wine Advocate

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU LE CARRE 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Le Carré offers palate staining intensity and tons of opulence. Inky dark fruit, chocolate, licorice, cloves and scorched earth power through as this large-scaled Saint-Émilion takes  over all the senses and demands attention. A shy wine it is not. Drinking Window: 2025 - 2033."
93 pts, Vinous

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU LE DOME 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Le Dome is composed of 80% Cabernet Franc and 20% Merlot. It slips sensuously from the glass with beguiling scents of blackberry pie, kirsch, blueberry preserves and plum pudding, plus suggestions of menthol, rose oil, pencil shavings and fragrant earth. The medium to full-bodied palate delivers fantastic energy and freshness, featuring loads of perfumed red and black fruit layers and a firm, very finely grained texture, finishing on a lingering mineral note. Stylistically, this is one of the most elegant vintages of Le Dome that I've tasted—and I love it! Drink Date: 2025 - 2050."
97+ pts, Wine Advocate
12 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU LES ASTERIES 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Les Asteries is composed of 83% Merlot and 17% Cabernet Franc and has a 3.65 pH. Deep garnet-purple colored, it has a bombastic nose of baked black cherries, stewed plums and mulberries, with suggestions of fragrant earth, spice box and unsmoked cigars. The full-bodied palate is rich, plush and jam-packed with juicy black fruits, finishing with lingering exotic spice notes. One for the hedonists! Drink Date: 2022 - 2042."
94+ pts, Wine Advocate
6 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU LES GRANDES MURAILLES 2017
nameSanitized: st emilion - chateau les grandes murailles 2017
sort: ST EMILION - CHATEAU LES GRANDES MURAILLES 2017
tastingDescription:
"Ripe and alluring, featuring crushed plum and blackberry preserve flavors enmeshed with anise, fruitcake and roasted apple wood notes. Shows good underlying structure but maintains a plush feel overall. Best from 2021 through 2032."
92 Points, Wine Spectator

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU MAZERAT 2018
tastingDescription:
"This vineyard is bordered by Château Canon on three sides and by Angélus on the fourth side. A blend of 65% Merlot and 35% Cabernet Franc, the deep garnet-purple colored 2018 Vieux Château Mazerat storms out of the glass with powerful black fruit notes of stewed plums, blackberry pie and boysenberries, giving way to wafts of underbrush, spice cake, kirsch and potpourri. The rich, full-bodied palate is jam-packed with black and red fruit preserves, framed by ripe, rounded tannins and plenty of freshness, finishing with loads of spicy sparks. Drink Date: 2023 - 2043."
94+ pts, Wine Advocate
12 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU PAVIE 2018
tastingDescription:
"One of the wines of the vintage is the 2018 Château Pavie, and Gérard Perse continues to produce one of the greatest wines in the world, in just about every vintage. Based on 60% Merlot, 22% Cabernet Franc and 18% Cabernet Sauvignon, the 2018 shows the slightly more restrained style of the estate today yet still brings classic Pavie richness, depth, and grandeur. Revealing a deep purple color as well as a sensational bouquet of crème de cassis, damp earth, tobacco, chalk, and lead pencil shavings, it hits the palate with full-bodied richness, incredible purity, a dense, concentrated mid-palate, and a liqueur of rocks-like sense of minerality on the blockbuster finish. This is another magical, probably immortal wine from this terroir that marries power with elegance perfectly."
100 pts, Jeb Dunnuck
1 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU QUINTUS ROUGE 2017
tastingDescription:
"The 2017 Quintus is super impressive today. Sweet floral and spice nuances give the 2017 its striking aromatic upper register. Rich and dense on the palate, Quintus is a bold, hedonistically opulent Saint-Emilion in 2017. Soaring Franc overtones play off the Merlot nicely, adding both aromatic presence and a real feeling of saline intensity that comes through, especially on the finish. Today, the 2017 is a touch exuberant - almost too much so. The 2017 is not at all subtle, but it has a lot to offer. Here, too, elevage has done wonders for the wine."
94 Points, Vinous
6 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU QUINTUS ROUGE 2018
tastingDescription:
"A wine with wonderful clarity of fruit and firm, creamy and polished tannins. So intense and powerful. Layers of fruit and tannins intertwined. Lovely blackberry, black cherry, cedar and sandalwood. Mushroom and bark undertones. One of the best from here. Try after 2027."
97 pts, James Suckling
6 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU ROLLAND MAILLET 2018
tastingDescription:
"Deep garnet-purple colored, the 2018 Rolland-Maillet gives up expressive scents of baked black cherries, raspberry preserves and warm plums hints plus baking spices and mossy bark. Full, rich, soft and fragrant in the mouth, it has just enough freshness and a perfumed finish."
89-91 pts, Wine Advocate

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU TEYSSIER 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Teyssier is composed of 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Franc. Medium to deep garnet-purple in color, it comes skipping out of the glass with bright, open, carefree scents of stewed red and black plums, Morello cherries and fruitcake, plus hints of Chinese five spice, bay leaves and dusty soil. Medium to full-bodied, the palate is coated with spicy red and black fruits, supported by chewy tannins and just enough freshness, finishing with an herbal lift. Drink Date: 2022 - 2030."
90 pts, Wine Advocate

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU TROPLONG MONDOT 2017
tastingDescription:
"Rich and ample, yet endowed with striking energy as well, the 2017 is the first vintage made by new CEO Aymeric de Gironde and consulting winemaker Thomas Duclos. The 2017 takes hold of all the senses and never lets up. All of the power that is typical of this site is evident, it seems to come so naturally, and yet picking earlier and then using a lighter hand in the cellar yielded a Troplong of uncommon energy and vibrancy. The 2017 has been nothing short of thrilling on the four occasions I have tasted it from bottle so far. What a wine! Drink: 2027 - 2047."
98+ Points, Vinous
4 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU TROPLONG MONDOT 2017
tastingDescription:

The 2017 takes hold of all the senses and never lets up. All of the power that is typical of this site is evident, it seems to come so naturally, and yet picking earlier and then using a lighter hand in the cellar yielded a Troplong of uncommon energy and vibrancy. name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU TROPLONG MONDOT 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Troplong Mondot is blended of 85% Merlot, 13% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Cabernet Franc, with 15% alcohol. Deep garnet-purple colored, with considerable coaxing and swirling it slowly emerges from the glass like a waking giant, building to a towering bouquet of preserved plums, blueberry pie and Morello cherries with gentler wafts of violets, star anise, fruitcake and cast-iron pan. The concentrated, full-bodied palate possesses impressive purity and brightness of fruit commingled with richer, riper elements and supported by firm, velvety tannins, finishing with lovely freshness and on a lingering ferrous note. It's a wine that's not just delicious, it's seriously interesting too. Drink Date: 2025 - 2050."
96 pts, Wine Advocate
12 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU TROTTE VIEILLE 2018
tastingDescription:
"Aromas of ripe berry, mushroom, ash and smoke follow through to a full body with a ripe, juicy center palate and lots of creamy tannins that are balanced and refined. Generous and very intense. Tight palate now. Give it time. Try after 2025."
98 pts, James Suckling
6 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CHATEAU TROTTEVIELLE 2010
tastingDescription: 93 Points, Wine Enthusiast: "An extracted wine, showing bitter chocolate as much as fruit. There is a core of dark tannins, very firm, with licorice, wood and a tight texture. Often Trottevieille shows this austerity when young, and this 2010 is no exception. It will develop slowly into a serious and concentrated wine." (May 2013)

name: ST EMILION - CLOS DE L'ORATOIRE 2018
tastingDescription:
The team of Stephan von Neipperg knocked it out of the park  in 2018, producing a brilliant lineup of wines. The 2018 Clos de L'Oratoire checks in as 85% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Franc that was brought up in 45% new French oak. Beautifully balanced, pure, elegant, and seamless, this incredibly classy Saint-Emilion is going to benefit from 4-5 years of bottle age (if not longer) and evolve for 30 years in cold cellars. It's certainly in the running for the finest vintage I've tasted."
95+ pts, Jeb Dunnuck

name: ST EMILION - CLOS FOURTET 2017
tastingDescription:
"The 2017 Clos Fourtet is vivid, rich and super-expressive. Beams of salinity give the 2017 its energy and shape. In the glass, the 2017 is wonderfully vivid and nuanced. Lavender, mint, blue fruits and blood orange all build into the beautifully layered, exquisite finish. In 2017, Clos Fourtet is all class. This is a terrific showing from the Cuvelier family. Drink: 2025 - 2047."
95 Points, Vinous
4 bottle limit

name: ST EMILION - CLOS FOURTET 2018
tastingDescription:
"The 2018 Clos Fourtet is one of the most elegant, refined wines of the vintage. Silky and aromatically expressive, Clos Fourtet is all grace. Blue/purplish fruit, lavender, spice, menthol and sage all lift from the glass. Even with all of the natural richness of the year, Clos Fourtet sizzles with tension and delineation. Then again, that is the magic of the Saint-Émilion plateau. Clos Fourtet is easy to look past in 2018. It is neither exuberant nor exotically ripe. Instead, everything is in reserve. The 2018 is a magical wine, that's all there is to it. Don't miss it. Drinking Window: 2028 - 2058."
98 pts, Vinous
6 bottle limit

tastingDescription:
